Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: gundogjh
Reviews.Content: Located on Kowloon and overlooking Hong Kong harbour, this hotel ticks all the boxes for location , friendly staff, high standards etc. Particularly impressive is the executive floor where you are served breakfast, evening cocktails and snacks whilst watching the spectacle of Hong Kong harbour and the passing ferries, junks and ships. Minutes from the ferry terminal, shopping and huge choice of restaurants make the location perfect. The staff were extremely friendly and activated the glass elevators at 5.00am (my wife can't use enclosed elevators) so we could leave for our early flight back to the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Location and price, that is ALL.”
Reviews.Author: cendut
Reviews.Content: I'm going to make this short and simple. You are paying close to 50% cheaper than any of the better 5 star hotels that are in the same location. In fact, the peninsula is just next door and the intercontinental is right in front of it. So it is insanely great value for money. And I need to remind you again, the location is AWESOME. Close to: star ferry pier, MRT, sogo supermarket and freshmart, intercontinental hotel that has NOBU, SPOON, and other nice restaurants, next door to peninsula's afternoon tea and felix bar, 5 minutes walk to harbour city mall, HK space museum (2 mins walk), HK museum of art, etc. The catch is... this is not a 5 star hotel to begin with. It is not even a decent 4 star hotel, and certainly loses to luxury boutique hotels. The room is so badly decorated, and the bed is harder than my kungfu practice mat. The bed is a brick, covered in sheet. The pillows are, of course, super soft. I had the worst sleep ever during my world travels on this bed. I stayed in a deluxe harbour view room. Room service is limited, service/courtesy is average, everything's so so. Location, and price.

Reviews.Title: “great location for Hong Kong stay”
Reviews.Author: ann marie k
Reviews.Content: Perfect location and wonderful harbour view from our room. Excellent breakfast! We dined in their Chinese restuarant one day for lunch...delicious! Rooms are small, as is bathroom, but the shower was great, and it was clean and had a great vew. I would defintely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Busy location, busy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frank C
Reviews.Content: I stay here for a few days every year. The first visit gave me a really good impression, which is why I continue to use it. From a single business traveller's point of view, it's fine. If you don't mind the presence of large groups of witless tourists staying there on cheap deals, then you'll be OK. The rooms are not huge but they work... however if you are travelling with many people and suitcases you will be crowded. For SPG members, there is a club lounge but it's a bit small and food is limited. For proper eating the main restaurant is good enough though, with a large buffet and well-prepared food (for a buffet). But this is Kowloon... why would you want to stay in the hotel to eat when there are so many restaurants outside, and across the water in HK? Talking of HK, the Star Ferry (preferred method of travel) still runs a service to the island, but if you prefer to use the metro Tsim Sha Tsui station is very close to the hotel. Octopus cards work on everything. To sum up the hotel... not the best, but perfectly serviceable. However if you don't like being surrounded by tourists and being pounced on by hawkers as soon as you step outside, then spend more and stay in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: wooski
Reviews.Content: Great location as everything you need to access is within walking distance. Hotel is on Nathan Rd where the golden mile of shops/stores are, subway is across the street or within 2 blocks depending on the direction you want to go, Harbour City Mall of 700 shops is a few blocks away, Art Gallery and Science Centre is across the street etc. etc. The cafe is OK as it is very busy. Most people have the breakfast buffet for 235 HK plus an automatic 10% service charge as we were told it would be over 30 mins to order from the menu. Service was OK but you have to beg for a coffee and even harder for a refill. Rooms were clean and the view was excellent. Nice comfortable bed and nice bathroom with excellent water pressure for the shower. We have a family of 5 so I needed to have 2 rooms. I was disappointed that they charged an extra 550 HK per nite for a cot in the second room for the 3 kids. It did not matter if you were a gold spg member or not. We were not charged for an extra bed in the Grand Hyatt on Hong Kong island or at the Peninsula in Beijing. I would rate the hotel higher if it was not for this.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: travelmypassion
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Hong Kong Hotel & Towers is a wonderful hotel at a reasonable price. The location, service, and price makes this the perfect choice in Kowloon. It is very close to the MTR subway station and the ferry. We took the ferry over to Lamma Island which was a fun day trip. The hotel service was incredible. We had a problem printing out our airline boarding pass and the staff called the airline for us and took care of the problem. The hotel room and hotel lobby is also very elegant. I highly recommend the Sheraton Hong Kong Hotel & Towers.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: heags
Reviews.Content: A great hotel. Fantastic location - close to MTR and Star Ferry services, as well as fantastic views of the harbour. Staff were friendly and very efficient. Great selection of restaurants and gym/pool area was modern and well-looked after. The bar and restaurant on the top floor are a great spot to base yourself for the nightly laserlight show.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DiscoE
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 days earlier this month. I chose the Sheraton because it is very conveniently located near a MTR station, as well as the ferry terminal. It is located in the heart of Tsimshatsui shopping and food district, so getting anything, any food, or anywhere isn't a problem. Overall, the stay was comfortable, and the staff was helpful. The room was big, and I did have a bit of a view of the harbour. But the best view is from the pool, located at the top floor of the hotel. The bed was also comfortable, which is very important for me. My only comment is that when I first checked in, despite being a Starwood Gold member, I was first given a less than ideal room which had a sliver of a window and was really really dark and gloomy. The receptionist told me beforehand that if I wasn't happy with the room she'd be happy to change it for me. And as it turned out, I wasn't happy with the room, and so I called the front desk and requested for a change. Which they did, to the better room with a view, where I stayed for the entire vacation. Question is - why make me go through that hassle when they could have given me the better room in the first place?

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location....”
Reviews.Author: Wont2Travel
Reviews.Content: An excellent property located in the heart of Kowloon ! We checked into a room overlooking Victoria Harbour on the "Reunification Day" and could see the flotilla of ships and other vessels right from our bedroom window ! The hotel itself is very conveniently located in Kowloon and close to certain major tourist attractions and lots of restaurants (including quite a few Michelin starred ones).

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Hot100
Reviews.Content: Was there last month for a 3 day stay. Location: Very good. TST MTR station, shops, eateries and shopping malls are within a minute walk from the hotel. Bus stop just outside the hotel. If you want to try the Airport Express train, about 20 minutes - HKD$90 use the Octopus Card, alight at Kowloon station and a short taxi ride - costs about HKD$40. Room: Good room size, abaout 30m2. Had the Deluxe courtyard room on level 8. Fab 40 inch LCD tv with good channel selections, super King bed with a 12 inch thick mattress - *Sweet Sleeper brand exclusively meant for Sheraton hotels with another 2 inch mattress protector!. IPOD dock next to bed and good selection of free tea/coffee. Chambermaids did a good job, on time, very efficient and good eye for details. Room package HKD$2100 per night came with daily breakfast for 2 and late checkout at 4pm. Wi-fi avail at an extra cost. However there are a few computers at the lobby - free use 24/7. Breakfast: Very good selection of international and local food items. Service delivered was pretty efficient but the staff lacked personal touch. They are just like robots. Only wanted to get their work done quickly. Overall experience: Very good.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: FionasGrandad
Reviews.Content: A good location in the Kowloon area with easy walk to both MRT and Star ferry. Towers room nicely laid out and functional with comfortable king bed. Enjoyed the facilities in the Towers lounge which offer tea/coffee 24/7 and afternoon tea plus canapés and cocktails in the evening. Staff always friendly and attentive. On departure bags collected and held until departure (9pm) safely and doorman made special attention to ensuring the car to collect me was identified,

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JWCornwell
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location on the Kowloon side. There is plenty of sightseeing and shopping to be done there. The rooms are very tastefully done. Just remember to go to the second floor for check in and registration. The room that I was in was somewhat small for the price paid. Had a full sized bed and not much room otherwise. TV selection was good, but that is not what you are there for.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing...Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Sanjay B
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Towers Deluxe Harbor View room for 3 nights from 15th to 18th August. The location of the hotel is perfect and view of the Harbor was amazing day & night. Breakfast at Oyster & Wine Bar (for Tower rooms - 16th & 17th Floor) was fresh and excellent with view of the Victoria harbor. The Towers lounge is open all day for tea/ coffee/ soft drinks and above all the open bar in the evening with cocktails and snacks ..... all with view of the picturesque harbor, you could not ask for anything more. The staff are friendly helpful and courteous. I would rate the Towers Deluxe Harbor View room at Sheraton the BEST in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: tonypires76
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights on a business trip and enjoyed all the facilities. The bed was not I expected from a Starwood chain hotel (quite hard) but it was comfortable nonetheless. Restaurant gets very busy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: lcpteck
Reviews.Content: I just had a 2 night stay over the weekend on the "economy single promo" for solo travelers (single bed) since this had the most value for me. The room I was in (1507) had a view facing the inwards of the hotel so nothing much to see. The rate had a room with "limited view", now I know what that meant. It was modern and well maintained and the size of the room and bathroom is quite adequate for a solo traveler. It also have ipod speakers which I made full use of. I went to the skylounge on the 18th floor every night just to sit and relax looking over the Harbour. There seems to be lots of Japanese and mainland chinese travelers staying at the hotel and throughout Hong Kong for that matter... Location is definitely 5 stars as it's linked (underground via the shopping area) to the Tsim Sha Tsui subway station. Hotel is practically right on Nathan road so it's great if you look to walk alot towards the various places in Kowloon. This was my first time in the Sheraton Hong Kong, service was great and every staff I met was helpful and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HarbourviewSydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed in tower room 1716 with floor to ceiling windows offering best views. Room immaculate and well appointed. Staff efficient friendly and always smiling went out of their way to assist. Generous and appetising buffet breakfast . Hotel cafe also of excellent standard.. Walk out the hotel door onto Nathan Road at the most convenient spot in HK despite claims of more recently constructed hotels. I took advantage of discounts for early booking. Tower block well worth the premium on other rooms. Airline misplaced my bags on arrival. Hotel staff monitored recovery and kept me posted. Rooftop pool a welcome relief after day out in sun. Overall most impressed with hotel and management and will recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but pricey!!!”
Reviews.Author: kunal16
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here!! Hotel was nice. Rooms are a little small but well done up. The hotel is more of a business hotel as opposed to one for a holiday. Had the chance to use the rooftop pool ad jacuzzi (they have three large ones outside) as well as the health club. Well looked after! Hotel staff are very helpful and friendly and the concierge was great in assisting u to book excursions. The Sky lounge (which is on the 21st floor i think) had beautiful views of Hongkong and its definately worth visiting for a drink and a quick bite! However the extras in the hotel were a little pricey. We were on a bed only rate and hotel breakfasts were in the range of US$ 55 per head!! Nonetheless i would definately stay back at this property again!!

Reviews.Title: “City lights at their best.”
Reviews.Author: LVJS
Reviews.Content: A brilliant location, on the water's edge with THE BEST view of the Hong Kong skyline. Close to shops and ferry terminal. Standard rooms improved by the brilliant staff. Spotlessly clean and well maintained. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great views of the harbour.”
Reviews.Author: pbjap
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a few days stopover in Hong Kong. We arrived and we had a warm greeting by reception staff. Our room was on the 15th floor looking out over the harbour. The room was small but comfortable with the usual gadgets in this type of hotel. The breakfast buffet was enormous but all freshly prepped and plenty of staff to keep the food coming. The location of the hotel was ideal, at the end of Nathan Road and beside the Penninsula Hotel. Plenty of things to do within the hotel itself, like the swimming pool and air on gym, as well as the restaurants around the building. We checked out the Oyster bar on our last night of our holiday with a few cocktails added into the mix at reasonable prices. The downside of our stay was that we felt that the room was not being cleaned to a great standard. On the surface it looked in order but we found something just under the edge of the bed that remained untouched or vacumned for the three nights that we stayed. All in all we enjoyed our stay at The Sheraton and would return if we ever came back to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome views from the Sky Bar”
Reviews.Author: HighHeidjin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights on the first leg of a trip to the Far East and were not disappointed. We decided to upgrade and use the club lounge facilities which was good value for money. June definitely not the best month to travel here as it rained on and off throughout, but that didn't detract from our enjoyment. The staff were also very friendly and helpful, whether we were in the bar, restaurant or other areas of the hotel. Great views of the nighlty laser light show from the Sky Bar (8.00pm). In our opinion, the hotel could do with a bit a of a makeover, but overall, we had a terrific stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: seasaw45rg
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Australioa via Hong Kong and this Hotel gave us a good rest and first class facilities.The rooms are quiet and the restaurant is excellent. All the staff were most helpful in planning our sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and great location.”
Reviews.Author: supergirl
Reviews.Content: I arrived quite early to the hotel and had told the desk person that I had just registered for the points so she "upgraded" me from the 10th to the top floor (17th) even though it was a few hours before check in. So...register for the points. You will get a better room if you ask for it. The staff was lovely and very helpful. The breakfast had everything you could imagine. Tip from my co-workers - have them make you your coffee special if you can, don't just get the little coin put on your table that says "coffee" - have them make an espresso or latte for you. I'm more of a tea drinker and I thought the black tea was great. The room safe is big enough for lots of stuff (a big deal to me). The bed is amazing! Again, very important to me. Getting from the airport to the hotel, there is a service desk area at the airport that has shuttle bus service - cheaper than a taxi so try to find that shuttle desk area. The one thing I was not prepared for was the rooftop pool noise. The pool is great. However, next door they have an ongoing helicopter drop off or tour which is a little strange - but it only lasts a minute.

Reviews.Title: “A good Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: RSL72
Reviews.Content: I stay in a lot of Starwood Hotels and am often disappointed with the Sheraton branded hotels. This one was however an exception.I was visiting for a friends wedding and they too had booked a few rooms there. The staff were courteous, helpful and friendly. The hotel was a little confusing at first but I soon realised it's location was a benefit and the shopping links were very useful. Rooms were small although that is normal for Hong Kong of course but I didn't feel too crammed and there was enough good air for a good nights sleep! The food was of moderate quality but again, being HK, there is no shortage of good places to eat so I wasn't too concerned about that. I would recommend the hotel for families too - I saw several families who said that they were having a good time and also for business - convenient and good services.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok”
Reviews.Author: Kevin C
Reviews.Content: We had wedding ceremony and banquet in May 2012 so we had booked 4 rooms for 2 nights. The breakfast was great plus the variety of menu they have was very good, however, they forgot to deliver our orange juice and then they charged our room extra for it. neglect. The bill was full of items that we didn't used and we had to double check when check out. The room is quite comfortable but it's over priced with and service there needs alot of improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently Located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: R L
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from 3-5 May 2012 using my Priority Club points. I booked the coach from the airport which was really convenient. There is a desk for the hotel just outside arrival. Someone will take you to wait for the coach (not specifically just for Sheraton guests). After dropping everyone else off to other hotels, I was impressed as soon as I got to my hotel. Checking in was a breeze. I was greeted as a Platinum member and was upgraded to a harbour view room. When I got to my room, I was most impressed with the size of the room, and most spectacularly the view! My room had ceiling to floor windows and I can literally see Victoria Harbour from my bed! The bed is very comfortable, there is a desk, with free wifi, bathroom is nice and big with shower and bath and I especially like the glass sink. Breakfast was good with lots of western and eastern varities. As it's a very big hotel, the breakfast room was quite big. The best thing about the hotel is the location. It's located on Nathan Road and very good for shopping. There are plenty of shops nearby don't close till very late and there are a few big departmental stores nearby too. Lots of Indian tailors and shopkeers here trying to get you into their shops but just keep walking and ignore them. There are plenty of places to eat and do around here too. Despite this, you can' hear the noise at all inside the hotel. Located on the Kowloon side and near the harbour so you can get the boat if you want to go to Hong Kong Island. Its also located opposite of Avenue of the Stars. If not then there is the MRT station within 2 mins walk from the hotel. I think it's called East Tsim Sha Tsui (TST) or across he road you have the TST station. Overall I am impressed with the hotel, services and facitlites. Will definately stay here again if I ever come back to HK

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for westerners”
Reviews.Author: RBHankes
Reviews.Content: The location is primo, Kowloon side is easy and convenient. Wonderful restaurants and shops densely packed for many blocks around the hotel. It's a convenient $13US for a taxi to Wan Chai and even more nightlife. The rooms are the best rooms of any hotel I stay in and I stay all over the world. The concierge will hook you up with anything, just ask.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view”
Reviews.Author: Drewstar85
Reviews.Content: Perfect location on Nathan Rd in the heart of the city. Stayed in Harbour View Room which on a clear day was breathtaking. Couldn't complain about room. Comfy bed, clean, nice bathroom, but the room itself wasn't overly impressive. The Sky Lounge bar upstairs was a great place to view the Light Show, the staff here were extremely attentive and even remembered my drink of choice from the previous night. Champagne cocktails were delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Old rooms, robotic staff, bad attitude”
Reviews.Author: enjoytravel5
Reviews.Content: Because of the location this hotel is very busy quite pricy and obviously doing good business, however the staff seem to have forgotten "hospitality" being a key word. The F&B staff int the restaurants don't care about service, my young daughter wanted to order from childrens menu but since my wife and I were not eating we were refused a table saying sorry we are full. Although the restaurant was more than half empty. Room service staff was polite and so were the doormen but that's where it ends. No farewell no welcome. Rooms are old and desperately need renovation as are the washrooms. Mouldy smell on all guest corridors. Food is extremely overpriced 35 USD for a burger almost 20 USD for a dessert, dinner buffet in the cafe USD 65 on weekends. If you charge those prices make sure to have the service that goes with it. Next time it will be somewhere else for me an my family. Also hotel management if you upsell someone to a suite don't be cheap add the perks that go with a suite not just a free newspaper.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl1961
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton in June 2012 and did a great deal of research into hotel options as we were a group of 10. Adults with children aged 10 to 13 years and an 18 year old. The hotel is in a fabulous position, within walking distance to the Star Ferry and only a few minutes walk to Tsim Sha Tsui station. Walk to the shopping on Nathan Road, Harbour City and with a Sogo department store literally over the road. We opted for Harbour View rooms and the views were breathtaking. Rooms are compact (but probably larger than most in Hong Kong), clean and comfortable with every facility you could need. All the staff we dealt with were welcoming, friendly and helpful. If travelling with kids, the pool area is an advantage for an afternoon spent relaxing. It is a good sized pool area for a city hotel. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love HongKong”
Reviews.Author: Mat B
Reviews.Content: This was one of our first stops on our honeymoon for three nights. And i must say we loved HongKong, so much to do and see wish we had stopped longer. The hotel has a great location, rooms were clean and well presented. we had the Harbour view room well worth the extra expense. The pool on top has great views of the HK skyline and a good spot to watch the light show. The staff were polite and helpful and the breakfast buffet was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Business and Visiting”
Reviews.Author: John T
Reviews.Content: One of the best locations in the city for views of HK, access to Kowloon, Star Ferry and China Ferry Port if you are travelling up the Pearl to other cities. Hotel staff was excellent, I am travelling with my son for his first visit to China and our Tower Harbour View with twins was not ready as we arrived for an early 1:15 check in.; Without hesitation, we were offered a two room tower harbour view suite and asked if this was acceptable...thank you for early check in and thank you for upgrade after night flight from America. Lounge was excellent and great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, busy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Littlewormmy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights on our recent family trip, great location and convenient especially if you are visiting the Arena of Star for the first time. The hotel is close to malls and MTR as Sogo is just across the road. Staffs are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but they refurbish the room and got some extra space here and there. Like the way they did the basin area with the see thru compartment. Overall the room is very well maintain and clean. We had a great stay :-)

Reviews.Title: “Worth staying just for the Harbour view”
Reviews.Author: savethetigerkol
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night on a business trip to Hongkong . The location is great and if you are able to stay in the Tower Room annexe you get a fantastic view of the Hongkong Harbour . Yes it is on the expensive side but the service is fabulous and you get a feeling of being taken care of . Did not have a chance to have a major meal at any of the restuarents as the trip was quite hectic - definitely recommended for budsiness travellers . For people on a vacation try to book for the Early Bird Discounts and try to squeeze in a week end for the best rates .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, OK room”
Reviews.Author: Purplepanda17
Reviews.Content: As with all hotels in Hong Kong the standard rooms at the Sheraton are small and expensive relative to the rest of Asia. The Sheraton is in a great location however, walking distance to many attractions and some great restaurants. The staff were helpful, we didn't eat at the hotel as it was expensive relative to other options around the area. Overall a pretty good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Quick trip to HK”
Reviews.Author: ShieldFamily
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel , bit on the expensive side but you pay for what you get ,first class hotel wih excellent friendly service. Easy to get. He other side of he Island using the ferry or the MTR.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent bed, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: LinoMacau
Reviews.Content: The rooms can be small to very small for a Sheraton. But you have to understand that you're in HK. Check-in and check-out can be a burden due to their target market cramping down the lobby and not understanding how to cue up. But the staff at the front desk makes it up to the annoyance with a very good service always with a smile. The huge plus is getting to bed. The mattress is fantastic and gigantic super king. It got me so well that I forgot to check the brand. Same goes for pillows and pillow menu. If you're looking for a comfy hotel to sleep and be walking distance to everything, this is a good pick. Other services like breakfast and room service can be left aside. You're not missing out on anything.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here and got a terrible rash”
Reviews.Author: Blake E
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for nearly a week and in the first room they put me in I woke up with a terrible rash and/or bites all over the side of my body (see photo). A doctor was called who said that it may be bedbugs or it may not - he couldn't say either way. When I learned that I got rid of most of my belongings before leaving the hotel. Unfortunately, management has declined to reimburse me for the loss of my property. All around, TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE. DO NOT STAY HERE. Do yourself a favor and take a look at my picture before you book here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fabulous Room”
Reviews.Author: TaiTai5
Reviews.Content: We booked into an East View Harbour suite which enable us to have our two children in the room with us. The room was so much more than we expected. We had a complete spacious living area, bedroom, walk in robe and bathroom with separate shower and toilet areas. The room also had a wonderful view of the harbour. The hotel is perfectly located, an easy walk to the waterfront, star ferry and large shopping malls. It is also close to an MTR station from where you can quickly get anywhere in Hong Kong, about 35 minutes to Disneyland. This is a large hotel and was very busy when we stayed there, but the breakfast buffet was managed very efficiently with minimal to no wait time. The gym is well stocked with equipment and offers views of the harbour. The bar on the 18th floor was a little pricey but service was excellent and the ability to order delicious Dim Sum (Western and Eastern Styled) was great. That combined with the view over Hong Kong makes the price worthwhile, and a must do if you stay here. Afternoon Tea in the hotel cafe was a pleasant surprise and quite affordable. Only area where the hotel could improve is a larger area in the lobby for drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Overall does well”
Reviews.Author: CCbostonma
Reviews.Content: My second time there. The lobby is certainly an upgrade from the US Sheraton "look". The rooms - at least mine - was recently renovated and very comfortable. Had a small suite - thanks! Large bathroom, with a fun tub/shower room. The only off notes were the musty smells in the hallway from our room to the elevators. And the bed was good but not the plush pillow top luxury I've found in other Starwood properties. And while the breakfast buffet is amazing with a wide variety - the room is crowded and a bit hectic. With mediocre coffee... Recommendation - We totally enjoyed watching the Light show (starting 8pm) from the Wine bar - which had one of the best prawn dishes I've ever had anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Extra service”
Reviews.Author: GWTsingapore
Reviews.Content: I am a very frequent traveller and stay Starwood around the world... The service that I receive and continue to receive year on year should be commended.. They run a very efficient clean and 5 star hotel... Special mention to the towers team and the extra mile they go to make my stay that much easier...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: aqillah i
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my family, hotel is located in the centre of the city (Kowloon area), CLOSE TO MRT STATION and you can go anywhere by only using MRT. Just asked the concierge team where do you want to go, they will tell u exactly how to get there with 2-3 options. Breakfast experience is average, bit advise to management that they have some market from middle east so please make sure the menu tag and the staff is aware what they are not allowed to eat (moslem). Overall was great place to stay for me and my family.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and great view + excellent service”
Reviews.Author: YSL999
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides good HK harbour view if you stay at their Harbour View rooms and as its on the Kowloon island, its price is much cheaper than other hotels along the HK island. In addition, its next to MRT exit and very near to the Space Museum + other great shopping street around the TST area. Service by its staff is great and it also has one of the best Chinese dimsum restaurant in Hong Kong. In addition, the pub on the 17 floor also gives you a nice view of HK harbour view + it also serves pretty good fingers food !!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth Staying For The View!”
Reviews.Author: michie011
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here in May, and it was just magnificent. We had a harbour view suite, which was great, big bedroom with large tv, separate sofa, a living area, and an office. Every staff member we saw asked us if there was anything we needed, and they were very friendly and helpful. We requested a late checkout as our flight did not leave until the evening, and were given a 3pm checkout at no charge. We had drinks in the Sky Lounge and watched the light show......beautiful! The hotel is very central, and it is not far to the Star Ferry terminal, and the MTR. Being in Nathan Road is a shopping paradise! I would happily stay here again, as the service we got was second to none.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Elliot16
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton in Hong Kong is at the base of Nathan Road (the busy tourist street) and faces the harbor. The rooms are superb, prices typically high in Hong Kong. But if you are going there the Sheraton offers great views, a cigar bar for those interested, wonderful breakfast and, overall, a very friendly and comfortable experience. It's worth paying for Harbor Views and even tower rooms who have breakfast included, cocktail hour with hors d'oevres and a pretty full bar, all included.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny standard rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelsalot6875
Reviews.Content: If you book a triple,insist upon a larger than standard room. Thie first night the three of us were squeezed into a standard with a king size bed and a rollaway. The addition of the rollaway left us feeling claustrophobic. There was no space for our luggage, and movement within the room was extremely limited. We suspect that the arrangement did not meet fire-code requirements. Fortunately the tour company was able to move us to a larger room with a gorgeous harbor view for the second night. We were paying a triple rate through Uniworld Tours and therefore should have been placed in a larger room at the beginning of our stay. We place most of the blame on Uniworld and AAA travel agent. Our travel agent led us to believe that triple accommodations meant that we would be place in a larger than standard room with a rollaway. The breakfast buffet was mediocre at best.

Reviews.Title: “Best location/Value”
Reviews.Author: coffeebean22
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there three times in the last 5 years and have never been disappointed. The staff is so friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and comfortable. You cannot beat the location. I have tried all the restaurants in the hotel, all very good but the Japanese restaurant is very expensive. We had a party of 8 and the bill was high., and my husband and son went out for noodles at a local fast food stand an hour after dinner. Very small portions in the Japanese restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “in the center of city”
Reviews.Author: sps100
Reviews.Content: you are right in the center of the activity. very close to the markets and the MTR so easy connectivity bf is lavish the rooms are reasonable is a good business hotel .but businessmen have to a little care full with the wake up call on one occasion it failed me.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Chinababe08
Reviews.Content: I stayed unexpectedly at the Sheraton when the nearby hotel I had booked proved to be too noisy for sleep, as I was in HK for 5 nights I didn't wan to go through that expereince again. The reception was courteous and overall my stay was as you'd expect, excellent responsive service, comfortable and nicely-appointed rooms and a good location near subway and shops. My only caveat is that on this occasion my room was tiny, this was because the hotel was apparently full when I turned up but there was no seeming attempt it seemed to upgarde me when a larger (normal-sized room) became available, plus I didn't appear to have much recognition of my SPG Gold status. However the manager has since contacted me to correct this, so I will remain a loyal customer.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible harbour view, huge room”
Reviews.Author: Amy B
Reviews.Content: The view of the harbour is absolutely breathtaking. Every night we were able to watch the laser show in the harbour, and had a much better vantage point from our room than those fighting for a viewing point outside. It literally looks like the skyline of Manhattan, multiplied by 10. We fell asleep each night with our curtains open to soak up the incredible view. Also, the size of the room was huge compared to others in Europe and Asia. Very updated room, very modern bathrooms. Perfect location-Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: J H
Reviews.Content: Located directly across the street from the Penninsula hotel, the Sheraton Hong Kong Hotel & Towers is a great location on the Kowloon side of Hong Kong and within easy walking distance to the Tsim Tsa Chui MTR. Overall this property is a good choice in Hong Kong, I stayed there because I got it free with SPG points, but there are other hotels that can be had for cheaper with about the same offerings. The rooms are a bit small and felt dated, but this seems to be normal for Hong Kong hotels. Compared to some other properties I've stayed at in Hong Kong, the room was of average size. Service was pleasant and helpful. Most of the time I stay in Hong Kong over night and just need a hotel room to crash in, it was a nice experience compared to some of the other cheaper hotels but then again for me I don't really need the 5 star experience in Hong Kong. I guess if you feel comfortable with the brand and want a good location, you won't be disappointed. Just don't expect a deal. I'm glad I scored it with SPG points, it felt like a nice splurge that didn't require any cash.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view”
Reviews.Author: love_2_travel666
Reviews.Content: This hotel was picked by me although as part of a trip organised by Thomas Cook. Staying once before in Hong Kong many years ago we saw this hotel, its right next door to the Peninsula, but a fraction of their costs. We had requested a high floor and a harbour view room, and that’s exactly what we got! A large corner room, windows on both sides, the first thing that strikes you when you enter the room is the spectacular view; it’s definitely worth paying the little extra for the room. If you can’t then the roof top pool will give you the same views. You can see right across to Hong Kong Island and the wonderfully lit up buildings at night. There is a small amount of traffic noise even on the 12th floor but not too much. A large glass top desk sits in one corner, a comfy armchair and glass coffee table in the other. Flat screen TV, mini bar and tea coffee making facilities fit into a unit. The wardrobe is large with deep drawers and plenty of hangars. The bathroom is a good size, with a walk in shower and large bath, a glass wall is between it and the bedroom, giving you the views whilst washing. A lovely glass washbasin adds the finishing touches. The bar in the ground floor has a good selection of drinks on offer, a good selection of restaurants and shops are also within the hotel. The cafe for breakfast is very busy at all times so if you have to be out early get up very early as you may still have to queue. The food on offer is very substantial, tea and coffee is brought to you, everything else is self serve, we were spoilt for choice from fresh fruit and yoghurt to the usual cooked breakfast items, both Chinese and European tastes catered for. The pool is a bit small, especially when you have Olympic hopefuls trying out their strokes! There are sun beds and a lifeguard who hands out towels and picks up those left by people who can’t be bothered to put their dirty towels in the wet towel bins. Complimentary water is also on hand. You are very close to the Star Ferry terminal and over the road from the Space Museum and the Museum of Art. Although there is some building work on-going on the waterfront, it is very well hidden from view. A wonderful hotel in a prime location, Nathan Road is a busy as ever, so well worth thinking about booking, we would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Big and Busy”
Reviews.Author: goodnamesaretaken
Reviews.Content: Before I left the Westin Shanghai, the concierge had called this hotel and asked they meet me with a car at the airport. My plane arrived in Hong Kong 8 hours late around 3 in the morning and I wondered if the hotel would follow through. The gentleman was standing at Arrivals with my name on a placard and the ride over to the Kowloon side was quick at that time of day. Although I had reserved in advance a king bed, the only room left was a twin - however it was very clean, modern and quiet and had a nice view of the harbor. The desk clerk apologized but said they were completely full. Location is excellent. 3 to 4 blocks to the ferry to go across to Hong Kong Island. In heart of Kowloon shopping and night markets. I only had a day here and did the Big Red Bus tour of Hong Kong Island, did Stanley market and night ride under the the classic Chinese signs lit up at night. This hotel struck me as incredibly busy with a multitude of languages being spoken with the staff taking it all in as a matter of course.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Clean”
Reviews.Author: A36127
Reviews.Content: I wish that there was a way to provide 3.5 stars. This hotel has some great features. I'm not sure I would normally give 4 stars as the overall rating ("very good"), but it definitely needs to be rated above "average". So, the real positives of the hotel is that it's clean and the A/C works very, very well. It was situated in the heart of the city and close to the main ferry terminal. It has shoppig on all sides and has a subway stop literally out the doorway. So, it's very easy to get to where you need to be by jumping on the Metro and going fo a ride. An added benefit is the Lobby is massive and has great seating areas for waiting for airport transportation, meeting clients, grabbing a drink, etc., etc. It's beautiful and massive. Also it has a terriffic breakfast area/restaurant. it's loaded with options and I would strongly recommend it as a good place to go for getting tanked up in the morning before you have to leave for the day of shopping/work/meetings/etc. The internet service is good and the wi-fi is fast. For a frequent traveler, I would say that this is an added plus and is much appreciated. Unfortunately, one the negative side, I would say that the rooms are very small. I recently stayed at another hotel in the are and i had a massive room (not an upgrade)...just a room that had a good amount of space, but that hotel is bit far away from the location, so it has it's own drawbacks as well. So, if you are looking for a centrally located hotel and are traveling on your own (or, with just one other person), then this is a good option. However, if you are looking for a room with a bit more space, then you may want to opt with a newer property as the Sheraton has been there for awhile. Nonetheless, it's well maintained and the decor is updated and nice. The staff & Concierge's desk were great....very helpful & quick to provide assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very good service”
Reviews.Author: kitrobinson
Reviews.Content: We had 10 nights at the Sheraton Hong Kong in June, and were very impressed with the quality of service and the facilities available. While, as one of the other revireers has mentioned, the building is rather dated, our room was great - we had a very good view over the harbour, our room on the 11th floor was well prepared, the bathroom functioned very well, and we were very well insulated from noise in and outside the hotel (Nathan Road seems to never stop when you're outside). You can't beat the location, at the start of Nathan Road, close to the TST and TSt East MTR stations and the Star Ferry, and with a great array of very good restaurants nearby. Free wifi, but only in the hotel lobby (in room it's $HKG 115 per day). Drinks at nght in the Sky Lounge (17th Floor) are a must, wonderful view over the harbour lights (be sure to be there at least once between 8 and 8:30 pm for the laser light show over the Central skyline), staff very attentive and a really good late night dim sum menu. The hotel's concierges are a fantastic source of information about good places to eat. If nothing else, go with their recommendation to have dim sum late morning at the Serenade restaurant nearby in the museum complex. Not the newest hotel in Hong Kong by a long way, but a very good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: sophie s
Reviews.Content: Overall, it was just ok - I would not stay here again, as better value can be found for the price we paid. We stayed in a Harbour View Suite on the 15th floor of the hotel, which had a reasonable view of the harbour; however you cannot see the famous 8pm harbour "light show" from this room. We stayed on a supposedly non-smoking floor, however the hotel allowed a guest to smoke repeatedly both in the common corridor, and their room for 3 out of the 6 nights we stayed. Our room stunk of cigarette smoke as it filtered under the door of the suite and through the air conditioning vents. Despite pointing this out to staff at both the checkin and concierge desks, they did not bother to force the smoking guest onto a smoking floor or take any appropriate action. We received no apology, and they did not offer to move us to another room/floor. We received our complimentary newspaper in the morning for only 3 out of our 6 day stay. Disappointing that they allowed other guests to steal the paper, or simply did not bother to ensure we received our paper. We had a limousine transfer service from the airport to hotel and return - they were able to fit 3 suitcases into the boot of the car from the airport to the hotel; however they were inexplicably unable to fit the same suitcases into the back of the car from the hotel back to the airport. These were hard shell suitcases, so they could not "expand" or get any larger on the way back. They decided to shove one suitcase into a back passenger seat, and I had an uncomfortable ride the whole way back to the airport - crammed into the back seat with another passenger. Uncomfortable and extremely disappointing. The room was very cold most of the time, and the temperature could not be moved any higher than 24 degrees. The suite was extremely large for hong kong standards, well appointed, nicely decorated and was very clean. Room service on our first night was disappointing, with not all of the "24 hour" menu available when we ordered. The staff were all friendly, polite and attentive. The breakfast buffet at the Cafe was a highlight of our stay. However, allowing a guest to repeatedly smoke for over 3 days on a non-smoking floor is completely unacceptable. There were just too many failures during our stay to give this hotel a good rating or recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but dated”
Reviews.Author: jinphil_cho
Reviews.Content: I needed to stay at a SPG hotel for one night in Hong Kong (even if I live in Hong Kong) so a Single room at the Sheraton fit the bill best for price and convenience. I stayed here a long time ago and I've stayed at numerous hotels in Hong Kong over the years so I had a pretty wide array of experiences to compare my stay to. When I first checked in it was very apparent that the hotel was busy that night and I ended up being stuck with my original booking of a Single room. The room was very small with just about enough room for a bed, side table, desk and an old tube TV. The bathroom was also very small, but felt a little less dated than the rest of the room. I was very disappointed because while I didn't expect very much from a Single room, the Sheraton is by no means a cheap hotel. I don't think they should even offer Single rooms if they're of such poor quality. I had a comfortable enough night in my room but I can't say too else positive about the room. The best part about this hotel is the location. It's located right above Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station and across from the Peninsula hotel in the heart of TST. Almost all the important areas in Hong Kong are easily accessible from the hotel's location.The service from all the staff I encountered was very good, which somewhat made up for my disappointment. Overall, I probably wouldn't recommend this hotel, especially with the excellent and nearby W not much more expensive and so many other options both in TST and the rest of Hong Kong. I have heard good things about the Towers rooms and I may yet try one in the future but I still think there are many better hotels in this price range in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Business Hotel with small rooms”
Reviews.Author: shikhasf
Reviews.Content: We're SPG Gold members and stayed here in their Club rooms for 3 nights. Our check-in was average. Nothing special to remember. As someone mentioned earlier, unlike other SPG properties in Asia, they don't "upgrade" you even if you're a Gold member. Our room was quite small but had a lovely view of the Hong Kong skyline. The breakfast was a very typical Sheraton American buffet breakfast. Lots of variety with a live egg station. Everyone around us seemed to be on some sort of a business meeting and it seemed like it really caters only to the business crowd. Since, we were taking a vacation, we left "guilty" of not working! :) If you're on a honeymoon or a romantic vacation, I would not recommend living here. The Club Lounge was okay. Nothing to rave about. The lounge itself was quite small and used to get full very quickly. We saw a few people leave because they couldn't get a table. We were never able to get a table by the window as someone was always there. Again, 4 out of 5 tables had either a laptop on or was a business meeting. Overall, an OK hotel. I'm sure there are better options out there at a much better price.

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice”
Reviews.Author: ben-3eed
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 nights in a suite overlooking the Victoria Harbour. the suite is large and spacious and beautiful. check in and check out does not take a long time. Breakfast is very beautiful . Location of the hotel is very excellent. but when I asked to join the lounge because I booked a suite. They told me that the lounge is only for SPG gold members.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect night - Symphony of Lights show & dim sum!”
Reviews.Author: Cattipoops
Reviews.Content: The bar here is superb. We came on Valentine's weekend to have some drinks whilst watching the Symphony of Lights show and couldn't have chosen a better spot! We had some champagne and enjoyed the environment and service so much we ate here too. The choice of Dim Sum is great, we loved our meal. This is one of my favourite memories in HK. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: mini_girlSH
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 nights over the weekend. The location is good, and the view is excellent. The hotel staff are very helpful. I will definitely stay there again for next time.

Reviews.Title: “A must if you would like a little pampering”
Reviews.Author: Austin L
Reviews.Content: The first thing you must check out is the rooftop pool and especially at night. The view from the pool is amazing during the day and it gets even better at night. The service as with most Sheraton's is fantastic, but if you have any work to do they are such a big help. I was in a rush the morning of my checkout and had to have an email printed signed and Fed Ex'd back to the states. All I had to do was email the document to the business center, they brought it for me to sign then filled out all the paperwork and sent it for me! The Subway is fantastic in Hong Kong and one major lines is across the street right in front of the hotel. You are perfectly positioned to go anywhere in the city quickly. The price has gone up a bit from three years ago, and the goes for all of Hong Kong due to all of the rich mainland Chinese coming into the city to shop, but is still not outrageous if you are familiar with this class of Hotel just look out on the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “a little small”
Reviews.Author: haroldHood
Reviews.Content: The rooms in Hong Kong are a lot like Paris, nice but small. I stayed there on my birthday and got upgraded to a Harbor View, which was very nice, especially at night when the buildings are all lit up

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneLynn
Reviews.Content: We arrived a day late due to missing our flight and the staff were very apologetic that we had to pay for the room for the previous night, we expected to as it was our fault but we were made to feel that nothing was amiss. Our room was overlooking the harbour and was cleaned once we turned on the green light for the maids to enter. We were given fresh bottled water daily, chocolates when the beds were turned down and our ice bucket was filled every evening. The half glass wall of the bathroom was a bit daunting until we realized there was a blind you coild lower for privacy. Best shower we have ever had and plenty of towels etc. Absolutely loved it. Would go back in a heartbeat and also reccomend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great position”
Reviews.Author: Carrie L
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Kowloon must be at least 25 years old, going on the architecture and decor, but it's still a great place to stay in Hong Kong. We were 2 adults and a child-out of the many hotels we tried, only the Sheraton would allow 3 in a room. We spoilt ourselves with a Harbour view room and it was worth it. The buffet breakfast had it all! Also, watching the light display from the 17th floor was great for us all. Only complaint was the room-slightly poky-oh well!

Reviews.Title: “Great View From The Towers”
Reviews.Author: Scott C
Reviews.Content: My in-laws were visiting Hong Kong and I wanted to show them a nice time, so we booked two Harbour View Suites in The Towers. The rooms were excellent and the view was even better. The complimentery breakfast offered to The Towers guests was perhaps the best I've ever had, both for the quality of the food and the view of Victoria Harbour and Hong Kong. Relaxing by the pool on the roof and in the whirlpools was an excellent contrast to the activities so easily available nearby. I will stay there again as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: Clare R
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband & daughter for 4 nights and couldnt have hoped for more. Wonderful harbour views, service from everyone with a smile & the best buffet breakfast I have ever experienced. Almost a perfect score except squeezing in a rollaway bed made the room feel pretty squished. I think the cut off for children eating as adults (as of 12) at breakfast is a little rigid though. Cant wait to come back again though, love the hotel & the city. Super clean, super efficient & super friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Grate Hotel, Grate Location.”
Reviews.Author: NEDHK
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Hotel Hong Kong is a fantastic hotel. Stayed here a week while my apartment were fixed up after a water leakage. Room, grate and for HK standards, big. Well equipped with coffee makers, mini bar, TV with all channels needed, Wi-Fi, and of course GRATE breakfast. Room service was quick and food tasted well. Mortons restaurant on the 4th floor is one of the best western restaurants in Hong Kong. I like to sit in the bar just above the escalator and in front of the reception, sipping on my whiskey and coffee and just observe people coming and going. Staff is over all very helpful and kind. I had to extend my stay with one day and had to move room, when coming into my new room a bottle of red wine and fruits were waiting for me with a note from management saying sorry for the inconvenience. If you are a tourist Sheraton has the perfect location for you to start exploring Hong Kong and Kowloon. In front of the hotel you have the star walk, the observation deck for the light show and the absolute must, Star Ferry. If you have not gone on Star ferry you have not been to Hong Kong. Shopping... well this is Hong Kong, its all around you. The cheaper stuff you find in all small or big, markets where prices are open to discussion. The Real Deal you find in the shopping malls where the high end brands are represented every where. Remember that Hong Kong has no tax on products, VAT, so it is good process every where! Enjoy Sheraton and enjoy Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough but all about the location”
Reviews.Author: Trev_9
Reviews.Content: Great location at the bottom of Nathan Road, right in the heart of the action. Great views from the hotel bar across to Hong Kong island. The staff are very good and hotel is very clean. The room I had was comfortable and clean, however a little small with no view. Overall I was disappointed for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: YYC_traveler_10
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Sheraton in Hong Kong. The hotel is centrally located on Nathan Road, close to the Star Ferry and the MTR, right across from the promenade, and close to shopping and restaurants. In addition, it has great restaurants inside the hotel and a rooftop pool where we spent many pleasant hours. The staff speak excellent English and are friendly and attentive. We ate breakfast at the CAFE three mornings. It offers an extensive buffet breakfast with choices from North American, European, Chinese and Japanese cuisine. You are offered coffee and tea when you sit down. One thing we learned is that you can ask for a cafe latte or cappuccino for coffee rather than just brewed coffee. They are happy to make it for you. We also had cocktails and snacks in the Sky Lounge and attended a wine dinner in the Oyster and Wine Bar. All were excellent. Our room on the 11th floor was a city view room, however, because of the direction it was facing we had a fantastic view of the Hong Kong skyline. Perhaps not as good as the harbour view rooms, but close. The room itself was of moderate size. Everything is laid out efficiently.

Reviews.Title: “Smoking allowed anywhere-Ambassador Patinum guest means nothing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marc F
Reviews.Content: Non smoking is not enforced. I complained about the horrible cigarette smell. Well management did not do anything the guests continued to smoke and were not moved to a smoking floor. After several days of complaining I was told by the front desk that they were not able to find cigarret butts in the rooms. Apparentlty the smoke stint of a cigarett is not good enough evidence for management action. tIf you can not bare the smoke and cigarett smell don't stay in this hotel because managment seems to give preference to smoking guests. .... so do not offer non smoking floors!!!!! The club is on the 9 floors, no windows, no staff...no nothing. Platinum guest not upgrated to Towers nor allowed to use the Towers lounge. Bad business!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Mildred J
Reviews.Content: We arrived here after 15 days on mainland China and were thrilled to find that the hotel is close to so many resaurants and right in the heart of the shopping on Nathan Rd. Easy walk to waterfront to see the laser light show at night and to Star ferry terminal to take a boat to Hong Kong side of the harbour. Staff all spoke excellent English and were very focused on making sure your stay was enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, below average Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: wuyck
Reviews.Content: No doubt about the location of this hotel; just great. You are at TST, HK Island is easy accessible by MTR or Star Ferry. But for a Sheraton this hotel is below average. The rooms are very small. Bed quality isn't what you would expect (and what you actually get in the W HK). Decoration is ok but not for a hotel of this class and price. Cleanliness is ok. Handling at check-in and check-out is a bit messy and very impersonal. And I fail to understand whether the breakfast cafe is really part of the hotel (e.g. why are the expenses excluded from Starpoints?), quality is good and choice is excellent. BTW - Morton's is housed (not part of the hotel) in this building, one of the best steakhouses I know and almost a reason to stay in the hotel ... Come on, Sheraton! You could do better at such a prime location!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice view for tower habour deluxe room.”
Reviews.Author: Pooky L
Reviews.Content: Staying from May 23-26, 2012 with 2 rooms booking. Not a good start with Sheraton Reservation Center as we got confirmed the smoking rooms instead of NON SMOKING Tower Deluxe Harbour View Rooms. Try to contact the hotel reservation but they mentioned fully booked. Got last minute confirm the room requested after e-mail complaining that this prepayment booking were made 1 month in advance and as a SPG member, I cannot accept. Very impress for the hotel location and facilities offer for tower rooms. Twin room, bed is a bit small and the lounge is not much space to move. Compliment on the deluxe breakfast at Oyster wine & bar. Services staff are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't Rank any Longer”
Reviews.Author: Geoff48
Reviews.Content: A dreaful experience. We stayed in a Deluxe Tower Room, how it gets the name Deluxe, I'm not sure. The Room is very small. The Executive Club in the Towers Lounge is a disgrace, run down, dirty and most uncomforatable as well as being way too small for the demand. We didn't checked the Platinum Lounge, but were told it was inferior to the Tower Lounge. It was the last night of a 3 week business trip, so we decided to lash out on the last night at the Oyster & Wine Bar. The French Wine was superb. Now for the dinner, my Wife ordered Boston Lobster, which was overcooked, dry and tough. I returned it to the Kitchen and requested the Chef try it, I was told he agreed it was "below par" because the kitchen "was very busy" but it was returned to us. I asked for Crab Claws and asked if they should be steamed, as I noticed they had already been cooked. They were dreadful, and the Maitre'de suggested he had made a mistake by advising they could be steamed. This is meant to be an iconic restaurant-no way. Incidentally, they did compensate us, they didn't charge for our shared desert, wow !! NEVER AGAIN !

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JemVanc
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean, but small. We didn't get much of a view as we were facing the wrong direction. Service was good. Concierge was helpful. Buffet Breakfast had a wide variety with great food, and the service was good. Location is great, as there are a lot of shopping and eating joints nearby. Also easy access to the MTR trains.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Average Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: GandRAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: We stayed in many Sheraton hotels, but this was not the best one. Small rooms with a rough sleeper type concrete bed in stead of the promised sweet sleeper. Good location. Good buffet restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Carmel1955
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Harbour View Room on the 14th floor and could not have wished for more. The view was superb, the room was quiet and the service was impeccable. Our room wasn't ready for us when we arrived. However, there was a room on the 12th floor available but the receptionist told us that the view wouldn't be as good as on the 14th. We had some lunch while we were waiting and then were given free drink vouchers for the inconvenience. We had two small issues with the room but they were addressed immediately and I received a follow up call to check all was good. The staff in the Business Centre were terrific, setting a camera up for me so I could do a Skype interview back to Australia. An excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: Tamara K
Reviews.Content: We recently enjoyed 3 nights at this lovely hotel and thoroughly enjoyed it. Our room was very clean and well appointed. The view was spectacular from the 17th floor and we'll never forget how we enjoyed watching the city lights at night. Breakfast was included and complimentary evening cocktails/snacks were so generously and graciously served it was wonderful. This hotel is very well located for sightseeing and it was so handy to be steps away from the Star Ferry and the MTR. I would love to stay here again one day!

Reviews.Title: “Back to its best”
Reviews.Author: langkawi-lisa
Reviews.Content: we are regular hong kong visitors who used to only stay at the Sheraton, but after too many occasions of appalling service and dodgy business practices, we stopped staying there about 7 years ago. This year, we decided to try it again, and we are glad we did. We stayed in the Towers, and it was a completely lovely experience, from the private check in to the unsolicited offer of late checkout, beautiful breakfast with stunning views overlooking the harbour, and lovely room. When we arrived, they had no king rooms left, so upgraded us to a junior suite (which staggeringly only had a double bed). It was late, we were tired, so we took it, but the next morning, they quickly, efficiently and with minumum fuss moved us to a beautiful junior suite with king bed. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazing harbor view!!”
Reviews.Author: Bythebay11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Towers recently and were amazed by the service and ammenities here. You have a private check in and reception upon arrival, which is so nice after a long flight, they even serve you drinks while you are checking in. A beautiful buffet breakfast every morning in the sky lounge, which is also private for Tower Guests. The Oyster Bar and restaurant were very happening, and have the most amazing view of Victoria Harbor. We also reserved the Mercedes to the hotel, which I highly reccomend, after the 14 hour flight it was so worth it. You can reach the MTR directly from the hotel below the shops, or walk to Harbor Court where you can shop forever. The first room we had was a non-smoking room with no view, we upgraded to a harbor view for a little more, but had to take a smoking room. Somehow the smoking room was much better than the "non-smoking" room, seems it is optional smoking? The pool is located on the roof of the building and there are 3 separate jacuzzi for relaxing, which were separated by a little hedge for privacy. My only regret is that we did not have more time.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: ltnathome
Reviews.Content: I was in HK for 7 days recently, stayed 4 nights here on my own and 3 at the Harbour Grand as couple (due to points usage/travel sched, and not b/c there's anything wrong with either place). Both are comparable in quality, though this one is more central --for example, a 10 min walk will take you to the evening light show on the promenade. I got a basic room, which is actually very nice and spacious, though lousy view. (I've often got upgraded at other Sheraton but didn't this time b/c the hotel seemed booked with a sales convention). Not much to say other than if you've stayed at other Sheraton hotels and happy with the quality, then you will be happy here as well. Feels a bit hectic, probably due in part to being right on a very busy road (though I don't think room noise is a problem with any of the rooms here). Very nice/expensive restaurant and oyster bar on top floor, and plenty of bar/lounge options nearby as well (Intercontinental across main thoroughfare/walk under ground to reach; or the Peninsula literally steps away). And in case there are people who are up early like me and don't want to spend money on hotel coffee/breakfast, the Starbucks in the mall across street doesn't open till 8am. Lastly, there's free shuttle service right outside hotel to the airport express train line.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view for a small room. Good location, but the SPG lounge is lacking.”
Reviews.Author: albutt27
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for half of our stay in Hong Kong. Our other half consisted of the Conrad in Hong Kong. As a SPG platinum member, I requested a late check in and check out to which the hotel obliged. We were given an upgraded room overlooking the harbor. Looking at the hotel, there are probably 25% of the rooms that have this view, so I was happy to get upgraded. . It’s about a 5 minute walk to the MTR station and major shopping areas. The clean and modern room was a bit small for 2 people. There was barely enough room to store our luggage. However, as a SPG platinum member, we were upgraded to a Harbour View room. The view was breathtaking and I could sit and stare out the window. The platinum lounge was terrible. There is no view and the food options are bare. I guess the hotel decided that it would rather have a lounge that it could make money rather than treating its best loyal customers. Note; the Conrad lounge had a gorgeous view overlooking the harbor, so we were disappointed with the Sheraton’s. The concierge staff goes out of their way to recommend their own airport shuttle, which I don’t understand. Everyone knows the fastest way door to door is to take the MTR Airport Express. It took us less than an hour door to door, including checking in our bags at the Kowloon station. However, the bell staff did walk us out to the stop with our bags so that was a nice touch. Overall, I’m not sure we would consider staying back at the Sheraton Kowloon because of the small room size and the amount we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Stuart M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights on business with two of my colleagues. Everything about the Sheraton HK was great. Check in was simple and efficient, our rooms were all excellent, spacious, comfortable and with beautiful harbour views. We ate in the hotel each night and found the food to be of great quality, and reasonably priced. We also visited the Sky Bar on the 18th Floor for evening drinks on two occasions and found the atmosphere,view and cocktails to be better than 'Felix' at the Penninsula Hotel. Every member of staff worked hard to ensure we had a great stay - I will not hesitate in booking in to the Sheraton when I am next in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Check in and check out takes a long time”
Reviews.Author: Tablefair
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this hotel 4 times a year for the past 10 years. We have never been recongnised for this despite being a spg gold member. Bell staff always friendly and attentive. Check in is the worst for any hotel. For some reason it can take 10-15 mins just to get your room key. If you check out in the morning forget it. There can be many ques at the counter. Rooms are ok but not great. A bit dated now. Good layout though. Food great, food meal and breakfast. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “So long.....”
Reviews.Author: burnsy133
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel for the past six years now, in that time I have seen it desend from the 4 star hotel it once was to the miserable excuse they now offer. Upon arriving i was allocated a Harbour view room which i had paid extra for, the room in question was 518 and to be fair if I pressed my face right up against the window i could see the harbour, looking straight out my view was obscured by buildings. I asked to be moved but the hotel was full (unless i paid extra of course, which in my view means it wasnt full), regardless of being a Starwood Privilege member no joy. The room itself was old fashioned (as most of the hotel is now) and is in need of a refurb asap. The carpet is an old floral design and you could see the dirt on your feet if you were bare footed. On the first night i rang down at 6.30pm to ask for two shirts to be collected for pressing, I was told that the last collection time is 7pm, so they might not be able to collect that day, I know its not the smallest hotel in the world but 30 minutes should be ample time. After complaining to the front desk a lady appered to collect my shirts, she was very rude and abrupt, telling me that the shirts would be dropped back off before 10pm, when i explained I had just arrived and that i longed for my bed so a morning delivery would be better i was told no, tonight before 10pm, despite my plea's the shirts arrived back at 9.45pm. Another shock waiting for me was that the breakfast had now risen to £28 per head, expensive even for a four star. At checkout i checked my bill and noticed i was being billed for 9 lots of Internet access, 1 for each device per day, as unbelievable as it sounds the hotel still charges HKG150 per day for wireless use, after explaining that it was 2012 and for £250 a night i would expect the internet to be free they finally agreed to only charge me for one device per day, if i had not stood my ground this was not being wavered. The sad thing about all this is that all my staff stay here, or at least they used to, the Shangri-la is much better value and they know how to look after you. Sorry Sheraton Kowloon...you need to take a long hard look before your bring the good name of your chain down.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good staff”
Reviews.Author: Sar
Reviews.Content: Updated Sheraton, great location. Even if not in a harbour-view room, the rooms are clean and functional. Staff is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: moomie13
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel 2 years in a row and highly recommend it. We had interconnecting deluxe harbour view rooms on both occasions. Views were great and hotel location is fantastic. MTR is accross the road and it is a short walk to the Star Ferry. The night markets are a short taxi ride away if you can't be bothered getting the train back. Breakfast was fantastic and staff are very accommodating, even remembering our extended family from the year before . Rooms are not enormous but then this is Hong Kong and space is at a premium. Would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for the quality”
Reviews.Author: BobbyPtravels
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great, hands down, right across street from Intercontinental and Peninsula hotel in Tsim Sha Tsui, if you haven't been to HK, it is on Kowloon side next to Harobr city which is a massive Mall. so Location gets 5 stars. Now to the hotel, it is old, the lobby had been renovated recently and it is nice, however the "tower" is only 17 floors and if you have been to HK, you know that is like a single story home. I am a SPG member so I got an upgrade, with internet and breakfast included which was very nice, however the room was very old. old carpet, very poorly positioned closet, that was very hard to get to. my view was of the oposite tower wall and back of the neon sign of the hotel. at least it wasn't facing the sign!, the Lobby assistants were nice, but not very helpful. usually the bell team take your luggage and send it to your room after check in. I asked them to do exactly that,and they said they couldn't do that?? The front desk staff were nice, but they gave me a key to the wrong room, and since I was carrying all of my luggage, I had to drag everything back down get a new key and go back to the room, then I found out the original room would have had a nice water view compare to my neon sign view... after a long flight, you really don't want to be learning that. if you like to work out, the gym is fine, a bit old, but good selection of machines, they offer classes as well but I didn't take any, the trainers were mostly behind the desk, I worked out everyday I was there and did not see any of them training anyone. The pool is very small, and I generally love to swim however I did not want to get into that pool. Breakfast is okay at best, I would have not been happy if it wasn't included in my room rate.The thing that bothered me the most however was the ease of getting into the hotel if you were not a guest. floors are not key controlled and anyone can get into the lift from the underground mall floor and go to any hotel floor they like.... There are security camera's on the floors, but I did not feel very good about it. so here is the kicker... the hotel over all is not too bad, but for 40$ or 50$ more a night you could stay in Intercontinental right on the water across the street... (I checked and kicked my self in the tush)

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: loun80
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located in the Tsim Sha Tsui (TST) area of Kowloon, Hong Kong. It is right above the TST East MTR station which is also connected to the TST MTR station. The entrance is always opened by the doorman/woman. The lobby is spacious and comfortable. The check in process was fast and friendly. The room was a good size for Hong Kong standards and was very well maintained and clean as was the rest of the hotel. The fitness center is on the top floor and it has a good selection of cardio machines and free weights. A nice surprise was made by the hotel when they delivered a birthday cake to my room as one of the days of my stay was my birthday. Cake came with cutlery, candles, and a birthday card to top it off. We had a problem with the iPod dock and a maintenance staff member and a manager attended to our room immediately to replace the unit. Service is very fast. The hotel is close to everything you need. You can find endless amounts of in-expensive and expensive eateries in the area with with luxury shopping outlets to department stores to small street stores. MTR, taxis and buses are at the doorstep when you need to venture out. The hotel is located right by the harbor as well which offers a promenade, the avenue of stars and some museums. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust111Chicago
Reviews.Content: The location of the Sheraton Hotel & Towers is perfect. Located on the Kowloon side, on Nathan Road and central to the ferry, shopping, restaurants, etc makubg this Sheraton an inexpensive option compared to other five star properties in the area. The hotel itself is in need of a major overhaul from the ground up. The staff are indifferent, not accomodating and the word "no" is used more than "yes". The rooms are very small with the two of us fighting for space. The "non-smoking" floors still smelled of smoke and when pointed out to the front desk, we were greeted with a strange refresher smell that never left the floor. Felt like this hotel was probably great in the 1980's and stayed in a bit of a time warp. The breakfast in the Cafe located on the lobby level was great with a lot of Western and Chinese options. For SPG members is was complimentary and a nice way to start the day. The SPG "lounge" was a conference room without windows and was not inviting. Coffee and refreshments were available all day but definitely not a room for relaxing compared to other SPG properties. If we were to come back to Hong Kong again would not choose this property and would splurge on the Peninsula or Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experiences......”
Reviews.Author: rengephil
Reviews.Content: I stayed twice at this hotel in april. First time: a harbour view deluxe, spacy very pleasant room with a maginificent view. Good service and friendly staff. A four star experience! Very good bedding as expected with Sheraton.
