Second time: Towers floor with harbour view, small room (You can barely move around without bumping into something), very very poor WIFI (notified this more than 6 times...), at night the Towers room is overcrowded so not much of a nice experience, the breakfast at the topfloor is excellent, friendly service and a view to make your day! I hesitate to ever go back to this hotel, and probably not at the towers, if you're there for work, a very poor wifi is a major setback. You can get the views at other places too with excellent wifi for the money you pay at Sheraton. A pity since the hotel has so much going for it. I I has a wonderful pool at the topfloor.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular harbor view just from suite”
Reviews.Author: FatbirdAlex
Reviews.Content: Suite booked via SPG and was upgraded to a corner suite I don’t know why. The suite size is just magnificent during our stay in HK (in comparison with The Peninsula & Isl. Shangi-La). Hotel entrance is kind of hard to find, well I think this might due to my personal issue since we were walking in a heavy rain with two big luggages. The basement links with HK MTR Tsim Sha Tsui & East Tsim Sha Tsui. Although it is heavy raining out there we are just fine to go anywhere without getting wet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Jennyp622
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night. room was very small but modern. Here if u book 2 beds you are actually getting twin beds. Pretty good breakfast, although not the cheapest. GREAT location in Kowloon to shops, restaurants, ferry etc! At the end of the day its not the St Regis or the W but would def stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “3 star at best”
Reviews.Author: annaaa333
Reviews.Content: Our visit was a four day stopover on the way from UK to Australia. Checkin was at midnight and staff were unfriendly and arrogant. The room was average and tired. View from the room was a courtyard. Hotel location is excellent. Foyer area smelled consistently for four days of stale water, at least I hope that is what it was. Food was average. Breakfast menu identical each day. Housekeeping staff were friendly and efficient. Concierge was pleasant and helpful. Power adapter was provided at no charge. Mini bar was well stocked. While the hotel provides several computers for use in their link centre, these are often being used by children. I had to pay for wifi in the room. I did not feel welcome or cared for. The sweet sleeper beds which Sheraton are known for were so hard they were more like futons! I have stayed at many Sheraton hotels and I consider this one well below par and overpriced by today's standards.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, convenient to the harbor, subway, and Ferry to Hong Kong from Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: RockCatWichita_KS
Reviews.Content: The fitness center is excellent, the beds are extremely hard (but maybe not for China, I have heard). The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Tmanjk
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel two or three time a year for the last several years while in Hong Kong on business. Great location in the middle of Kowloon, very near the star ferry and underground. Staff has always done a great job. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: greenstarlette
Reviews.Content: We had a gorgeous Harbor View room that had one of the best views in Hong Kong! The hotel is on Kowloon in the Tsim Sha Tsui neighborhood right next to the famous Peninsula Hotel and on Nathan Road which is the epitome of high-end Hong Kong Shopping. We felt the location coudn't be better since we could see the famous 8pm light show from our room and it is so easy (3 minute walk) to walk right to the Harbor (Avenue of Stars) if you want to hear the music along with the 8pm light show. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk from all the shopping your heart desires and also a 5 minute walk to the Star Ferry so that you can take the ferry (less than $3) over to Hong Kong Island where you can visit Victoria Peak, the IFC mall, etc. The best view is from the Kowloon side so we'd recommend against staying on the Hong Kong island side as those hotels are more geared to business travellers and don't have the good view nor the good shopping. We thought the view at the Sheraton was better than the Intercontinental because the Intercontinental is right on the water in the corner and it is harder to see the entire light show from there - even in the good rooms. There is a Sky Lounge on the top floor of the hotel that has fun drinks, dim sum and afternoon tea (British Influence). There is also an Oyster Bar and another restaurant. We ate at the Chinese restaurant twice = once for dinner (award winning and delicious) and another time for Dim Sum lunch. We highly recommend it! The room was very modern and there was see-through glass to the bathroom but it wasn't like some hotels and you would still have privacy when in the shower and using the toilet. We stayed on the 8th floor and even though that was in about the lower to middle floors of the building it was still super quiet despite the street below and we slept very well. Also, even though it was only the 8th floor, we still had a fantastic view. We took a taxi to and from the airport. They tack on $5HKD per suitcase and there is a $10-$30HKD charge depending on which bridge/tunnel toll the driver takes you. It cost us $235 HKD from the airport to the hotel and $245HKD from the hotel to the airport (Red taxis = blue and green are for other regions). We would recommend taking a taxi if you are more than 1 person because it is much more convenient (quick & easy to get taxis both at the airport and the hotel) and it is faster than the train or airport bus. It took us less than 30 minutes each way door to door - even in traffic. It was also more economical since there were 2 of us and the taxi dropped us off right at the hotel as opposed to the airport train which we'd have to walk with our luggage or take a bus or taxi anyway. Overall, we enjoyed our stay immensely and would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: Asiabase
Reviews.Content: Good location - close to shopping, restaurants, and Star Ferry. Good view of the harbor. Service is terrific. Check-in is efficient. Cafe staff very friendly. Gym is on top floor - good view of the harbor. Gym counter staff are great. Gym is small, but well equipped. Rooms are clean and well maintained. Comfortable bed. I had a nice harbor view - Day and Night views were fantastic!! Breakfast buffet is enormous. Several food stations with lots of choices. Will be back again and again!

Reviews.Title: “in TST at the end of Nathan Rd”
Reviews.Author: dgvictor
Reviews.Content: a good hotel located across the road from the historic Peninsula hotel. stayed here as we had a trade show and the exhibiton centre and really great to catch the ferry across the harbour to Wanchai. its a great commute. this hotel is located at the bottom of nathan rd in the heart of the TST tourist shopping zone. one every corner people will offer you suits, bags watches etc. great selection of shopping, restauarants in the area the room in the hotel was great, with awesome views over harbour. exectecutive club is good especially for breakfast. would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely restaurant”
Reviews.Author: gingko2
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely meal here with friends. The food was a brilliant fusion of European and Chinese food so very acceptable to our taste. Unobtrusive and attentive staff. Attractive venue.

Reviews.Title: “Best designed hotel room I've ever known”
Reviews.Author: Alan B
Reviews.Content: The room we had in the Sheraton Hong Kong - I'm guessing the hotel was recently redone - is without a doubt the best designed hotel room I have ever enjoyed. I have travelled over much the world and all over Asia on vacations. I am a registered architect. It's not glitzy or fantasy. It just works so well and is very,very well thought out. To start with, there is room for two suitcases to be opened up and accessed. Why do so few hotel rooms account for more than one guest? Then, there are flat surfaces to spread out on without having to clear away all the signs, book, clutter and crap which most hotels cover every square inch with. So too, the bed night tables are multi-level to hold phones and writing pads and all the stuff required by the bed, all the while leaving the top free for the guests' use. Seems simple, so why do so few succeed at this? Then, the main furniture across from the bed is one clean and simple unit holding the drawers, TV, the mini bar. Instead of multiple furniture pieces like most hotels, it is like a functional piece of office furniture, thus no icky un cleanable spaces inbetween. Even the desk is a glass oval hanging off the main piece. And low and behold there are plenty (plenty!) of data and power outlets right there at the desk - built in clean and lovely, not down on the wall somewhere, not an afterthought. Yay! Then, the bathroom . . . what a joy! One, there is a nightlight so you don't get blinded and wake a sleeping partner during the night from turning on the bright bath light like in most hotels. The sink area - at first I thought two sinks was over ambitious in such a small space. But there is a shelf built in all along under the main sink counter, effectively doubling the counter space. And the main counter surface is glass, so you can see what you've put below to access it and not forget anything when leaving. Brilliant. Then there's a separate wet area with the tub and shower sectioned off by a glass door and partition. It is perfectly proportioned space-wise. It keeps the bulk of the moisture out of the sink area (love that) and bets of all you can see yourself shower in the full mirror over the sink, owing to a lack of curtain or mirror fog. Sexy. I could go on. The curtains are enclosed on three sides neatly by a partition wall making them tailored and neat. The closets like the main furniture are one large almost ship-like well designed and built in unit. Whoever designed this room deserves some real kudos. I LOVED it. Like I said at the top, it's not high design. But it works a million times better than anything I've stayed in by Phillipe Stark, or any W Hotel travesty. This architect says YES!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with a sweeping view of Central Hong Kong!”
Reviews.Author: Eijtraveler
Reviews.Content: Great location for A few days in Hong Kong. The rooms were comfortable, but the bathroom was a little small for me. I am never a fan of the toilet right next to the only counter were I can put my makeup bag.... If you get a harbor view room, you will be treated to a wonderful Hong Kong light show every evening! Another location to view the show from is one of the several rooftop hot tubs, although that view is of Kowloon and the skyline of Central Hong Kong Island due to a large electric sign on the top front of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat Visit - Just as Good as the First Time”
Reviews.Author: LasBrisasGal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton back in August, 2011, and now again in March, 2012. I received the same outstanding service and accomodations, that I decided it merited another positive review. The location is wonderful. You are near the MTR, the Star Ferry, and shopping in Kowloon, but aren't bothered by the hagglers who tend to congregate around some of the other hotels down Nathan Road. I particularly like the desk/workstation area and the window ledge/desk on the wall behind it, because there are plugs everywhere you can possibly think of to use your computer and charge your electronics. But as much as I like it, I do have a few issues to note: (1) For the life of me, I don't know how to stop the shower water from getting on the bathroom floor through the 1/2 glass wall. Easy remedy = toss a towel on the floor, and there is a drain there as well. (2) The lighting in the bathroom is too low for my taste, so I end up drying my hair and doing makeup, etc., near the desk. That's not a problem, since there is a full mirror there, and the shelf with plugs that I just mentioned, but that may not be true of people who aren't travelling alone. (3) I really wish that the WIFI was free in the hotel. More and more, it's common for it to be included in the hotel rate, particularly our corporate rate. It also makes the billing and travel expense reports more cumbersome to have to separate out and report the charges. (Hint: If you have multiple devices, check your bill and ask the desk to remove additional charges for the same day.) Other than that, the property, amenities, location, staff, and overall value are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great view at night..”
Reviews.Author: markandphilippa
Reviews.Content: A wonderful location for viewing Hong Kong island, particularly in the evening when the buildings provide a great backdrop to the harbour. I was here for a short stay but wouldn't hesitate to return - decent location and very good staff at reception and in the 'cafe'.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Mozza47
Reviews.Content: At the bottom of Nathan Road opposite the extraordinary and overpriced Peninsula Hotel, the Sheraton is almost as good, and whilst still expensive, it costs only a fraction of it's neighbour. And the service is better! My second visit to the Sheraton (with one at the Peninsula in between) the friendliness and anticipation of the staff is outstanding. My gripes are just the price, and the overactive suggestive-sell of the reservations people. I requested an early check-in prior to leaving home, but was told "not possible the hotel is very very full, but if you book room for the night before we can guarantee room on your arrival" I turned that exciting prospect down. Thanks but no thanks. When I arrived at 8.00am, I was told, "can have room in few minutes". I'm pleased I didn't shell out $HK3000 for nothing! Room size is small by international standards, but the Hong Kong is like that! Typical Sheraton - far too much furniture stuffed into too small a space. And the "harbour view" might not be much more than a glimpse unless you are on the highest floors. The art gallery and the bloody InterContinental block the view .... Hint: If you want to very best location on the busy Victoria Harbour - go to the InterCon.

Reviews.Title: “Not enough for 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: TotallyFinnish
Reviews.Content: Rooms I have booked and payed over 300€ a night for non-smoking room with double bed, but was informed at check-in that hotel is fully booked, so I got the twin-bedded room for the first night. It did not sound that bad in the beginning, but the reality hit me immediately – it was a smoking room on the smoking floor (which, by the way, the hotel staff did not mention at all!). The horrible smell hits you immediately when you step in from the elevator and while you reach the room you can’t breathe anymore, and in the room it’s even worse. Having suffered the first nigh, I have got an upgrade to the harbour view room for the rest of my stay, though on the 5th floor, not on the top. Overall the rooms (and the hotel in general) is very tired and worn out. Rooms are quite small, though functional: you even get an adaptor if you forget yours (as I did). Free WiFi is not available in your room (only the one you have to pay for), which I think is too bad for 5 star hotel. Breakfast Busy, noisy, not relaxing at all. It helps, that hotel staff will find a free table for you. Food selection is good, although smaller than I had in other 5 star hotels in Beijing and Shanghai during this trip. Healthy smoothie was my absolute favourite! Hotel amenities and staff Free WiFi in lobby very slow. A few computers available – 80% of them were not functioning properly for 3 days in a row. Health centre on the top floor was quite good – with an outdoor swimming pool, a few whirlpools, gym and sauna department. Spa treatments were at a very expensive price. Staff is friendly and helpful. The check in, though, took way too long. Location This one I will definitely give a 5 star – within a few minutes walk to MTR and Star Ferry Terminal. Nathan road is full of shopping and eating possibilities, if you manage to avoid annoying vendors of suits, fake watches and bags. Conclusion Good try, but I will most probably stay in another hotel next time

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Tiny Tiny rooms!”
Reviews.Author: ben s
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Good service. Wow the room was small (maybe because I don't have status with Starwood?) Had a good time, didn't spend much time in the hotel but the time I did spend was good. Small rooms tho. Not sure I would stay again at these prices. Clean however. Very clean and quiet. Good sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect start to a romantic holiday”
Reviews.Author: Keith074
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a harbour view tower suite. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful & the rooms and view lovely! We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Five Stars - Service could improve”
Reviews.Author: Lapi
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Sheraton with the family on a holiday to Disney. Hotel Rooms are nice and big compared to others in Hong Kong. Service staff at concierge desk were not very helpful in giving directions especially when I was looking for places to eat - especially when all they do it take out a map and draw the location. Hong Kong can be relatively confusing especially if you can't speak cantonese or mandarin. Its a NON Smoking lobby so smokers take note to smoke only outside of the hotel. Not child friendly though.

Reviews.Title: “Still one of the best-value and best-service 5-star hotels in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: hgautschi
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to this 5-star hotel for the past 15 years. After a 3-year absence, I am very glad to be back at this great hotel with exceptional service at every level, perfect location on popular Nathan Road and overlooking Victoria Harbour and with a multitude of fine facilities such as a very efficient Front Desk, a world-class steak house, upscale Japanese and Chinese restaurants, a popular coffee shop, a unique oyster and wine bar, a wine and cake shop, a sky lounge on the 18th floor with a unique view of the bustling Victoria Harbour and the fascinating Hong Kong Island sky-line plus a health spa and fitness center with roof-top pool and jacuzzis again offering a superb view. The rooms are very well appointed and have above-average size. A little tip: book a harbour-view room, it is very well worth a little extra money. - Henri Gautschi, Greenville RI, USA

Reviews.Title: “Happy with my current stay.”
Reviews.Author: cxworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: As a Starwood Platinum member I expect to be treated better at Starwood hotels. For me, they did a very good job this stay. I was upgraded to a room with a Harbor view. As a SPG Platinum I was provided with the full breakfast buffet which was fantastic. Clean room, nice staff. Great location. Will return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Older property but well maintained”
Reviews.Author: Kristy-Vagabondkids
Reviews.Content: A bit dated but well kept, the only downfall is the breakfast and lack of lounge for SPG members. Highlights are location-location-location. I had meetings on HK island and loved the morning commute on the Star Ferry.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel with easy access to shop, MTR and Ferries”
Reviews.Author: jbtujuh
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to the Tower Ocean View on the 15th floor instead of Main 14th floor with access to Business Lounge on 16th floor, 18th floor for bkfst, teas and cpocktails at 530 to 8 pm which is great when needing to catch a red eye flight. Turndown service lady on 3/15th kindds' missed the sign on door and reported do not disturb sign which was not the case at 930 pm since we got back around midnite' and took bakc her name which was slipped under the dor as Hellene and I got a kick out of that busy day on 3/15th since i am very detailed oriented person. The Tower appears to be a tad dated, toilet flusher are out of the socket when flushed and at 1st, thhe sick top was out when i turned on the water, fixed glass appears to be chiped on the corner. I quite agree with one trip advisor, the mirror appears to be darker when i put on make up since the design appears to be revamped in the room. pro: double sink, see through, 4 free bottles of water, rather large room for HK, high floor for better view. nearby Ave of stars, i square mall, MTR are all within walking distance, lounge with internet, room with fax machine, free local calls, rain shower with tub access with extended shower hose as well as shower access. con:a tad dark for a revamped room, a tad dated and may be falling apart,awkward closet space.

Reviews.Title: “Calm amongst the noise and traffic”
Reviews.Author: PJJersey
Reviews.Content: We had booked an Executive Suite with garden views. Arriving late at night were shown to a room overlooking the hotels air con units, the noise from which would have made sleep impossible. They upgraded us to a Harbour view suite which was vey good. The Club level service was excellent although the furniture very tired. Breakfast was probably the best of our AustraliaHong Kong trip

Reviews.Title: “Location is great but a bit pricy with its current decor”
Reviews.Author: TravelJoyLin
Reviews.Content: The good thing about Sheraton Hong Kong is that it's in easy access to any big shopping malls / attractions near TST in Hong Kong. Also, the room is very clean and comfortable. Yet, i still think it is over priced with its furniture and carpet condition. It's probably the most "Antique" Sheraton I have ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Best Early Check-in Ever”
Reviews.Author: Ladeelawyer
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything you would expect from this level hotel. We arrived Hong Kong around 6 am, reaching the hotel about 7 am. They had our room ready and let us into it right away. We are SPG gold members, so I cannot be sure everyone gets this treatment, but it never hurts if you get there early to just ask. The room was large, the bed was comfortable, and the television was a big flat screen with many channels. There was coffee and a nice selection of teas included gratis. The bath was large with great towels. The location is convenient, with shops and restaurants in close proximity to the hotel. Every request we had of the staff was immediately answered positively. We would stay again for the service and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Superb second stay at Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: kokonuk
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at Sheraton Hotel Hong Kong. It was pleasant the first stay, and my happy experience is repeated in this recent visit. The concierge was very patient with my many queries on best cosmetic shops near the hotel, and dinner venues. I could not find my room door card, and someone was immediately despatched to assit me. The location is fantastic - the MTR station is just outside the main door, and within walking distance to the main shopping strips in Tsim Sha Tsui. Try having a traditional dim sum breakfast or lunch at the nearby Serenade restaurant at the Hong Kong Cultural Center. Its worth every cent and calorie. :>

Reviews.Title: “Our recent Hong Kong Experience”
Reviews.Author: susy1Brisbane
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 8 nights at Sheraton Koowoloon very handy especially for Harbour most of the tours left our hotel which was very convient and we loved the sightseeing Victoia Peak & especially a one day trip with viator to Shenzhen China for sightseeing and shopping we asked for Mark who is a tour guide he was great We loved all the markets Ladies ,Flower Market made me feel like returning home to catch up on gardening. Stanley Market was also good. Everything went to plan and would recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Location wins”
Reviews.Author: Sharon S
Reviews.Content: It was strictly a business trip for me in the Kowloon area. The level of efficiency is a trademark of hong kong hotels. I liked the layout of the room, and the basic amenities provided. It was a good starting point for shopping day trips, being close to many shops and subway stations. Breakfast was also good, but nothing extraordinary. For the price perhaps I will consider some of the more unique boutique hotels next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TrippingRound
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed three nights at this centrally located hotel on the Kowloon side of Hong Kong. Located on the corner of Nathan Road and Salisbury Road, it is across the street from Victoria Harbour. Our first room faced Nathan Road, and we found the traffic pretty loud even on the twelfth floor. Responding immediately to our concern, the front desk moved us to a harbour facing room. Not only does the room provide a panoramic view of the harbour, it is also larger and the washroom had dual sinks and a separate shower and bathtub. The room has comfortable beds, quite a change from the harder beds in our other hotels during our trip. There is a desk and an ergonomic chair. Having an iron after two weeks on the road was also useful. The lobby area on the second floor is spacious and well appointed with quite a few comfortable chairs. We didn’t bother paying for the Wifi in the room; there are six computers for hotel guests to use near the lobby. The staff is very welcoming and accommodating. Given the hotel’s close proximity to the harbour, all public transportation (Star Ferry, MTR, bussing), shopping, and dining, you can’t beat the Sheraton for a terrific stay, though you will have to pay more for this reason.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: EugeneChan
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel for its location, service and value. The hotel is conveniently located in Tsim Sha Tsui in Kowloon amongst a multitude of shops, shopping plazas, designer boutiques stores, cafes and restaurants. It is also within walking distance from the Avenue of Stars and the ferry terminal for the ferry to Hong Kong Island. The lobby of the hotel is quite grand with sitting areas and unlike Langham Place, is well lit and bright. However, the lobby was always busy and fairly crowded. The lobby seats were always occupied and so I never had a chance to sit on them. The lobby also contains a section with computers that provide complimentary Internet. Wi-fi is also complimentary at the lobby but costs HKD115 for 24 hours in the room. In the evening, there is some entertainment in the lobby (a singer with a guitar). I booked 2 Deluxe rooms with harbour views (Rooms 516 and 518). Before, and at the time of, checking in, I specifically requested for rooms on a higher floor but they were unable to accommodate that request – I was slightly disappointed but the harbour view was good nonetheless. The rooms were amply sized, clean and supplied with a plethora of amenities including bath robes, slippers and various types of coffee and tea. However, some of the furnishings and furniture such as the coffee/tea cabinet were showing their age. The bathroom was a good size but it was not a stand-up shower. Customer service was excellent. All my requests including extra teabags, towels and room keys were met with promptly. The four “Guest Services” telephone lines were very convenient to use (it was a one-stop line for all my requests and questions). My calls were also personalised: the operator referred to me by name. What I was particularly impressed with was the late check-out of 2pm, although the reception agent repeatedly emphasised that they would usually charge for a late check-out by the hour. I thought that this was a little stingy of the hotel. Another example of stinginess was the lack of apples on offer adjacent to the lifts for Level 5 guests. I noticed that apples were provided at the higher floors such as Levels 8 and 9. There was a lack of consistency. I also used the printers at the Business Centre by emailing documents to the Business Centre email. All my documents were printed efficiently and free of charge. I also used the Fitness Centre, which had a range of quality equipment including treadmills with LCD screens (it opens at 5am and closes at 10pm).

Reviews.Title: “great choice for Kowloon..”
Reviews.Author: DANYSTYLE
Reviews.Content: i came to the Sheraton for a 4 day seminar and stayed there as well. Front desk was fast and very friendly besides the hectic in the lobby. The room itself was clean and spacious. Although the room was close to the elevator the night i couldn't hear anything and had a good night sleep. The bed was however very soft and my back started to hurt after the third night. The breakfast selection was wide and staff very friendly although it was early morning. The room can be very noisy, so get your breakfast somewhere else if you like it quiet. Enjoy the view at the Sky lounge on 17th floor if you can grab a seat near the window. I havent seen an unfriendly or unhappy staff during my whole stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for fireworks”
Reviews.Author: visitor191
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel several times – always on a business trip. Consequently the cost was not much of an issue, but I would agree with some of the other writers that the cost is expensive for what you get. While certainly not cheap, there are things to like: The staff was always hospitable and when we stayed last time the view of the fireworks across the bay was simply spectacular. The access to the underground is easy and it is a lot faster to travel to Central via the train. Somehow we usually opted for the ferry, though. The serenity of being on the water and watching the junks float by compensated for the time difference. On the other hand the property could certainly use some upgrading. If you want to do a lot of sightseeing, it may be better to stay on the other side, because most of the tours depart from around Central.

Reviews.Title: “Not deserving of it's 4.5 star rating”
Reviews.Author: grimrater
Reviews.Content: If this Hotel was rated on the staff only, it would deserve 5 stars. However, as previous reviewers have said, it's tired, really in need of a facelift. We upgraded to a suite with harbour view, the view was great but the suite was very disappointing. The location is great for easy transport to HK. The down side of the location is Nathan Road. You cannot walk for more than a metre without being pestered by some pushy tout in your face trying to sell their goods. I couldn't handle the nuisence so stayed well away from Nathan Road. We were given a tip to visit Soho and Hollywood Road. The MTR central is fantastic, very well signposted and the cleanest station I've ever seen. Loved how well organised everything is in Hong Kong. Holywood has an amazing selection of antique shops and the Man Mo Temple is worth a visit there. We had brunch at Classified, a great little modern cafe. You can take the escalator for easy access to Elgin St and more shops and cafes. It's a goes long way up, remember you have to walk back down. Back in Kowloon, Hullett House built in 1881 is a delighful colonial building with an interesting history. It houses a few restaurants. We lunched on the verandah which was a little bit of heaven in busy Kowloon. If you like to have excellent service and appreciate crisp linen tablecloths and silver cutlery, then don't miss it. I would go back to HK but wouldn't stay at Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel at High Price”
Reviews.Author: KL-XVIII
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton in Kowloon for 1 night. My 2 fellow travelers were given upgraded rooms, but I guess my Starwood Preferred status was not high enough, so I got a cramped dated room with an interior view for 2640KHD, about $340. I found that the check-in staff was not friendly - they treat you like a number. The room reminded me of a 1980's airport Sheraton as far as the room went. This Sheraton charges an in-room fee for internet access for each device, something I found annoying since on my multi city trip I stayed at much nicer places for much less money that offered free in room WiFi. Have some bottled water on the house in your room; wait, that costs extra too. The lobby areas were nice, although there is insufficient seating in the lobby to wait for a colleague. The location is excellent with close access to nearby attractions, restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, compact accommodation, efficient service”
Reviews.Author: pelachi
Reviews.Content: Always busy and priced accordingly, the Sheraton Hong Kong is located on the Kowloon side in Tsim Sha Tsui at the Harbour end of the Nathan Road shopping area. 10-15 minute walk to the star ferry terminal, close to museums and of course loads and loads of shopping. The rooms are cosy and generally comfortable but feel small. The bathrooms are also comfortable but again feel small. The breakfast was well stocked with most everything you would expect from a 5 start hotel with a good mix of East and West selections. Fitness centre is well equipped and there is a pool but again, it feels small. Service is friendly and efficient. Only issue was that the bed was a mattress on top of wooden boxes which meant any significant movement made a hollow thumping sound or a disconcerting cracking sound.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton HK - TST station”
Reviews.Author: Lenox_Square
Reviews.Content: I've been to HK several time, In my opinion, when you see the 4 stars hotel, is atually which 3 stars. But this hotel is very good as same as any Sheraton in other countries. The hotel is located on Tsim Tha Tsui (TST) station (1 block), across the street from Sogo (not big department store but it has supermarket and small nice food court). The opposite building is Peninsula hotel which carry Chanel, LV, Prada, Hermes for the brandnames lover. A few blocks walk to carnavorn rd., the street that has a lot of shop to eat (chinese wonton, noodle, Congee, Japanese) In room, even small but they are complete, the bathroom has both shower & tub. The bed mattress is not good as same as Sheraton in US, but they are above average of other Hong Kong local hotel (same rate as here). They have additional pillows and blanket provided in the wardrobe. They are the weight machine, too. Lastly, they don't have heater (only AC) which the same rate hotel (for example Marco Polo gateway) don't have it,too. I made a reservation via an agency which is actually cheaper than the rate in SPG website.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location with breath-taking views of the Harbour!!!”
Reviews.Author: BTELO
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas at this hotel on the Kowloon side of Hong Kong. We arrived on December 24th and left on December 31st. They had a great rate for long term stays. I booked a Deluxe Harbourview Tower Room with two twin beds. I emailed the hotel about a month before to ensure there would be two twin beds. Communication with the hotel was excellent via email. I had also arranged private transport from Hong Kong airport to the hotel. The service could not have been better. You are greeted at the Sheraton counter as you leave the baggage area. You are then escorted to a Mercedes luxury sedan where they load your luggage and you step into a comfortable experience, which is very important for me as I travel alone with my 10 year old son. Fortunately, this time we invited my dad over, who was staying in China, to join us for the week, hence we needed the two beds. Being a Towers guest, you have your own check-in on the 16th floor. When we arrived, our luggage was tagged downstairs and we proceeded in check-in on the 16th floor. As you can imaging, it was very busy since it was Christmas eve. We were escorted into the lounge where we were offered drinks and a comfortable lounge to relax. My credit card, reservation, and passports were given to a check-in hostess and when everything was done, I got everything back and our room keys. The lounge has a fabulous view of the Harbour and Hong Kong Island and it was nice to enjoy this view after a 15 1/2 hour flight from Toronto. When we proceeded to our room, our bags followed shortly - about 5 -10 minutes. We were very happy with our rooms-- only we would have liked a non-smoking room, but they were great about getting us an air filter which we enjoyed for the entire stay. Breakfast was included at served at the Oyster & Wine bar. Great buffet selection and also hot menu selection ranging from American, Chinese, Thai, Japanese breakfast. On weekends, they also served champagne. The lounge has an afternoon high tea service and in the evening there were cocktails and appetizers until 8:30 pm You do have access to the lounge 24 hours if you only need to grab coffee/tea/soft drinks/water with your room key. There is a light show every evening at 8 pm, which we actually watched from our room or the lounge. The location is great for walking around and the Star Ferry Terminal is very close. If you have any interest to eat at the Celestial Court restaurant, you have to make reservations. Unfortunately I did not get to eat there as there was a function or wedding there every day of our stay. The Oyster & Wine bar has the most delicious crab cakes I have eaten! The lobster salad was also excellent. As for service, the staff are great and top notch...no complaints at all. We had the pleasure of being served by a very nice young lady "Wing Wong", both during breakfast and in the lounge. She would be very genuine in her pleasant conversation with my 80 year dad. And she was also well appreciated by other guests based on the interactions that I observed. So, all in all, I would stay at this hotel again due to the level of service and the excellent staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with Stunning view, but old.”
Reviews.Author: EeeE_Travel
Reviews.Content: We have been over Chinese New Year in the Sheraton and had two interconnected rooms with Barbour view. The rooms were clean, but very small by Asian standards. Reception was very much a mess and it took more than 20 min to checking and 30 min to check out. Overall was the temperature in the Hotel to low and we had to use all the times thick pullovers. The lounge for plainum SPG members did not offer breakfast and was very small (without a window). Anyway, the view on the firework made this an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in the hustle & bustle of the city”
Reviews.Author: ultrakenzo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very conveniently near TST MTR station, and it's in the middle of all the actions. The Harbour View room is simply spectacular in particular the night view across the Victoria Harbour. This hotel however requires some major upgrading (such as carpet) to keep in line with major 5* hotels in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: UncleGus32
Reviews.Content: Situated at the south end of Nathan Road in Kowloon, the hotel is conveniently located close to the harbour, shopping, is across the street from the Tsim Sha Tsui MRT station, and is one of the stops for the Airport Express shuttle. Having stayed here for several years it is apparent the rooms are starting to show their age a bit, though they do have flat screen TVs, but importantly they are clean and well appointed. The location and relative value compared to other hotels in the area make up for this and is why I keep coming back. The staff are also very good, and speak very good English, so there is no problem with any special requests getting misinterpreted. If you have an opportunity to get a room with a view of the harbour, take it, for great views of the light show on the Hong Kong side of the harbour each night (or cross Salisbury Road and watch the light show from Avenue of the Stars along the shore). There are several dining options on site including a Morton's of Chicago (that is not technically part of the hotel, but an equally good place to watch the light show while enjoying a good steak). The Cafe has a good buffet breakfast, but the dinner buffet is average at best.

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon tea buffet is a must!”
Reviews.Author: BB100
Reviews.Content: We came here for their afternoon tea buffet, which offers an array of dim sum, Asian delicacies, salad/ cheese/ sushi bars, desserts and freshly made fruit smoothies. They also have a noodle station, congee station and a crepe station (dessert). Seating is spacious and comfortable. Would definitely come here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great view...”
Reviews.Author: foliumnondefluet
Reviews.Content: Good points: fantastic location overlooking the harbour. make sure you get a harbour view room. Club level great investment especially if travelling with kids for view and huge spread of food in the evenings. Location for access to rest of HK very good, via ferry or subway. Food very good in club dining room for breakfast. Other restaurants not cheap but high standard. All in all a great stay and if you are a Starwood fan this is the best option in HK.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a let down but accessibility was great”
Reviews.Author: MRYMelbourne
Reviews.Content: After reading all the rave reviews about this hotel, we decided to stay here for 5 nights, two days after the Chinese New Year. From the airport, we were correctly advised that taking a taxi (red) was cheaper (for 3 people) and more convenient than the limousine bus or the Airport Express Train (which stops at Kowloon, then you are transferred to a bus to Tsim Sha Tsui area). Lobby was packed with people milling around and there was a long queue for check-in. I must say that it was the longest hotel check-in that I have ever experienced and the reception staff was apologetic saying that it was because of Chinese NY. No upgrades for non-platinum SPG members except being placed on the SPG floor overlooking a sad courtyard and billboard. King bed seemed smaller and lower than standard King sized bed in Starwood hotels but staff assured me that it is a King sized bed. Well, sleep wasn't as good compared to the other Sheraton hotel we just stayed in on a King sized bed. Buffet breakfast wasn't as great as the other reviewers posted. The bread and cakes were dry, bacon rubbery and coffee was too strong and almost undrinkable for me despite putting lots of milk. The saving grace was the fruit section, husband loved the fresh pineapples and I enjoyed the blueberries. Concierge staff were helpful although not very familiar with MTR travel costs. The room itself was okay and always kept clean, complimentary bottles of water were plentiful. Accessibility was the main feature of this hotel. The hotel is smack bang in the middle of all the action: Star Ferry, MTR to Mongkok's night market and Kowloon's Elements mall, high end shops in Harbour City, electronic and golf shops. We were tired of Chinese food so we bought New York style pizzas from Paisano's for 30HK dollar per huge slice, this shop is located in Granville Road. The previous night, we bought the award winning fried rice from Loong Yuen Restaurant, part of the Holiday Inn Golden Mile hotel at a cost of 110 HK dollars which can feed between 2 to 3 people (depending on how hungry you are). My family discussed our experience with this hotel and if we were to return to Kong Kong, we would probably try another hotel because for more than A$300 per night, this hotel was not value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Bliss in a stunning city”
Reviews.Author: BrochUSA
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that understands the concept of guest comfort and attention, essential given it's location and that the majority of guests either are arriving or departing upon long-haul travels. Myself and my colleague were upgraded to nice rooms overlooking the harbour. The breakfast is simply amazing, with attentive staff and a wonderful collection of international offerings to suit every taste, from fresh fruit through true continental breakfast to dimsum and other well prepared delights. A modest cost by Hong Kong standards for a great location and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Gordon H
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in HK many times and the Sheraton is right up there with the best hotels. It is one road back from the waterfront and there are loads of good bars and restaurants in the area ( Gaylords Indian rest. is a fave ). The underground is really close, as is the Star Ferry to the island. Lovely spacious rooms. Excellent breakfast facilities.The rooftop pool and hottubs are great, but the gym is not the best.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, view and speed of service at front desk is disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Dufffader
Reviews.Content: I booked a harbour view and on the 6 th floor, the harbour view is nothing to shout about. HK cultural center blocks most of the view. Disappointed with the premium prices compared to the other views. Front desk is a mess with all these mainland Chinese tourists thinking that the queue does not apply to them. Even with one other person in front of me at the gold/platinum queue, it still took half an hour to get into the room. It wasn't very quick when I found out the next day my key card had to be reprogrammed either. Otherwise the location is top notch. For value I rank it lower due to slow service and the questionable "premium" view. Plus the front desk employees has to be taught that customers who jump queues should be placed in a different queue to be served by their slowest newbie front desk employees as a punishment.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice accommodation - however...”
Reviews.Author: Stiza82
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here recently during Chinese New Year. The location of the hotel was perfect as it was right on the parade route and close to the harbor for the fireworks display. Being platinum members, we were upgraded immediately to one of the executive suites which had a living room and separate bedroom. The room was very clean and bath/shower was strong and hot. The service at this hotel was good. Everyone was polite. However, there was a little problem during our stay... Since we were staying here in January, it was quite cold outside. Upon entering the room, my wife and I attempted to turn up the heating using the two thermostats in both rooms. I turned them up to about 25 degrees Celsius and waited for the room to warm up. Thing is: that never happened. It actually got colder. So we figured it was broken, we called downstairs and asked if there was something we were missing (some hidden button on the thermostat that I didn't notice or something). They ended up telling us that there was no heat in the rooms, and that the thermostat was, in essence, there for 'show'. It didn't matter what temperature you set, nothing would change. We then learned that the entire building was centrally controlled, and that they do not turn on the heat in the hotel until 8pm each night. With our room freezing, we obviously complained about it and that they needed to do something to accommodate us. They told us that they have small space heaters that they can send up to rooms - however ALL of them were in use by other rooms. Hmm - what should that tell them if ALL the heaters were being requested? They said that have 700 rooms but not 700 heaters. This was obviously not on with us, so we wouldn't give up until they gave us a heater (even though they said they were all out). We then found out that their own employees have heaters in their offices! So they gave us one of those to use. I would like to note too that even after 8pm with the 'central heating' turned on, it was still damn cold. They told us that the central heat is set to 22 - 24 C when it's on, but with what we felt - not way that was the case. Anyway, other than the temperature problem - the hotel was fine. I just couldn't believe a rated 4-5 star hotel with a top SPG category rating doesn't have the ability to let its guests choose the temperature in their own rooms. If you plan to visit and stay at this hotel during the winter, request a heater sent to your room immediately when you check in.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Business Hotle - Great View, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: MargieBar
Reviews.Content: It is hard to complain about being so far from home when you can look out at the Hong Kong Harbor lights every night. Great Business set-up in room - desk good size, good access to electricity, wireless worked perfect. Renting meeting space in the hotel was good too. The staff is extremely helpful. Business Center is not as "self serve" as I like BUT the staff was helpful there too. Beds were more comfortable than most China hotels. Shower was VERY nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: AnnieL79
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights before Christmas. Perfect location right in the heart of Kowloon. Step out hotel onton Nathan Road and very short walk across road to the river. Lovely rooftop pool and hot tubs. Airport bus stops right outside. Stunnign view of lightshow from the bar and the play the music into the bar which is great. Room was lovely. Food was expensive but high quality and there is plenty of cheaper options minutes from hote if you do not want to pay these prices.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from HOME”
Reviews.Author: OttVanTor
Reviews.Content: This is not the greatest hotel on earth but far from being the worst. The location is perfect, the staff try exceptionally hard, the breakfast buffet is second to none, the views from the rooms can be spectacular.....but location, location, location is the key. It's not a big fancy hotel with a luxury feel, the platinum lounge is far below Starwoods standards and the gym is tiny BUT, the hotel caters for a very transient clientele and for me, it's home away from home with location, comfort and safety as my key criteria. Comfort: the beds are fabbo, the rooms are quiet and very clean, they have one of the best showers of any hotel I have ever stayed at. Safety: the rooms have oversized security lockers, the doors locks and security features are excellent and the rooms "feels" safe, the hotel also has ample door/security staff although not overly visible. It's a matter of expectations with any hotel, sometimes the brand suggests more but for Hong Kong I believe the Sheraton Towers has gotten it just right, a nice blend of service, quality and comfort. 2 final points I want to mention: the concierge(s) at this hotel are the best in the world from my experiences and do an incredible job at assisting. In my case, I want to save money by NOT using the hotel laundry and they always remain neutral on this point and facilitate a local laundry to pick up and drop off.....I have used this service about 20-25 times. This hotel knows I have a preferred room and after staying here for 3 years very regularly - they always facilitate and actually are the first hotel who really take my profile into account without me having to contact them. I am also a VEGAN and allergic to dairy and pork, after I arrive, they ensure that staff are aware especially in the platinum lounge and make special efforts to ensure I have some snacks that are suitable. Note I am based in Canada, a platinum member and travel 10 months of the year globally or approx. 300 nights in hotels. cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: leelee101
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in Hong Kong and had the absolute pleasure of staying at the Sheraton. Location is amazing and the shopping is great. Ladies market, Temple street Market, Stanley Market, and all the amazing Brand stores to either window shop or if your lucky enough to buy less sales tax. Now about the Sheraton, check-in was quick and smooth so that was great after a long day of travel, we also enjoyed a few drinks at the sky lounge and the atmosphere is relaxing and classy. We also had the pleasure of spending our wedding anniversary at the Oyster Bar and that was amazing, the service was exceptional and the food was amazing, thankyou sheraton for a lovely stay and a very memorable anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in hongkong”
Reviews.Author: amit4717
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel.Very well located in the heart of the city. The staff members were very friendly and helpful.The breakfast was great with lot of choice.The room was very well decorated and a great view from the window.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe the Best Hotel I Have Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: kpchitown
Reviews.Content: This hotel is typical 5 star hotel in amenities but what makes this hotel different is everyone workers there from the doorman to the cleaning lady. Everyone goes out of their way to be helpful. If in Hong Kong, I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel that is worth every cent”
Reviews.Author: happybutnotsosolucky
Reviews.Content: Like the location. It's near a train station, with amenities nearby. The rooms are clean and very comfortable. Check in is smooth. There is a shuttle bus service provided after you take Airport Express and arrived at Kowloon station. Overall.... Good :)

Reviews.Title: “Everything Nice”
Reviews.Author: beb111
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Sheraton Hong Kong Hotel & Towers recently and absolutely enjoyed our stay. Location was perfect if you want to stay in Kowloon. It is right across from The Peninsula Hotel and it couldn't get any better than that. There is also a free shuttle from the Kowloon station if you are taking the Airport Express. The staff at the hotel was wonderful. Everybody that we came in contact, from the bell person to the housekeeping were all courteous and seemd happy to provide assistance. Rooms were pretty good. We were assigned a room with a great view of the harbor and a pretty good size. Everything worked well. This is a great hotel for Hongkong and I would not mind staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location with Superb Views of HK island”
Reviews.Author: sonnysan
Reviews.Content: Brilliantly located property just minutes walk to the nearest MRT or a stroll down the esplanade to the STAR Ferry terminal. I recommend to book a club room on the tower block & the breakfast will be served at the top-most floor offering 1st class view of the HK island instead of the lobby cafe. Breakfast includes a hearty fruit salad bar complete with fresh blueberries & blackberries perfect for vegans and you have access to the lounge facilities which is priceless.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great position”
Reviews.Author: Psarou
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times and I really like the hotel. It doesn't get a full 5/5 solely based on the cost of wifi access and the cheek of trying to charge £6 a minute to use the phone to make international calls.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, however still not Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: uniflip
Reviews.Content: A short stop for night night and we decided to try Sheraton Towers in Hong Kong - The Intercontinental raised the price to much for the Club access and habour view. However, the stay at Sheraton was nice and the breakfast at the same high level as Intercontinental - The Club lounge crowded but they allow you to bring drinks and food to your room - Nice! If we should choose again we will go back to Sheaton, if the prices at the Intercontiental doesn't get more reasonable -Staff nice, rooms small but functional - Nice location...

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Hong Kong Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dianascutie
Reviews.Content: Very nice harbour view from the room. Best breakfast in town at the club level. Cigar bar is nice but a little pricey. Club level for drinks was nice and comforatble.

Reviews.Title: “Great harbour view but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Coellum
Reviews.Content: My family and I occupied 2 harbour view rooms. The views from the rooms are just wonderful. My husband and I enjoyed admiring the view after a full day of shopping. The rooms are on the small side. The bathroom had a glass wall so that one can enjoy the view while brushing one's teeth! There was a separate shower stall from the bath tub which is always nice. We had difficulty controlling the lights in the bedroom. When we turned on the master switch, all the lights would go on. Yet when the master switch was off, there was no way to turn on individual lights. There was a constant supply of free water, two little bottles per person. The wifi was not free in the rooms. However, my sons and I checked our email in the lobby. By mistake my son got wifi in the room not realizing that we had to pay 115 HK per day. The print when he logged on, he says was so small. The breakfast buffet was adequate but not particularly special by Asian standards. We had it on two mornings. I would stay again at this hotel for the view and the excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: Buzipadilla21
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for over 10 nights on a recent business trip. The staff is very welcoming and friendly. The rooms are modern, although not very large, but that is typical in Hong Kong. For the most part rooms don't have a great view, you may get lucky and have a view of the harbor, but that's rare. The breakfast restaurant has a decent selection and I didn't get tired of eating there over my long stay. The lobby is spacious and has a good vibe, with live music nightly, open areas to meet friends or colleagues, Sheraton-link internet access and a cigar lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for family with kids”
Reviews.Author: TexRamblinMom
Reviews.Content: We just finished a 4-night stay at the Sheraton Hong Kong. We were able to get a room with a king bed connecting to a room with 2 twins. We brought in a rolling bed, so there was room for all 5 of us. Judging by the noise from the other rooms, there were kids in surrounding rooms, too. Perhaps they put us all together to keep us away from business travelers? We had a Harbour View room on the 9th floor so we could see the 8pm laser light show. The buildings across the street somewhat blocked the view of the boats on the water, but we could see the laser show just fine. The hotel is conveniently located near an MRT stop which we used to return from both Disneyland and Hong Kong Central. Star Ferry was within walking distance, too. The Museum of Space (closed on Tuesdays) was located just across the street. Kowloon Park, The Museum of Science, and the Museum of History were about a 15-20 minutes walk from the hotel. We had the buffet breakfast at the Cafe. It was delicious and had many good offerings but cost US$115 for 2 adults + 3 kids. Free apples were on a table in each floor's elevator lobby. We didn't use the rooftop pool because it was too cold outside. I went up there to look around, and noticed that the view wasn't very good. There are also 3 hot tubs up there. The concierge desk was very helpful in recommending a nearby Dim Sum restaurant for lunch (Serenade at HK Cultural Center) plus looking up museum hours for me. They also wrote out destination names in Chinese on a card that I could hand to taxi drivers.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flying_Dragon34
Reviews.Content: good hotel and good location on the Tsim Sha Tsui side. This location is excellent for people that want to see the sights and go for shopping. It is also close to the ferry to go to Macau or Hong Kong etc... Malls and shopping streets are all nearby. Short walk to the MTR. Excellent views of the Hong Kong Island side. Rooms are nice size and are well equipped. The location however for business is not ideal as most of the large corporates and companies are on the HK Island side. Obviously you can still catch a taxi or the MTR but its not as convenient or as quick.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families!”
Reviews.Author: Buffyanna
Reviews.Content: We had a great time staying at the Sheraton! We have two small children and were travelling with one set of grandparents. A pair of adjoining rooms worked out perfectly for us. Our little one slept in the King bed between the two of us while our older child was quite comfortable in her own rollaway bed. The extra rollaway bed made the room a little snug but we were still able to lay out two large luggages, one in the lazy butler and the other on the dresser. The bathroom was fantastic for showering small kids and the adjoining rooms meant that the grandparents could supervise when mom and dad went exploring Nathan Road and the various night markets in the evening. We loved our 12th floor Harbourview room which allowed us to enjoy the Symphony of Lights from our room at 8 pm (just turn on the radio and find the station broadcasting the music). The hotel location was so convenient: steps away from MTR stations, short walk to the Star Ferry, Afternoon Tea at the Peninsula across the street on Nathan, and across Salisbury Road you'll find Avenue of the Stars (great for morning jogs), Museums of Chinese Art and Space, and the Hong Kong Cultural Centre (where we watched the HK Ballet perform The Nutcracker). The concierge recommended a few great casual diners nearby and we saved a lot of money over eating at the hotel restaurants. Another fantastic feature was Middle Road Children's Playground located next to the Sheraton. Our children also really enjoyed the HK Museum of History (walking distance away) and the Goldfish Market and Bird Garden in Mong Kok (the double decker bus is lots more fun than the MTR).

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for business and pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyboyFinland
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Sheraton on business trips for more than 10 times, and always very satisfied with this hotel. Once even with my family including 2 kids, aged 11 & 13. Location is great, take the Nathan Road exit from the downstairs lobby (avoid the street hustlers on the street selling fake watches etc). and enjoy HK. Across the street you can find the Walkway of Stars and the views across the bay to the HK Island. Always try to get a room with Harbour View, it pays off. Also, the Towers lounge is a must. Tip: if you are staying at the top floors, try to avoid rooms near the elevator shafts: the noise of the elevator engines at night will keep you up and unhappy!

Reviews.Title: “Post Card View”
Reviews.Author: livesinhotels
Reviews.Content: As others have said if you get a harbor view you’re in for a treat. This time of year the building skyline is lit with Christmas themes. If you can't get this view make sure you at least stay in the Towers to have access to the Club Floor. This gives you the harbor view without the room price. Club floor also includes h free cocktails from 5:30-8:00pm with a good appetizer buffet and great little desserts. I have stayed in this property many times and gave it three stars because the suites are small and they need to be freshened up. Also they took away the laundry amenity which was a couple of pcs. Per day. It has been cut back to 1 pc. pressing on arrival and shoe shine. Another reason I gave it three stars is the internet service is PAINFULLY SLOW! YOU CANNOT USE V.O.I.P. Also the rooms are small in relation to price. The location is perfect for taking the Airport Train which connects to the Hotel shuttle station. It stops at about five hotels. Cost is about $10 US and its $25 less than a taxi and takes about the same time during peak traffice hours. The Metro is 1/2 block away and makes getting around a breeze. I also commend the staff in going above in service. My last trip I lost my passport. You require an appointment at the embassy and a police report. The staff filled out the police report faxed it in and got the copy back in less than an hour. They called the night duty officer at the embassy and made an appointment for the next day. I had temporary passport two hours after my appointment. Room

Reviews.Title: “My Hong Kong Home”
Reviews.Author: FloridaBetsy
Reviews.Content: I stay many nights each year at the Sheraton Hong Kong. I cannot speak about the lower floor rooms as I always stay in the Towers on the 16th or 17th floor. This hotel is wonderful!!! The staff is beyond compare and make my stay wonderful and complete. I have enjoyed the rooftop pool, the jacuzzi, the health club and all of the restaurants there. The Towers manager, Sylvia is most helpful and always caring and checking on the guests. From check in to check out, I always feel like I am at home and always look forward to my return. It isn't the least expensive hotel, but in my book it is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Again at Sheraton Towers”
Reviews.Author: Susangermany
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Towers are always excellent. The staff is extremly nice, service wonderful. The MTR steps away, Star Ferry close by. A wonderful place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough.. But expensive now, I think..”
Reviews.Author: juninho_d
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice enough. The rooms are nicely appointed, if a little on the small side, though. I did have one issue with the rooms, in that the bathroom has a window into the main room area. This wasn't an issue with privacy for me, there is a blind, so privacy of some sort if afforded (although not totally as there is a gap at the bottom).. No, the main problem, for me, was that but it does not block out the light in the bathroom.. and there is a night light in the bathroom, which I could not extinguish, so the bedroom was light at night.. I am marking the rooms only average because of this and their size. Bathrooms starting to look a little grubby in the hard to access areas. I had a corner room, which was nice as the extra window on the side makes a nice difference to room ambiance. Check in and baggage service was friendly and efficient. Buffet breakfast and dinners in the "cafe" were pretty good, lots of choice and friendly service.. at a price.. and watch out for some poor table locations, close to lots of people walking by.. Internet is not free. I just think all of this is too expensive, for what you get.. Sure, I expect this is all location/market driven, but whereas in the past I might stop on for a day or two in HK on my way home from Asia., now, on the basis of costs here, i would not bother doing so..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: QueenBeaver
Reviews.Content: We manage to get a 2Nites + 1 Nite free deal (excluding breakfast) for executive suite. it cost me average $380/nite considering that other newer hotels charging at $400/nite for normal rooms the price seems ok. Frankly, how bad can a hotel be if its just beside the Peninsula. Location is fantastic! just less than 5 mins from MTR & shopping centers. There's even an underpass (3 mins) to SOGO that's opp the hotel. There's all kinds of eatery around us (Chinese, Japanese, Western). We are spoil for choice. Service from the staff especially the Concierge is WONDERFUL! The concierge help us make a last minute reservation at one of the "in" restaurants for our Wedding Anniversary. Room is clean & spacious. To be honest, hubby & me don't care much about view cos we are in Hong Kong. Aren't we supposed to be shopping & eating non-stop in HK?! If both of us want "view", we would have traveled to Bali or something. We got a room in the higher floor so no noise. Hubby loves the bed but I find that its somewhat hard. The 3 whirlpools @ the top level was a nice touch too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service and magnificant harbour view.”
Reviews.Author: Silverbrim
Reviews.Content: I stayed a a Superior Harbour View room for three nights. We had excellent customer service. Their staff (from concierge, reception, fitness centre to those at the health club) was friendly, even willing to help heat my leftover dinner at 1 am. Excellent view from room 1138. Its on the pricy side tho. I did find a little stain on the foot of the quilt cover. I called reception and housekeeping came immediately to change it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: aevegan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business just after an extended vacation around SE Asia. This hotel cam highly recommended to me by other colleagues as did the location. I took a taxi from the airport to the hotel (about $280HKD). The hotel is right in the middle of a very lively section of Kowloon (TST). It's conveniently located near the trains and easy to get taxis as well. The lobby is nice, nothing crazy. The room was a decent size but it had a phenomenal view of Victoria harbor! No need to go somewhere to see the 8PM light show, it was best viewed from my room. The bed was great (as most renovated Sheratons are these days) and the bathroom was super cool. They use some kind of all glass (clear sink). The room and hotel were always super clean. As a Platinum SPG member they also provided free breakfast every morning. The buffet was huge and had all types of food options (from Eggs to noodles, fruits, cereals, yogurts, and pastries. It was way more than sufficient. The surrounding area has a lot to offer in the way of food and shopping. And you can easily catch the ferry or a taxi across the harbor to LQF if you want to party (but be forewarned about the high drink prices in LQF). The hotel also has a rooftop bar which is pretty cool too. Finally, existing the hotel was easy too. I hopped on the free bus which stops just outside the hotel and takes you to the Air train station. You can check-in for your flight and drop your luggage at the train station (which is awesome) and then get on the train to the airport). The whole trip took a little less than an hour and cost HKD90. All in all I had a wonderful stay at this property and I would definitely stay there again. Cheers and safe travels.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in all of Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelguy
Reviews.Content: I have frequented this hotel given its superb location. Situated in Kowloon, there are countless things to do. And located across the road from the harbour, gives it the best views of any hotel in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to experience Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: joe c
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel only 3 days prior to arrival and got a very good price. The location is great, close to the ferry, on the train line, lots of shops near buy. The hotel was very clean, great rooms, great bedding, lots of computers to use for free, Staff went out of thier way to help with anything we needed. A great value. No one in our group of 4 speaks Chinese, we had no problem with the language. A great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: feibeesi
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights to attend a conference held at the InterContinental across the road. Got a Harbour View Room and a great unobstructed view across Victoria Harbour. You could catch the nightly Sound and Light Show from the comfort of your room. Both public area and rooms are well appointed and location is great (2 minutes walk to the MTR and Tsim Sha Tsui shopping district is right at your doorstep. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “nothing special for me...”
Reviews.Author: idontlikechina
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights on a rate that had both breakfast and internet included, so that was a plus. But for what was about $330 a night, I didn't see it of value. I wasn't about to spend anotehr $75-100 bucks for a harbor view, as I am sure the room would hav ebeen the same anyway. The room was OK. Bathroom was a bit small, but functional. The room was OK, bed was hard (not like the Sheraton beds in the USA) but the work area was nice. Internet was OK speed, no issues there (wired connection). TV channel selection OK and typical of what HK has to offer. Breakfast was also just OK. Nice selection, nothing to complain about. Location was also just OK for me. Being near the harbor is nice, but as someone else mentioned, you need to deal with Nathan Road crowds if you venture up Nathan and also need to deal with the idiots and their suits and copy bags crap constantly. I rate this average only because it's just average to me for Hong Kong. Hong Kong hotel prices have skyrocketed over the last year again and it take at least $300 a night to get just get an average hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “The best service ever!”
Reviews.Author: AllanPage
Reviews.Content: Being SPG gold card members we chose this hotel because of the Starwood brand. Descent Hong Kong hotels tend to have smaller rooms at a higher price, and the Sheraton was no exception to this rule. The rooms were definitely smaller and more expensive than other Sheraton properties we have stayed at in China. Service here was by far the best I have experienced at any hotel I've stayed at in the past, That welcoming feeling started right at the door when arriving by taxi. Every employee smiled and greeted us. The biggest surprise came on my birthday. My wife had told them nothing, yet I was treated to cake at breakfast, and in the evening on our return from dinner we found an entire cake, complete with candle and matches in the room. I presume they got my birthday info from either my Starwood membership or my passport at check-in. Because I had booked a "tower" room, check-in was on the 16th floor. It was a comfortable process, with all of the extra facilities explained in detail. The tower rooms did carry a higher price, but the additional "extras" like free internet, breakfast, afternoon tea, etc., made it a better value. Our room was located at the far end of the hall away from the elevators so there was no pedestrian traffic, making this a quieter location. Although we were not in a harbour view room, the hotel is in a U-shape which did result in us having a partial view of the harbour and Hong Kong Island on the other side. Sheraton Hotels feature the "sleep comfort bed" which is one of the most comfortable I have experienced anywhere. The bed was also equipped with two different kinds of pillows and there are apparently more types of pillows available for the asking. I rarely sleep for more than 4 hours but here I got up to 9 hours some nights. Aside from breakfast we ate at two of the hotel's restaurants. We were unimpressed with the Japanese restaurant on the 3rd floor, but the Oyster and Wine bar on the 18th floor provided us with a memorable meal. Location-wise the hotel is located right in the heart of the shopping district. It's an easy walk to the subway, bus, star ferry and Macau ferry. Victoria harbour with the evening light show is across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton standards do not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: Alek77
Reviews.Content: Every time I go to Hong Kong this is usually my choice. There are so many hotels in the city that once you find a nice clean comfy one it’s usually best to stick to it. Location is of course perfect. Sheraton is located on Kowloon side, right on the southern tip along Nathan Road, the main commercial hub of mainland Hong Kong. Subway station is one minute away, good for shopping and having a walk, full of shopping malls and department stores just facing the hotel and, last but not least, being opposite the island you get stunning views of the skyline. The hotel will not disappoint you. Service is perfect and everyone is of assistance. Separate check-ins and check-outs to speed up the process. I had an executive suite on Starwood Preferred Guest floor. The room was spacious, with two bathrooms and small living room with a desk/computer area. From the decor you could guess the room was not the newest but it was very clean and spacious. I had previously stayed here in standard rooms as well and they were clean and spacious enough too. Sheraton’s Sweet Sleeper bed is always a garantee!!! Complimentary fruit is available all day long on all floors outside the elevators area. The hotel has of course a gym and a spa. The gym is not big but equipment is very good level and it’s not overcrowded. I didn’t try the spa anyway. I haven’t tried the restaurants inside the hotel as we like generally to explore the cities and experience local food so I cannot tell. Breakfast is on the hand very good. There is anything you can wish for. From Asian, to continental breakfast choice is wide. If you don’t want to spend 24 euros each for breakfast just go out. Along Nathan road you will find several bars and coffee shops where you can have breakfast at very cheaper prices. And if you need to go to Hong Kong island, I don’t recommend taking a taxi. With a taxi you need to take the tunnel and it takes in the morning even 35 / 40 minutes due to traffic. It is so much better to take star ferry. Star Ferry terminal is just beside the hotel, 5 minutes on foot . With just 5 dollars you cross to the other side and you get to see the skyline at the same time. I’ve always found it very pleasant both in the morning and in the evening. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “You will either love or hate this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nes1745
Reviews.Content: First of all, I like to mentione about the people work at this hotel, they were absulately wonderful and very kind. Hotel didn't meet our expectations but this is not their fault. If you are used to staying at 2,3 star hotels , you will like this hotel. But if you are used to staying 5 star hotels , you will definately hate this hotel. LOCATION: Hotel has a very good location, it is on Nathan road which full of restaurants, shops etc. VIEW :If you didnt see the other hotel views at this area, you might think it has good views. If you look straight , it is open view to harbour but if you look right and left and down there are buildings. If you are high floors , you might have better view than lower floors. We were on the 17th floor, but we werent impressed with the view. ROOM: We stayed at the Tower section of the hotel thinking the rooms in that section will be much better quality and better views. When I read the bad reviews, before we made the reservation, I thought maybe those people staying at the regular section not the Tower. Tower rooms were so bad, I can not imagine how the regular rooms are. Everything in the room looks old, carpeting so old and looks dirty, you don't want to walk without shoes or slippers. Bed was so uncompartable and more like a quien size .Bathroom was SO small, sink was very small. Sheets and towels were clean. BREAKFAST: Since we were in a Tower room , we had the option for eating at the 18th floor or lobby area main restaurant.18th floor had smaller buffee with a quiter ambiance. Main restaurant had better buffee with more choices, not the best breakfast , but it was ok. Only way to describe this hotel is so you can understand "Days Inn with the Harbour view" or cheap Las Vegas Hotel. As I mentioned before If you stay at 2,3 star hotels , this hotel is great because at least it has some view and good location. But If you like to stay at 5 star hotels like Peninsula, Kempinsky , Four Seasons this is not a hotel for you. I made the mistake to make a reservation at this hotel thinking that we won't be in the room that much, we can spend the extra money for shopping etc. I hope this review helps for your hotel choice in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Allie57
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Sheraton on our recent shopping trip to Hong Kong. The position is fantastic for a shopper and we were very happy with our room which had a superb Harbour view. We were able to see the laser show from our room which was unfogettable.
