All the staff were friendly and helpful - particularly Polly in the Lobby Bar where the Long Island Iced Teas revived us each day after shopping! We ate in the Cafe several times and had excellent service from Angela there as well. This is the only place to stay in Hong Kong if you want everything on your doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Rich2809
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel very much. The view from my room was fantastic. The hotel is located perfectly. Lots of local attractions a short walk away as well as fantastic shopping. The hotel has a relaxed atmosphere, very well traine staff and some great restaurants. The room I had was small but very comfortable, the hotel looks a little dated but as with all great hotels, this does not really matter.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location!”
Reviews.Author: SunshineGirl2929
Reviews.Content: I used to live in Hong Kong and for me, the location of this Sheraton is ideal for site-seeing and shopping. Very short walk to subway (MTR) and Star Ferry (to Central). Easy walk to Macao Ferry and Ned's Kelly's (famous Australian Pub). Free shuttle to Airport Train just outside hotel driveway. It's a business quality Sheraton - no more/ no less. Free WiFi in lobby for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Sheraton doesn't disappoint”
Reviews.Author: rockohorse
Reviews.Content: Stayed at discounted conference rate Breakfast and Internet was included But the official Internet rate was 115$ per day Breakfast's official rate was 220$ per person per day (this seems typical - the hyatt was about this, though the intercontinental on the water seemed higher than this) To get to the hotel: Airport Train to Kowloon, free bus to Sheraton, for two it was $140 one way but there was a two person discount otherwise it is 90$ per person (buy your tickets at customer service for the discount) The subway seems cheap, the airport price seems a bit out of whack with the regular subways costs, the highest I saw was 22$ one way but the airport line seems special. We didn't get an oyster card, but you can use them everywhere so it might be good to get - unfortunately i think you need to use cash to purchase it, hong kong seems very much a cash society Sheraton breakfast: Loved the buffet breakfast, smoothies, fruit, all sorts of bready things, cheese, cereal, juices, dim sum, smoked salmon and cold meats, milks and yoghurts, eggs, bacon, hashbrowns, sausage, bread pudding, waffles, French toast, usually an Indian dish (daal, Chana masala), salad and probably more. You definitely will find something you'll eat. They change it up a bit from day to day but most of it stays the same. Great location - but honestly all the western hotels are within spitting distance of each other. The bar are restaurants are pricey! We thought about the oyster bar but we can pay the same or less at home for 4-5 star restaurants. We went for drinks and I had a virgin something and it was $100, husband had a beer at $50. Pool and hot tubs are on the roof with the fitness centre. Three "Luke warm" tubs and a pool. Not really a view unless you consider the flashing lights of the canon building a view. The bar has a great view as do all the restaurants upstairs. Standard room, standard bathroom (ie king bed, marble bath, desk, sofa, not a ton of room but a decent size - ie there is enough floor space to walk but the room is full) We didn't have a view and I think most rooms don't simply because there are buildings in front. The intercontinental obscures some of the view from the restaurant so I have to assume lower down would be worse. We were looking into the courtyard so perhaps you have to pay for a water view and you definitely need to be on a high floor. From the bar upstairs you can see the water but the intercontinental blocks some of it - so i'm not sure what the floors below the bar can see. There seemed to be a Sheraton link in the lobby, didn't try it since had Internet already. Other note - the curtains here were complete blackout curtains, not sure why this was so noticeable but this is probably the first hotel i have not actually known if it was day or night with the curtains drawn The room was also quiet expect for the water pipes, i seem to remember the water turning on and off for other rooms. It didn't disturb me, but i don't think i think the sheraton might be an older hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazing views!”
Reviews.Author: MDJL81
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sheraton during a short trip to Hong Kong, and were generally very pleased with our experience. The hotel is very conveniently located, within walking distance of two subway lines, as well as the entertaining harbour area. A free hotel shuttle will take you to and from Kowloon Station if you decide to take the express train service to and from the airport (which in our experience was very quick and convenient). At check-in, we were faced with a short delay until our room was ready, but this was quickly remedied by the courteous staff who offered us complimentary drinks in the lounge while we waited. Generally, the service was very pleasant, with staff always smiling, opening doors, and greeting us as we passed. The concierge desk in particular was very helpful in arranging dinner reservations for us at nearby restaurants. The room itself (we stayed in a Deluxe Harbour View) was clean, very spacious, and surprisingly modern, all the while offering a stunning view of the Honk Kong skyline. The bathroom area was particularly impressive - very stylish and spacious, with a separate tub and shower area and a modern clear glass design. In our opinion, definitely one of the nicest we’ve seen in any hotel during our travels thus far. The breakfast buffet, while nothing particularly memorable, was definitely good and offered a surprising amount of variety – including both local and traditional items. We were pleased that there were no line-ups to be seated, nor any extensive wait times at any of the chef’s stations. All in all, the Sheraton easily met our expectations in most respects, and even surpassed them in a few. A great choice, and highly recommended for anyone visiting Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Pefect location, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: msubears
Reviews.Content: We were in HK for business and loved the Sheraton. Great location on the south end of Nathan Rd. Everyone was extremely friendly and the room was great. We spent one afternoon at the rooftop pool. It was a bit crowded, but everyone was quiet and relaxing. The pool is gorgeous, and should not be missed. Also, if you can get a table by the windows on the top floor cocktail lounge, the view is amazing. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: igolfCA
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Hong Kong and stayed at the Sheraton. The first two nights we were in a standard room on the 9th floor that was fairly large with a nice size bathroom and very large vanity/sink area. The vanity/sink was all glass and very exotic looking. You could see through to the glass shelf below. The only downside to this was that the area had only two tiny little recessed lights and was very dark. It was so dark that I had to go into the bedroom area to do my make-up at the mirror on the wall in there. The tub/shower area was well lighted. Room included a flat screen TV, mini-fridge, and 4 large bottles of water. The second two nights we moved into a harbor view room. This one was on the 6th floor and was disappointing in that the view was partially obstructed and not what I had hoped. The room was also smaller than the previous one and didn't have the large lounge chair as in the other one. The bathroom was also smaller with a much smaller vanity/sink area, about half the size of the first one. It was also all glass but not as exotic because of the small size. We didn't even have enough room for all of our things. There was no mirror on the wall but instead had clear glass that enabled one to see through to the bedroom and also outside. This took care of the problem of being too dark that the other room had. A partial mirror on the side would swing out for use. A shade was available to close for privacy if needed. This bath had a separate shower whereas the first one had a tub/shower combo. Room also included the same mini-fridge, flat screen TV, but only came with 2 small bottles of water (vs. 4 large in the first one). Puzzling difference. The staff is very efficient, polite, and helpful. Never had a problem with anyone. Food in the buffet restaurant is very good with great service. Decor at this hotel is somewhat dated but the premises are extremely clean. Location is fantastic being at the foot of Nathan Rd. Great shopping nearby as well as many restaurants. Walking distance to the ferries as well as the subway. Free internet at 5 computers available in the lobby. Nice touch Very happy with this hotel in general and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “sheraton hotel hongkong”
Reviews.Author: Marlzy
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent. The staff were very helpful with everything. We stayed in the harbourview rooms and the views were stunning. The rooms are comfortable. The swimming pool area is pretty average. The resturants are nice and the meals where good. The breakfast buffet has a very big selection. Yes we would stay there again,

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: TheSusilos
Reviews.Content: Unlike any hotel in Hong Kong, I found Sheraton HK has a decent space room and everything is great about the hotel. Also it has a good location, right in the south end of Nathan Road where shops and malls spread along the road. However, it was not convenient to travel by Airport Express as I had to switch to another MTR line and no elevator/escalator almost in HK MTR entrance/exit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay with the best spot at Kowloon Island”
Reviews.Author: Amsterdam1975
Reviews.Content: Sheraton lovely standards. Next to Peninsula hotel. Amazing view at rooftop pool. Lobby bar very nice to drink coffee. Buffet breakfast and lunch is a must do!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in one of my favorite cities”
Reviews.Author: christso
Reviews.Content: The location is outstanding since you can walk on Nathan Road for any shopping or food. It's blocks away from Harbor City which is a huge mall and good restaurants. It felt pretty safe as well which is important to me when traveling abroad.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but aged property”
Reviews.Author: Aviator42
Reviews.Content: I have stay in Sheraton on several occasions and this particular one a couple of times. The location is good, near to harbour city and also right smack in nathan road. In terms of service, they are always professional, as the cliente base is mostly business clients. As for the in-room dining, defintely one of the best. The rooms looks old, but the service and the location more then compensates for it. One great thing to point out, there are a good number of channels on TV, so defintely keeps one well-entertain. Looking forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous hotel, best location ever!”
Reviews.Author: vondel33
Reviews.Content: If you want to visit Hongkong, this is the place to be, A short walk to the ferry to Hongkong Island and Victoria Harbour, just near all the best shopping in Nathan Road and many restaurants in the small streets behind. Great views on the skyline of Hkg Island. The location is very central and you can make a 'big bus tour' hop-on-hop-off, with 2 stops very close to the hotel. The hotel is very good and correct, with excellent service and friendly staff; the rooms are rather small but very well equipped. We booked a Harbour View and this is really a must, The rate is high, but we guess this location cannot be cheap. As SPG-member we got a good room on a high floor and surely would come back to this Sheraton.. Absolutely top-location for tourists!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but thats it....”
Reviews.Author: starjohnday
Reviews.Content: Really dissapointed that the service standards in the club level have not improved, you still feel that you are doing the club lounge check in staff a favour by stopping at this hotel! overall the rooms are small and ok. The batroom has a three quarter bath and a shower that need some working out. The location is very good being at the bottom of Nathen road however there are better hotels for around the same price (Langham and Langham place mongkok) If I had the choice I would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good TST Choice”
Reviews.Author: Shamrock_Wallace
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Tsim Sha Tsui have gotten more expensive over the years. The Sheraton in one of the few that has actual views over the harbor. Try to get a high floor though if you book a harbor view room, the lower floors can have some obstructions. Close to the MTR to take you across and what you want and need. But most other TST hotels fit this bill also. You can tell this hotel is getting older, but has been kept in pretty good shape. The room was smaller, but not uncomfortably small. Bed and bathroom are nice. There is a window to the bathroom. Had a good stay. No real faults, but didn't feel the rate was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Sorrento2949
Reviews.Content: I managed to get this on a cheap last minute deal otherwise it would have been too expensive. I was shocked to find that all their club level rooms are smoking rooms and in fact most of the hotel is which sucks if you are a non smoking like me. The service and rooms are all up to par. I don't know what else you'd need from this hotel but given the price you'd expect a lot. I cannot wait to go back and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IN HONG KONG”
Reviews.Author: Skyeblue9
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that you know from the moment you walk into it that you are going to have an amazing experience. From the cleaners to the managers you find expert caring service. The hotel is in a great position overlooking the harbour. However it is the staff and their caring cheery manner that make this a great place to be. They seem to be so happy to make your time with them wonderful that you just cannot help but love it and want to come back again. Rooftop bar amazing as were all the restaurant. 5 plus stars I would say this must be the top hotel in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “The only thing memorable is the view, if you're lucky...”
Reviews.Author: GeogieBrighton
Reviews.Content: Some hotels make you feel as if you being "processed": the queue at check-in, the frozen smile when you get to the desk, the excuse for not upgrading you, etc. This Sheraton is one of those... Overcoming the jetlag, I put on my best charm and win a room with a view of the bay! But it's on the lower floors and I can just see past the top of the building in front... The hotel foyer, on the 1st floor, is not striking. The restaurant, extremely busy, looks more like a Hong Kong Poly canteen. It's not 5-star stuff and the prices exorbitant! Although it's very well located for Tsim Sha Tsui and shopping, I will go back to my old haunts in Hong Kong Island next time...

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: kiwisontour
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. Our room was spacious, clean and well appointed. The view from our window was spectacular especially of the lights at night. There was a great selection of food for breakfast and the staff we found very helpful. The location was excellent so overall we were very happy with our choice of hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location sells, hardly a five star”
Reviews.Author: Kamran S
Reviews.Content: We stayed Oct 1 to 5 , 2011. Great location but that's about it. The rooms ( we had two next to each other for kids) are cramped. Toilets are very average. And cannot be locked - whats the logic only Sheraton would know. One wonders sitting in the rooms what makes them a five star? The work out area was the smallest I've seen for any five star - it's probably three bedrooms combined and outsourced to first fitness. That's disgraceful. the breakfast area is also average. Low ceiling makes it look claustrophobic. In room service forgot stuff. Sugar, iced coffee had no ice, the list goes on. It's an averagely run hotel and a disgrace for a five star. I paid US$280 per room per night, it was probably worth well below half that.

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong on show...”
Reviews.Author: top-picks88
Reviews.Content: An amazing property in the right location! adjacent to Vic. Harbour with awesome views of HK central and the light show at night is an experience unto its own! Loved the service of all employees with gracious smiles and second-to-none knowledge on what travellers should do and booking them with ease make holidaying that little bit easier! From reservations to Junk boat rides, to dinner at One Peeking (Which I highly recommend) it was all done without even blinking and in such a swift timely manner. harbour room was spacious enough with a gorgeous picture frame window framing Vic harbour and Sailsbury road below! Definitely returning without hesitation!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: phillinda
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Hong Kong is a beautiful hotel in a great location. Walking distance to shops, restaurants and the ferries. Location is perfect. Nice hotel bar and restaurant with gorgeuous views and good dim sum (but expensive!). Rooms are spacious with comfortable beds, nice size bathrooms, mini-bar and lovely furnishings. We were very happy with the room, service and location. After exploring Hong Kong, we realized we made the right hotel choice and couldn't have gotten a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, with a brilliant view of an exciting city!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Hong Kong Hotel & Towers in February 2011. When ever we travel we usually chose 4 or 5 star hotels. This hotel was on an entirely different level to any other hotel we have traveled to, mainly in the area of service from the staff which was second to none! If you stay at this hotel, you can expect only the best in service. The staff are extremely polite and go out of their way to assist you in whatever way they can. We traveled with our two small children, I was even offered assistance in the dinner buffet to serve my food as I was carrying my two year old son! The room was stunning, the view was better than we could have imagined. It was a perfect introduction to Hong Kong and I am glad that we paid extra for a Harbour View, as I mentioned we traveled with two small kids - we did spend quite a lot of time in the room so it was nice having a constant reminder that we were in this beautiful new city right in front of us! Not to mention a first class view of the nightly harbour laser light show! I had trouble sleeping with the view being so distracting - I'd often awake at 3am and just sit and watch! To top it off the location was perfect, easy access to the MTR and ferry service, and close to go for a relaxing harbour side walk! Stay at this hotel - you will be very pleased, we will be returning soon!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but this is it.”
Reviews.Author: Rosi-Alexander
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has an excellent location just next to The Peninsula and Tsim Sha Shui MTR station. Famous Nathan Road is just around the corner. Faboulous view on Victoria Harbour and Central HK. Our room was small. Not clean as there was still some dirt on the floor and on the back of the mirror in the bathroom. Backside of (two sided) Mirror has not been cleaned during our three day stay. Bathroom was so small that one cannot sit straight on the toilet. Very big breakfast buffet but everyhing is of a humble quality. For my next visit I'll choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Grizzly888
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the hotel was memorable for the extrestive breakfast offering with very friendly staff, comfortable clean rooms, and brilliant location at the end of Nathan Road. Being close to the Star Ferry and MTR stations makes getting about easy. The Kong Kong train system is brilliant and Australian Governements could learn plenty of lessons here. The hotel's Sky Longe is the perfect spot for a drink and you can soak in the sights. The roof has a pool and 3 outdoor spas which which great for soaking the tired body after a day's sightseeing. All of the staff that we encountered ranged from pleasant to downnright friendlyand you will struggle to find better than that. It was a pleasure to stay there and we will return. Highly recommended. PS. The staff at The Penninsula were no where near as friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “All that a good Sheraton should be; fantastic views from the Sky Lounge”
Reviews.Author: Gobbledyspook
Reviews.Content: This hotel, while not cheap, has everything you'd expect from an upmarket Sheraton in a city with plenty of competition. Nice rooms, great beds, good selection of restaurants with excellent choices and great food. A very good breakfast spread and a decent health club. The view from the Sky Lounge on the top floor at night, over the Harbour, is really worth the (high) price of a drink just for the experience. Staff throughout the hotel are extremely efficient, helpful and courteous. Location is great as long as you need to be in Kowloon, although the Star Ferry is easily within walking distance; plenty of shops/restaurants around, and the hotel is within spitting distance of the harbour front. No free wi-fi. This is a constant gripe in many of my hotel reviews: paying for internet access; how come hotels charge us for this essentially fixed-cost item? Answer: because they can. Why don't they charge extra for running water and lighting? One day this will seem as unacceptable as smoking on planes. Not acceptable in a hotel charging these sorts of prices.Lack of free wi-fi loses the 5/5 score. Starwood management should start to take notice of consumers' dissatisfaction with this at all their proerties. All in all, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Service plus”
Reviews.Author: Bayswatertravellers
Reviews.Content: Great location, 5 minute walk to Star Ferry, 2 mins from MTR train station, 10 mins from Ladies Market Mong Kok. We were offered and accepted an upgrade to a suite (HK$500 per night extra) and had immediate access at 6:30am, great after a long flight. The cafe serves good food and the service is amazing. Breakfast buffet is very good. The public rooms are spacious and tasteful. A solo guitarist played in the lobby each night and there is free Internet in the lobby @ Sheraton link. It is charged in your room. The suite was comprised of a large marble tiled bathroom with dual glass sinks, separate toilet and wet room made up of a bath with hand held shower and also a separate fixed shower. The swimming pool is on the roof. There is easy access to the large underground shopping mall which is under Salisbury St and Nathan Road. The staff are probably the highlight of this hotel. After 4 days we were sad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Audreyow
Reviews.Content: Overall stay was pleasant, the hotel gave us an upgrade to harbour view as it was my birthday. Much appreciated though I though topping up with a little cake wld have been sweeter :) I like the location as it's convenient and yet away from the bustles of TST. I would stay here again if I were to come back to hk in future.

Reviews.Title: “Harbour View on Kowloon Side!”
Reviews.Author: mcphistop
Reviews.Content: The Kowloon side of Hong Kong is the best side to appreciate the lights at night. We stayed for six days in a tower room with a harbour view which was fantastic. The staff there were extremely helpful and were always ready with a smile. The rooms were clean and smoke free. I say smoke free as the Starwood/sheraton website where we booked the rooms actually listed them as smoking rooms - so we were kind of concerned that it would smell of some when we got there. However, it would appear that smoking in general is stopped in hotels etc and as a result our room smelt great!! An advantage of the tower room is the fact that it also comes with breakfast and access to preferred guest rooms on level 16 which was always open and always had something tasty to eat and drink. You had access to two stations - Tsim Sha Tsui and East Tsim Sha Tsui via underground connections. The ferry terminals were about a three minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong Business trip”
Reviews.Author: pradeepshenoy
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers a pickup from airport to the hotel with for 300$ which you do not have to pay upfront and is billed along with your room bill. they also provide a map within the airport on how to reach the counter in the airport on their website. However the cheaper means to get to the hotel is to take the metro from the airport for 90$ to kawloon and then take a free airport express bus which drops you a yard away from the hotel. The Location of the hotel is good , there are Indian resturants around and a stone throw away from the hotel. The travel desk counter also helps you with a map in case you want to travel within hongkong via the Metro know as MTR there. the map has both english and chinese printed on it and is easier to communicate with people showing the map. The hotel has got a shopping mall at the basement for some real quick purchases and is not priced at a premimum the rates are reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, good food, nice wine selection.”
Reviews.Author: billCarmel_NewYork
Reviews.Content: Great location, right across the harbor from Hong Kong island, subway stop right outside the hotel, and right on Nathan Road. Walking distance to the Star Ferry, Ave of the Stars and attractions. The View from the 18th floor Restaurant ( i believe it was the 18th) was amazing we had drinks and dinner while watching the light show.It has a roof top pool which the kids loved. Our second time staying there and we be back for a third

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: jechho
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the towers and had a good time overall. The suite we stayed in had "courtyard/city view", but we could in fact not see anything else but the opposite hotel building. Large suite, but a bit worn. Nothing fancy. Breakfast spread/buffet was excellent, the view from the tables unbeatable. The tower lounge could be better. Compared to the Conrad Hong Kong, where the lounge was outstanding e.g. serving real champagne, the food/beverage selection in the tower lounge was limited and not of the highest quality. Plus it was kind of cramped there, with few chairs. Would probably stay again if the price is right, but I honestly prefer Central more than TST.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location”
Reviews.Author: Have_kids_Will_trave
Reviews.Content: The room was nice, spacious (for one person) and clean. The most special thing to say about the hotel is its very great location. It is in Kowloon very close to the waterfront and also very well connected to public transportation (metro, Star ferry) and numerous shopping & dining opportunities. One can also walk to most of the sights (e.g. museums, parks) in Kowloon. It wasn't the most pleasant stay I have had in a Sheraton since the receptionist staff seemed to be a little bit snobish, but I will go back, since the location is so perfect for a stay in this part of HK.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it will go back”
Reviews.Author: DeniseLock
Reviews.Content: Clean very comfortable great pool and 3 jacuzzis big rooms air con works well close to ferries trains and shopping

Reviews.Title: “Reliable, friendly, beautiful hotel. Great location”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany O
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Sheraton HK both times I've been to Hong Kong on business. I stayed for 5 nights on each trip, and I couldn't be happier with the entire experience. Location is wonderful - at the end of Nathan Road in Kowloon, you have the view of Victoria Harbour and easy acess to the metro transportation system that will take you anywhere you want to go. Hotel staff is very accommodating and professional. When I went running on Victoria Harbour, every morning I was welcomed back in to an open door, with a bottled water and fresh towel. The sushi restaurant in the hotel is fresh and amazing as well. Lobby lounge is well decorated and always has relaxing live piano music. The sky lounge has a great view... and delicious breakfast. Oh, and as always, the beds are SO COMFORTABLE. Overall, great hotel, and I hope to go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “View, service location”
Reviews.Author: 35islandgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5nights in harbor view club level. Check in and out easy. Great view from room, enjoyed light show each night. Beautiful club level breakfast room. Enjoyed cocktails each night with others in hospitality room. Hotel staff pleasant and accommodating. Location awesome. Airport express bus to train drops off andpicks up steps from hotel. Loved the quick bus~train connection.....we usually cab it. Cheap and easy.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hotels in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: thomasiksk
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Hotel & Towers is a very nice Hotel with a perfect view onto HK island. Even though that the rooms are quite small they are nice. The Hotel is located next to the Peninsula Hotel and to the Intercontinetal. If you are a fan of japanese food please try the NOBU restaurant at the Intercontinental Hotel. You will not regret. The Hotel itself has a very nice restaurants too - like the Wine & Oyster restaurant. If you are into Oysters it is a must. The prices in the restaurants are not cheap but they are worse every penny spent.

Reviews.Title: “Always good service, decent rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: Asiabase
Reviews.Content: Sheraton TST is one of my favorites hotels in HKG (Kowloon). Good location - close to shopping, restaurants, and Star Ferry. Service is terrific. Efficient and friendly. Check-in is a breeze. Cafe staff very friendly. Room service and housekeeping staff are friendly. Gym is on top floor - good view from the cardio stations. Gym counter staff are great. Not much good to say about the Fitness First personal trainers. Gym is small, but well equipped. Rooms are small - but so are most of the older HK hotels - Kowloon side. Harbor view can be blocked by other buildings (inercontinental, museum/arts centre). Clean and well maintained. Comfortable bed, double head showers!

Reviews.Title: “Our second time and no regrets.”
Reviews.Author: ozmike77
Reviews.Content: This was our second family stay in 2 years and we were extremely happy with all aspects of our 7 day stay there. Attentative staff in all areas of the hotel make sure your needs are quickly attented to.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean business hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Bill S
Reviews.Content: Good clean business hotel in a perfect location. Service is always consistently good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pedeva99
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a perfect location next to Peninsula Hotel, MTR, Nathan Road shopping. Is a good base for exploring HK. When I arrived no room was available but they gave me a drink voucher and an upgrade to an exec suite which I thought was pretty decent. Room decor is pretty standard hotel stuff although the bathrooms look like they have been upgraded with glass sinks etc. What was strange was a separate room with a small soaking bathtub and shower - but the shower head was really low and you showered all over the floor and bathtub - didn't get the logic. Hotel is very busy with tour groups and flight crews

Reviews.Title: “Great place near the ferry port of Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Andre K
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located near the a Metrostation, the Ferry port and Nathan Street in Kowloon. Even as the hotel is of a certain age already it still represents a very good address in Hong Kong and is a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Never again. Budget hotel charging 4-star prices”
Reviews.Author: LovetheOrient
Reviews.Content: We always tend to stay at higher end hotels on our vacations, but on this one occasion, Sheraton was the only option we had on our stay in HK. We have a 5 and 3 year old, and most other high-end hotels required us to book 2 rooms (weird rule, but we had no choice). This was the only half-decent hotel allowing us to stay in one room. Well, not sure where to start with my rant. First the positives (rather, the ONLY positive): - Service - quality of service offered by the staff is impeccable. Very friendly, responsive, follow up nicely on requests, and overall very welcoming. That's where the good ends. Now for my rant: - Room size - ridiculously small. Just to give you an example, we ordered in-room dining one night. The waiter was unable to fit the table between the bed and the TV. Eventually he just kept everything on the study desk and split. With two suitcases taking up the space on one side of the bed, we were basically jumping over stuff just to get to the bathroom. Horrendous! - Restaurant - The Cafe restaurant serves buffet breakfast and lunch (and I think dinner too). The spread was decent, fairly standard. But the waiting line spread all the way across from outside the restaurant, across the entire reception desk, to the elevators (on all 3 days when we were there). We seriously thought that there was a Black Friday sale going on inside. One of the morning, we basically had to go out for breakfast because our kids were starving and couldn't wait. It looks like these guys do brisk travel-agent bookings, and are unable to handle the demand. Increase the number of tables for cryin out loud!! - Our older son developed a rash from a mosquito bite in the room. We asked for an in-house doctor, they said it would cost HK$1800. When I lost it and said that they should offer it for free since they had mosquitoes in the room, they said our other option was to go to the doctor ourselves (next block) and he would charge HK$400 there. The doctor later told us that his fee was the same at the clinic as it was at hte hotel (HK$400). So I guess the hotel wanted to pocket the HK$1400 themselves. Nice way of doing business - first infect your rooms with bugs, then charge customers for getting treated. I can go on and on about how ridiculous and Motel-6 like this hotel is. Bottomline, if you are on a budget and have absolutely no other choice, give this a try. Otherwise there are better hotels in the vicinity that would offer better service. Never again will I ever stay at this shabby joint.

Reviews.Title: “The Definition of Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: LasBrisasGal
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my week at this hotel. The customer service was outstanding. The room was absolutely lovely, with wonderful amenities, including the glass shower and sink. The built in 110V power outlet near the desk made the late night laptop sessions more enjoyable. The Breakfast Buffet at the Cafe was absolutely wonderful, with more choices than I ever imagined. To wrap up the day, we enjoyed dDrinks at the Lounge in the evening with the Hong Kong harbor views in the background. I didn't point this out to the staff, but they obviously made a note of my birthday from my PassPort upon checkin. I was pleasantly surprised to find a Birthday card and a piece of declicious Maxim's cake in my room when I returned from a busy day at the office. I would highly recommend this hotel. The location is wonderful for getting around Hong Kong using the MTR or the Star Ferry, as well as shopping in the area. I also took advantage of the proximity to the Hong Kong Museum of Art.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rishi_parwani
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for two nights while we were stopping over on the way to Australia. First of all, the hotel is very easy to access and the rooms are quite spacious. There is a 7 Eleven nearby and Nathan Road is right around the corner. There are plenty of places to eat as well. The bathroom is small but it is also nice with nothing to complain about. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay at a hotel which is comfortable and is also in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at a Good Price”
Reviews.Author: foulaman
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Sheraton in Kowloon in a deluxe harbour view room on one of the executive floors. Room was very comfortable with a panoramic view of the harbour. It is worth it to pay the premium for the executive floors since you get access to drinks/snacks on the 16th floor overlooking the harbour in the afternoons, and breakfast included in the excellent 18th floor restaurant with the best view in Hong Kong. Service staff at breakfast could not have been better. Hotel is just a few minutes walk from the Star Ferry and across from the art gallery and concert hall. If going to or from the airport consider using a taxi as the cost is not substantially more than a couple of tickets on the hotel shuttle and you will save a lot of time, assuming the traffic is not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Standard has slipped significantly!”
Reviews.Author: tfarcos
Reviews.Content: This is the last time I will stay at this hotel - have been staying at Sheraton Hotels around the world for years, but they have lost me. They had a faulty iron in my room with a sharp edge on the bottom, which destroyed my shirts - there response was to offer me free transport to the Airport upon check out. What a joke!

Reviews.Title: “Great & convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Bumahra
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location which is right on the harbor so you will get some nice views at night. The service is good and the food at the hotel is also great, its next door to the legendary peninsula hotel so you can have a change of scenery when needed. It's a shame the hotel did t inform us of the construction work going on as it took us a couple of days to get used to the hotel. With Nathan rd close by I think this hotel is a good catch for people who want to be in the middle of it all

Reviews.Title: “NOT SURE IF I WOULD GO BACK”
Reviews.Author: patriciaw9
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is in a fabulous location and we have stayed here many times I have chosen not to stay at this hotel again. As I am a Starwood Preferred Guest Gold member the hotel's restaurant does not participate in the program therefore no points, and the rooms are small and I have never been given an upgrade. We are leaving for another overseas holiday this month and I have chosen the W hotel this time.

Reviews.Title: “The Sheraton standard - what's there not to like?”
Reviews.Author: travelbypairs
Reviews.Content: Previously i used to gush about my stay in Sheraton in Bangkok however staying here at Sheraton Hong Kong has allowed me not to just say that Sheraton in Bangkok is a thumbs up but rather .... that i love how the Sheraton makes you feel. ;) Breakfast was really good and if you're lucky, you might get a seat with the clear glass window to just soak in Hong Kong's buzzling Tsim Sha Tsui in the morning. The staff were all polite, well spoken and attentive. Even when they realized i had a Do Not Disturb sign so they couldn't make the room, they made sure they left me a voice message in my hotel room phone to let me know - just in case i pressed it by accident. Rooms were modern and updated with a large screen flat screen TV with a wide selection of international channels! Beds were plush and oh-so-comfy! How can i forget the immaculate toiletries they provide! Although i must say their previous shampoo/soap they provided were much better than the current, it is still a standard that you'll wanna take some home to still use! ( I know of some of the hotels whose shampoos don't lather and make your hair so dry with average scents!) If i really had to find some constructive points to note --- a. I wished the toilet roll holder was much higher and nearer. You would have to keep bending down and reach out for your toilet paper. b. I felt that security should be tighter, normally hotels would allow free access from the first lower levels to the common shared facilities but once it got to the rooms, it would only be accessed by your hotel room card slotted/tapped in the lift. c. Being in HK where land space is so tight, it was understandable that the view you get would be a really close shot of the building beside you, but i really didn't expect that it was that close. At night, you'll really need to close all your curtains.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure to come home to”
Reviews.Author: bambooculture
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed 4 nights at the Sheraton and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We had read previous comments and so specified a higher floor(8) and Harbour view room, From arrival by taxi the staff were faultless. Efficient pleasant and friendly.Being a big guy the King sized bed with a nice mattress and good pillows were very welcome after a hard day.Harbour view was front and centre and an entertainment of its own. This a good hotel in the old fashioned sense. Maybe not as trendy and chic as some but we will be back next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't stay at the hotel - just used the gym and pool facilities”
Reviews.Author: Zeva2010
Reviews.Content: As a member of Fitness First, I was able to use the Fitness First facilities in Hong Kong whilst on vacation. Situated at the top of the hotel, the gym itself is TINY. They have one studio room and I did check out the yoga, which was pretty good. But most of my time was spent on the rooftop pool, sunbathing and swimming. The pool is pretty small and it was constantly busy - they have a section tucked away purely for sunbathers only, but I was lucky and got a lounger by the pool. The food and drink here is super expensive. One can of coke was about $50-70hkd. They have nice outdoor showers by the pool and a bar area. Tucked in another corner you have a rooftop jacuzzi - this was AWESOME! they have three of these. I had one to myself. The view is awesome too. It was pretty relaxing, but the gym, because of its size, I didn't check it out - it didn't have some machines I wanted to use. This gym was supposed to be a platinum club, but I think it only has this status because of the rooftop pool and its location in the Sheraton - nothing more. The lifeguard and waiter service (for food and drink) were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton at its Best”
Reviews.Author: JWCRiyadh
Reviews.Content: Not cheap, but is anything in Hong Kong. The Hotel is well located for the Cultural Theatre, Science museum, imax theatre & Avenue of Stars which are just across the road. Room was excellent with a fantastic view of the Harbour and across to Hong Kong island. Loved sitting in the restaurant watching the busy streets below. Took us a few days to realise we could actually go down into the air conditioned shopping mall beneath the Sheraton to cross the road ... duh!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and convenient with good views of Victoria Harbour.”
Reviews.Author: chp37
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and great with services for business travelers. They were professional and had a very nice wine bar on the top floor with fantastic views. It also was super convenient to the MTR with the a station entrance literally across the road. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, pleasant room”
Reviews.Author: kokonuk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel (20 Nathan Road) for 3 nights, and it was a pleasant stay because of the following: 1. Clean room with well-stocked toilet amenities (shower foam, shampoo, soap, clean towels, toothbrush and toothpaste, lotion). 2. Bedsheets are clean, ample pillows. Beds are also sturdy. 3. Room was a nice size, even if just a tad small for 2 single beds (I was their with a girlfriend who was there for a shopping spree while I worked!!) 4. Great location along Nathan Road - we could visit the Museum and Cultural center in 5 mins. The subway was also right in front of the hotel. 5. Pleasant customer service all round! 6. I was impressed that the hotel staff turned my girlfriend away from the pool due to lightning warning (even though she was adament about a swim). But I think safety is important, and staff had the courage of conviction to say no.

Reviews.Title: “Towers is excellent value”
Reviews.Author: samatjac
Reviews.Content: I had a short stop over in Hong Kong after a trip to the UK to see family. I decided to have a bit of luxury and splurge for a couple of nights in Hong Kong. I booked a sea view room in the Towers and couldn't have been more pleased with my choice. The Towers has its own check in area which is quiet efficient and very personalised. My room was all you could wish for with stunning views of the harbour, perfect for viewing the nightly laser and light show, and a glass wall in the bathroom so you could lie in the bath and watch TV..there are speakers in the bathroom. Included in my tariff was breakfast, which is served in the executive dining room overlooking the harbour. Once again this is quiet with personalised service. Complimentary afternoon tea is served in the Towers guests lounge and in the evening there are free drinks with delicious and plentiful finger food in the guests lounge. I didn't spend any other money on food the whole time I was in Hong Kong! I thought this was amazing value and would certainly stay there again. The good thing for me, as a solo traveller, was that I met people to talk to in the Towers lounge which is not so easy to do in a larger, more impersonal, general lounge or bar area. Acess to transport is easy from the Sheraton. The only thing I would say is that the mall under the hotel is tired and dull looking and needs a fresh upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “....victoria harbour from our room was a beautiful view.....specially at night!!”
Reviews.Author: kmarif
Reviews.Content: we stayed at hong kong sheraton for 3 days and we liked the service...but what we loved was the view from our room...it was breathtaking specially at night. i remember sitting up late with my wife and admiring the view...wont forget it for years to come!!. since its a property located close to a great shopping street n walking distance from hong kong space museum it was a very sensible choice...we saved a lot of time and money that way!! the size of the room was not big but heyy!! the service and food was great and more than made up for it!!

Reviews.Title: “Consistent quality and service”
Reviews.Author: TreyZ
Reviews.Content: Arrived in HK and made a last minute booking at the Sheraton, managed to get a very reasonable room rate. Complimentary upgrade on check-in to a harbour side room on a high floor with my SPG Gold Membership. Very friendly and fast check-in. Room was clean and spacious, very similar to Sheraton on the Park in Sydney which I stay in quite regularly. Well equipped gym with friendly staff. The Sky Lounge/Bar is a great place to relax with stunning views of HK. Exactly what I would expect from a Sheraton hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK business hotel, nice bar at top”
Reviews.Author: Travel12370
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights for business. All in all a "13 in a dozen" kind of hotel. The bar at the top is nice, their gym OK but a bit small. For the views I'd prefer the Interconti just across the street.

Reviews.Title: “very classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: geoffreyt
Reviews.Content: excellent value,very comfortable rooms with all the extra facilities you would expect from a SPG hotel.If it is in your budget then this is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: TomMcCaffrey
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel in a great location. We stayed in 2 rooms for 6 of us. The rooms were nice and clean. They had 110vac outlets. Nice to charge electronics. Internet access is about 15 US per day. Nice thing is hotel had umbrella's to borrow when going around Hong Kong. Easy to walk to many locations including subway and star ferry. The hotel pool is small but nice for a dip with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: satori99
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights. Loved the perfect room, very clean. The food (tried both breakfast and dinner buffet) is amazing and simple at the same time with a great variety and for everyone's taste. The staff is very professional and nice. The atmosphere is great and the location even more perfect than all the rest. So close to the ferry and to the metro. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Expectation Gap”
Reviews.Author: jp63670
Reviews.Content: I'm a Starwood Platinum member and I chose to stay at the Sheraton because I wanted Club lounge access. Let's face it, they usually provide a nice environment to chill out after a long day. Unfortunately I was extremely disappointed in what I found at this hotel. Their lounge is in an interior room with no windows. They have a Towers Lounge, which is what I thought I'd have access too, but this was not the case.Their Platinum Lunge is pathetic. The hotel is for sure in a great location, and if you're not making a decision based upon an expectation that you'd have a nice lounge in which to relax, then go for the hotel. I won't be staying here again. Also, over five days they never changed what they had on their breakfast buffet. Overall a big disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice upmarket hotel in TST location”
Reviews.Author: travelling_syl
Reviews.Content: My first impressions of the Sheraton hotel was that it was it was very inviting. Great views of the Harbour and we had joining 2 rooms together, parents in one room and 3 children in next room. Bit of a tight squeeze for the 3rd bed. Breakfast is served buffet style on the 2nd floor. The only faux pas was the porridge one day tasted sour so I complained and the chef changed the pot of it. Would have liked to try the pool out but there were thunderstorms all week. The Internet lounge linksheraton was not free. I observed hotel guests were not aware of this as they logged in there room no and surname. Maybe a note should be displayed next to the computers before guests try to use it.

Reviews.Title: “good location and fast service”
Reviews.Author: Tittipong
Reviews.Content: perfect for a business traveler who looks for convinient location and fast service.... Good breakfast and very friendly staff at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Is just impeccable.”
Reviews.Author: jc_singapore
Reviews.Content: Room is big for 3 adults and especially layout of the toilet, is just perfect. The harbour view will be even better if we were on the 10th flr and above.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, exceeded expectation”
Reviews.Author: Mike_Wong75
Reviews.Content: It is my best stay ever for business trip in Hong Kong. Check-in was swift and smooth by friendly and efficient stuff, was also registered as SPG member for the first time. I was then given a room at member's floor. The room was clean and cosy. I liked the 3-in-1 iphone charger + MP3 player + alarm clock in the room, it simply eased the charging of my iPhone. The hotel stuffs were friendly. Housekeeping was carried out twice a day with the 2nd turn-down service in the evening. Loved the daily small surprise gift placed on my bed during the turn-down of the day i.e Crabtree & Evelyn sample size shampoo, small chocolate bar and etc. The location of the hotel is excellent, right in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui, proximate to all attractions, shopping malls, restaurants and most importantly Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station which makes Free & Easy roaming from the hotel very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely renovated, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: yellowplum
Reviews.Content: Your typical stay at a luxury hotel. The rooms are newly renovated, the fitness centre has a fantastic view of the clock tower and harbour. Location is excellent with walking access to most attractions and shopping venues in the tsim sha tsui district. Also within walking distance to the underground and the east rail.

Reviews.Title: “A belated approval”
Reviews.Author: SPGglobal
Reviews.Content: This is a much belated review and, in fact, I have stayed here on a number of occasions over the past year. The location is great but what makes the hotel fantastic is the helpfulness of the staff. I had booked for my partner and I to stay for Chinese New Year and then again after a trip to mainland China. Unfortunately, on the trip preceding this, I left just a few days before bookings opened to buy tickets for the parade (it has to be done in person unless you pay an appallingly high fee to a tour company for a very mediocre package). I mentioned all of this to Icarus Tso, the deputy concierge, and he immediately arranged for the hotel to buy the tickets for me. He also booked a window table for me to watch the fireworks and followed up with emails to keep me briefed. On each of my subsequent visits he remembered my name - he is in line for a platinum "thank you" card once I find his email again. The staff in the club lounge are also very friendly although the lounge itself is extremely claustrophobic. I have always been lucky enough to be upgraded to a suite on each of my trips but have only ever once managed the upgrade that gives access to the really smart lounge but, in the grand scheme of things, that matters not at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: doogiehowser_md
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Harbour View room. Well furnished. Beautiful views. Spacious Room. Bath opening to room is a nice feature. Great location being a minute or two walk to MTR, Starbucks and Grocery Store next to Intercontinental. Easy walk to the huge Harbour City Shopping Mall. Good dining options. In good company being across the road from The Peninsula & Intercontinental. Sweetsleeper beds are the BEST! Rooftop pool is awesome as well, makes for a great photo.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: shereed
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with our travel agent on the first stop of a Seven Seas cruise and had a good experience . The room charge was very reasonable for the quality of hotel The room had a great view and was spacious for all of our luggage. The restaurants on the property were very nice and offered a good variety of food.. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Big room for Hong Kong, but quite a distance to the MTR”
Reviews.Author: yvrchick
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel, not the towers. I was surprised with a stay at the Sheraton in TST with a Harbour view room. You can see the lights from the evening light show every night - and you can turn up your hotel room's radio to have the accompanying music playing. On New Years Day, the hotel staff did a great job keeping the general crowd out of the hotel and we kept going downstairs to let our friends into our room for a celebration. I was relieved not to be crushed in the crowds below. The room was spacious for Hong Kong standards and the glassy view into the bathroom from the bedroom was odd but there was a privacy blind available. The bed was comfy though turndown service was inconsistent and disappointing - considering how much was spent on the room. The hotel is within walking distance to a Watson's Wine Cellar (for champagne, wine), a convenience store (7-Eleven?) - and other fast food chains. There are also several attractions nearby. The bad thing is that it's quite a walk (15 mins) from the nearest MTR station and it's near the Chungking Mansions - walk up Nathan road and you'll be hassled by multiple people for suits and other services - ignore them, look forward and keep walking. The hotel gym had a lovely view of the harbour with its own personalized televisions. It's manned by an attendant and had amenities like water and towels. The hotel Oyster bar was packed with people at night - which was unable to hold our large party but they offered the wine room instead. Multiple requests for champagne flutes for our room were delivered in a reasonable amount of time. Checkout was efficient and staff were friendly. Would definitely consider again for future stays in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Smashing2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the past May 2011 for 6 nights and like my previous stay in 2008 it was another great stay! The hotel itself... Staff from front desk to housekeeping were courteous and friendly. Only a short wait for check-in and check-out. My partial harbourview room was spacious and comfortable and though the bathroom can fit two people, it's really meant for one. There were more international channels on the television than I get at home. The mini fridge was a bit small and I had to empty it to fill with my own food and beverages (I hope housekeeping didn't think that I consumed anything from their mini bar). The free bathroom amenities like shampoo and lotion weren't of the greatest quality. Free wifi internet is available only in the lobby which is an annoyance when you want to get work done in the quiet privacy of your room but can't. Dinner buffet at The Cafe was quite disappointing. The maitre d' sold it pretty well saying that there's a large focus on fresh seafood, but when I returned that Sunday night only five tables were occupied from 6 pm to 8 pm and the only seafood available was steamed fish and some four choices of sushi. The workout gym is small and feels crowded if there's more than 6 people, but the rooftop pool is fantastic and one of my favourites in Asia. A dozen lounge chairs are available as well as two whirlpools with a fantastic view of Victoria Harbour and a great place to relax after a long day. However, unless you can find a deal the Sheraton is pretty expensive per night. Sheraton hotels, at all of them that I've stayed in in Canada and Asia, have an "American" feel to them if that makes sense. The location... Very easy to get to from the airport by Airport Express and the Airport Express Shuttle Bus. It's about five minutes door to door from your hotel room to the MTR platform at Tsim Sha Tsui. You can be door to door to Mong Kok in 10 minutes, Central in 15 and Causeway Bay in 23-25. Three supermarkets, a dozen restaurants, three pharmacies and dozens of shops are within a 7-8 walk. Star Ferry is about a 12-15 minute walk away. Final comments... The concierges here are great and very knowledgeable. Talk to them for directions and tips on anything you want to see or do in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Came back really satisfied”
Reviews.Author: kogiongai
Reviews.Content: It was apt for the money we parted with for our stay with Sheraton. Our room was one of the best in the hotel perhaps. Wow… it was fascinating to look through the room… excellent views. Everything else was of an optimum match to this. Our room was beautiful and spacious and also very clean and arranged elegantly. Breakfast buffet was more than just enjoyable. In the beginning our proposed accommodation seemed expansive but we came back really satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trackknife
Reviews.Content: Here on vacation, booked a standard king (not queen) non-smoking at a great rate -- well they did not have that room when we checked in, however they offered us an upgrade to a tower room / level at half off. Tower level included breakfast, high speed internet, heath club. We also did high tea one late afternoon and cocktails another, both were above average. Our upgraded room had an amazing harbor view and plenty of complimentary bottles of water. Neat iphone clock radio was useful. Cordless hot water kettle and cream in the fridge was perfect for my coffee. Hard wired internet in room was great for my voip phone calls back to the states and the wifi on the club level worked well for emails and web browsing. Super easy to use the MTR, two lines are close and very close to the shops along Nathan road. Just a little short of the perfect hotel, but so close -- bathroom was a pretty small, especially for two people. The lower lobby had a slightly unpleasant smell, but not offensive - these do not keep me from giving this hotel 5 stars and seemingly a good value for the money. Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and nice hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: happysun16
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a convenient location. Definitely worth the extra money to ask for a room with a view, and if possible to get a room on the club floor (floor 17). It is nice to have drinks and appetizers down the hall throughout the day. The first room I was put in smelled like smoke, but the next day after I complained, the staff had no problem moving me. I found the staff in the Skylounge bar kind of rude and slow, and the food (we had appetizers- calamari and dim sum) was terrible. It is worth it to come for the light show (but next time I wouldn't eat). The staff at the hotel (check in and at the door) are very nice. Overall nice stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Moretimemoremoney
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel for 2 days was good. The hotel’s location is fantastic. We were given a Harbor View room from where we got a great view across the harbor. The sight is wonderful to behold. The room was clean, comfortable and furnished. The staff and their service are great. They are always ready to help. The food served is always delicious. The huge breakfast buffet is something lavish and amazing. The lobby is tastefully decorated and is sophisticated. We thoroughly enjoyed staying at this hotel. A drawback is that it is quite expensive. But we would love to stay again here.

Reviews.Title: “A good, solid choice in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: FoodWallah
Reviews.Content: The location and service are what stand out at this hotel. All the staff really know their jobs and are eager to please. The staff at the front desk, concierges and chambermaids were all very professional. I stayed at the hotel for nine days, attending a conference that was held in the ballroom. The lunches and coffee breaks provided by the hotel to the conferees were lavish and delicious, and were served seamlessly. The only drawback is that the rates are pretty high, and there are substantial extra charges for Internet access in the guest rooms and for phone calls (including "toll-free" ones).

Reviews.Title: “Nice view”
Reviews.Author: HavanaMan
Reviews.Content: Having previously stayed at the W Hong Kong it was nice to come to a old-school hotel with a sophisticated and well designed grand lobby and the usual Sheraton class. The room felt a bit cramped but the harbour view clearly compensated for this. Their breakfast buffet was super value and the evening buffet comes highly recommended by someone who usually doesn't enjoy buffet dinners. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel convenient location”
Reviews.Author: travelwonders1234
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel many times and never once they failed us. Very friendly & helpful hotel staff and room is nice and clean. It feels comfortable and cozy everytime we come to visit. I would highly recommend upgrading the room to the one with a view of the water. It is absolutely beautiful at night with all the lights. Lobby is nicely done, warm and serene! Don't miss the buffet breakfast, huge international selections, don't need lunch after the hotel breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent Good Service”
Reviews.Author: dushaner
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton located in Kowloon area of Hong Kong continues to deliver excellent service time after time. Great location and friendly staff keep me coming back each time I stay in Hong Kong. I suggest staying in the Towers rooms since they offer private check-in on the 16th floor and breakfast on the 18th overlooking the harbor. I simply won't stay anywhere else....

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels”
Reviews.Author: sarojajayasinghe
Reviews.Content: very good rooms (double) excellent service. courteous staff food was good

Reviews.Title: “Needs upgrade urgently”
Reviews.Author: AjmMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tired and is urgent need of upgrade Rooms are small and ugly Competitors nearby offer far more for same cost Room service food quality average and expensive No free wireless internet in rooms

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: MCEAAthens
Reviews.Content: Best location in Hong Kong, just beside the Peninsula. The room was nice and it had a nice view to Victoria Harbour. The Chinese restaurant was very good and the buffet restaurant very cozy, a bit more informal than expexted for this type of hotel. The bar at the last floor was very trendy with marvellous view to Hong Kong island. There was a small open air pool at the top and a fully equiped fitness center with incredible views. I would stay there again if I could get the same rate with the one I got last time...

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: donamiel
Reviews.Content: The highlights :We have ordered a non smoking room but smelled like smoke, the service was terrible, and personnel was understaffed, streetvendor in front of the hotel. And not worth the money !

Reviews.Title: “million dollar view”
Reviews.Author: spencer992
Reviews.Content: As a single most senior woman the hotel was excellent. The desk staff were most considerate and went out of the way to be most helpful. The harbor view room is perfect and the hotel location is the best.

Reviews.Title: “You won't see Hong Kong properly staying somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: edanherg
Reviews.Content: Well, after looooong sessions looking for the "right" hotel in Hong Kong, I'm glad to say that our choice was the BEST! I considered lots of hotels and decided for Sheraton for its location. It's simply great. You can walk t the harbour to see the Symphony of lights every night, it's just crossing a street! The hotel is at the beginning of Nathan road, the heart of Kowloon area. The subway is just a block away... plenty of places to shop and eat... we upgraded to a suite and couldn't enjoyed more. Plenty of space, nice beds, huge bathroom... the only complain I have is that the room was veeeery far away from the elevators (it was on a corner) so when getting back to the hotel every night tired and packed with shopping bags, it was annoying walking to the room. But no big deal! I could recommend Wifi access in the rooms, that would have made our stay perfect. All in all, it's the best place to stay in HKG Kowloon area

Reviews.Title: “good price , but update needed .....”
Reviews.Author: SAIMOHAN P
Reviews.Content: have been staying here for over 7 years .... the price is great however the hotel needs a major update interms of thier bathrooms ... no wifi in rooms . security cameras in the drop off porch areas are not able to record the taxi numbers , so if you forget something in the taxi , make sure you have the reciet otherwise you wont be able to trace the taxi that you left the stuff in . in summary the hotel is a great place to stay in .the staff is very polite and nice , extremely nice . the rooms are nice and clean . the location is awesome . i would highly recommmend this property .

Reviews.Title: “Very American hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Fusebuddy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here April 11-15. Took the 4 night suite package which was only about $30 USD per night more than standard room with bay view. It was worth it because the standard rooms, while nice are typically small for Hong Kong. I like this hotel and stay here every time I go to Hong Kong. The location on the golden mile is great, when I'm done with business, taking a walk or shopping is always interesting. For trade events at the HK convention center, its a short walk to the star ferry, in 15 minutes, you're inside the building. There's a Morton's Steak House in the hotel for American food and the morning buffet is always just fine. For a more affordable dining experience, there's a TGI Friday's just a block away. I've always had great service at this property. There are probably some slightly more modern and newer hotels now in HK. I know some newer ones have opened in the past few years. But this is really hard to beat for service, location and amenities. There is a swimming pool and hot tub on the roof too.

Reviews.Title: “A very good introduction to a Hong-Kong business life”
Reviews.Author: Frankieandcharl
Reviews.Content: What I like with the Sheraton is the close proximity to the airport express, 2 stops away from the airport. It will take you less than 45mins and a very short taxi ride from the customs area to get there. The service upon arrival is disappointing, but once you settle in your room (ask for a view over the Peninsula hotel), and take a trip at the bar on the top floor, before heading to Mortons for a steak, you will find it a nice way to start your trip. The hotel is opposite the famous Peninsula Hotel, close to a busy high street, and the views from the top restaurant are breathtaking. Easy to find a taxi from a well managed taxi rank sets you off well in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great views”
Reviews.Author: WildcatNZ
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel once a year. If you upgrade to Harbour View rooms especially on the higher floors the views of the harbour are great. Location is excellent at the harbour end of Nathan Road, 1 minute to the subway, about 5 minutes to the Star Ferry. Expensive but i keep returning

Reviews.Title: “Here is where to stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Btravellor
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel from start to finish was excellent. Everybody was cheerful, helpful and seemed to be trying to make our stay as special as possible. The hotel is on Nathan Rd and is convenient for the MTR and the Ferries to Hong Kong, Macau etc. It is also a reasonable walk to the Ladies Market and the Night and Jade markets. The restaurants at the hotel were great, the staff and the food was terrific. The buffet breakfast provide something for everyone. Our room had a great view of the harbour and at night the harbour lights could be viewed out our window. The room was clean and was cleaned very well every day.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Beds. Clueless Service”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravler8
Reviews.Content: I'm a 600 plus night Starwood stay member plus the same number for Marriott. This hotel is amongst the worst in the world when it comes to customer service, which is unusal for an Asian hotel. For example, when the hotel lost 1 sock, they debated me if I had received all my socks back. In the restaurant, service is non-existent if you want to eat off the menu instead of the buffet. This is the third visit to this hotel, thanks to my firm's good rates at the hotel, but the service stinks so much, forget going back. And the beds are as hard as a rock so make certain you request extra padding. Of course, noone has the authority to compensate mistakes, such as for the lost sock took an hour of staff debate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Rovato78
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about this hotel, it was beyond perfection. Everything about the hotel matched the quality of the view and the location was extremely convenient to everything. I have stayed in quite a few of star hotels, but after my recent experiences at the , I will never again stay at any other hotel in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, will stay again”
Reviews.Author: UrfanK
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel, in all respects. Great rooms, clean, quiet. Sky lounge is amazing. I was so impressed I set up a corporate account for us! Wonderful location. All this comes at a cost, it is very expensive but I stayed peak season. Excellent says it all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with excellent service. Staff are very helpful and professional”
Reviews.Author: IanSydney09
Reviews.Content: First time at this hotel and stayed in Delux Harbour View King Room for 3 nights. A decent size room. To Sheraton's credit they show room sizes on-line before you book. Room was spacious, view of harbour, very quiet, well appointed separate shower and bath. Within 10 minutes walk to everything you need in Tsim Sha Tsui. Free internet 24/7 in the lobby. Great! Hotel management to be congratulated. Our experience with all hotel staff was excellent. A reflection of good management training and recruiting good staff. Attitude, behaviour, professionalism and response to customer needs could not be faulted. Although I had to change my electronic room key several times as it wasn't working. Not once did I get the feeling the staff were becoming frustrated but rather were more apologetic and eager to resolve the problem. We've stayed in many 5 star hotels in Asia. The service was right up there with the very best. Only improvement I can think of would be a refresh of the room decor, ability to have brighter lighting and repositioning the LCD TV to be center to King Bed.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: anish_2109
Reviews.Content: Great location .. business distirct ; metro station just adjacant to the hotel .. very convenient for shopping ; sight seeing ; hotel is great ; all facilities ; lnk@sheraton is exciting ... rooms are good ; staff friendly and helping

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travellingbaker
Reviews.Content: The location is great. It's close to the MTR and the airport shuttle is right at the door. Everything is within reach. Although I would prefer more street food but that's a totally different area. You're within walking distance to great shopping. Service was great. Everyone at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. We were heading to Thailand for a week and then coming back, so we had to stow our extra luggage there and we never had any problems. The hotel is very clean and very nice. We got a room of the court yard, which was fine because we are never in our room anyways. However, one more we were woken up by loud music coming from the court yard and when I looked down, I saw some people exercising. Not sure why the music was so loud at seven in the morning. But that happened only one day. The room is average size, but bigger than other hotels I have stayed in in Hong Kong. It has a really nice bathroom. Love the soap dish that drains into the sink so there's no puddles of water in the soap dish. The free internet in the lobby was great when we needed to do our early check-in for our flight. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just average, but not up to other top tier hotels in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Japan_Expat_07
Reviews.Content: Aside from a convenient location near Nathan Road shopping, this hotel is just average. Service is not acceptable for an upscale hotel. I am a Starwood Preferred member, with a large amount of stays per year and they couldn't satisfy my room reservation and tried (poorly) to push me into a sub-standard room. Deluxe rooms are just average, views from many are of other buildings or even walls. If you're looking for an above average, or even great hotel experience, try another property. This Sheraton isn't a good choice

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: CV_TravelingGirl
Reviews.Content: I don't have a single complaint about this hotel. The staff was extremely helpful and pleasant every day no matter how long they had been working. The room we stayed in was large enough for two of us and very comfortable and clean. I did not see any other rooms so I can only say how great our room was on the 12th floor facing Victoria Harbor. Based on my experience with this hotel, I would definitely recommend it to friends. I did not use any of the spa/work-out facilities because that is not what I went to Hong Kong to do, but I did see them and they appeared to be very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Everything You'd Want”
Reviews.Author: Pedicabber
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Sheraton in a harbor-view room. I had requested a high floor so we would get a really nice view - my sister would be celebrating her birthday. We got a room on the 12th floor directly across from the Hong Kong Convention Center, a fabulous view. It was good enough to get some good photos of the nightly light show. They had a bowl of fruit waiting for us when we arrived, and on her birthday, they brought a beautiful, delicious piece of cake to our room. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location can't be beat. It is at the beginning of Nathan Road, the golden mile of shopping. The ferries and subway are nearby. The room was spacious, clean and quiet. The shower was always warm and had great water pressure. Getting to the airport was a piece of cake - the bellhop walked us and our luggage to the bus stop behind the hotel for the bus to get to the airport express. The bus arrived within a couple of minutes and we were at the airport in no time. I would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view cannot be beat for the price!”
Reviews.Author: NYCshopper
Reviews.Content: Hello: For years I have stayed at this hotel and always seem to come back. In HKG space is at a premium and unless you are shelling out $600+USD per night you are going to have a smallish room by American standards. By European standards the room size is fine usually between 28-35 sq meters. The beauty of this hotel is that it is perfectly located at the bottom of Nathan Road so you can take a train or the Star ferry over to Central or walk almost anywhere on the kowloon side. The next door neighbor across Nathan Road is the Peninsula and across the street is the intercontinental Harbour front. and the Sheraton has the same view! This trip we paid about $300 for a deluxe larger size harbour view room. The view constantly took our breath away. If you are someone who likes to look at water, get one of these rooms and watch the world sail by. The rooms are showing their age, but beds were good, flat screen tv's installed and internet connectivity was available everywhere. Bathrooms are marble...some have a shower tub combo some are separate. Breakfast was included and we enjoyed a great buffet every morning and all our special requests were met, expresso's cappucinos. There was a manager lady Eva who called us by name every morning and was SO on top of things that I must say she and her staff provided some of the better service we have had in HKG. When she was off for one day, it was immediately evident. As far as HKG hotels go, this hotel strikes a nice balance of form and function as well as a beautiful view. It is this view that calls me back again and again! Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “a tired hotel that's not worth any money”
Reviews.Author: notshur
Reviews.Content: I'm an SPG gold card and I stay in lots of hotels (chain and non-chain) around the world.....a mixture of business and pleasure I stayed here four/five years ago....I am very disappointed by how shabby and dated the rooms are now..... I saw the handyman in the corridors with a varnish brush and pot of varnish (I smelled it).....then later I saw him gluing bumper strips on the room entryways. I went to use the gym (free-weights)......any more than two people in that particular corner of the gym and it's one too many !
