I tried to change the weight on the lat. pulldown machine and the bar fell on my head !.....the very pleasant 'personal trainer informed me that there was a "trick" to changing the weight !!! This hotel needs to be closed for a full renovation,... I will not stay here again until Sheraton advises same

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: iyazmin
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely time staying in Sheraton Hong Kong. Was upgraded to junior suite room which I very much appreciated. I also liked the fact that it was located in Kowloon nearby shops and just opposite the river.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: read_review_first
Reviews.Content: very good hotel. good location. food good. would recommend Fantstic view of hong kong

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel if you want to stay on Kowloon side.”
Reviews.Author: cxworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for many years. While in the past I would have given this hotel a 4 star rating, I feel the service of this hotel has gone down. 1 - I am a SPG Plat member. The Hotel has really cut back on the type of benefits they provide to members. Even as a SPG Plat member, I was given one of the smallest rooms in the hotel. 2 - If you get a harbor view, it is a good view from the higher floors. 3 - Service from the front desk was below average. While in the past I would recommend this hotel to friends and work colleagues, this last stay resulted in over 40nights I brought to the hotel, I will not do this in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: gbpatel76
Reviews.Content: Loved the location of this hotel... right next to Peninsula hotel in Tsim Sha Tsui. Plenty of shopping nearby. Great massage spa called Tai Pan at walking distance. Loved the proximity to MTR. The service was good at hotel. Everyone seemed to be friendly and eager to help when being asked. Ask for high floors to avoid any city noise. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Care of people's well being - have absolutely "NO" Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Poisoned61
Reviews.Content: We had to call a doctor to be on standby, after getting food poisoning, the only place we ate in Hong Kong was breakfast at the Sheraton (after getting off a 10hr flight where we didn’t eat anything and only drank bottled water). To which they didn’t' Ever call us back to see if we were ok....and when speaking to PR they didn't care and only offered a Free Lunch by way of compensation!!!!! We are here on a work conference - spending quite a sum of money and have invested large sums globally with conferences around the world. None of this made any difference to the staff at the Sheraton Hong Kong! ... to the point where even the Director of Customer Service couldn't see the value in meeting with the my Vice President of Asia Pacific (who was the other person that had food poisoning ... this was the person who needed the doctor to be on stand-by!). We have never experienced such Bad Customer Service and the lack of care for people in all our travels around the world. When staying in a 5 star hotel the least you could expect would be a call back to confirm that a doctor wasn't required and to see if we needed anything e.g. something as simple as more lemonade :-) All we requested was to be compensated in some way for the food poisoning and loss of 2 business days through illness that (we feel) the Sheraton Hong Kong caused ... e.g. could have included an upgrade package - didn’t' even have to move rooms, just include Wireless and free cocktails between 5 - 8pm. Honestly - I and about 20 other people would Not recommend the Sheraton Hotel Hong Kong and therefore all future business around the world with their limited focus on Customer Service.

Reviews.Title: “Habour View.....”
Reviews.Author: AsiaTravellerAsia
Reviews.Content: Stayed there during the days before Christmas before heading to Disney Resort. Old old hotel with really dated decor. Looks really bad compared to the Sheraton in Bangkok I was staying at a year before....But it is pretty decent compared to other hotels in the area. The view is really beautiful from my room....except that the windows are long overdue for a good cleaning. Getting around is really easy with MTR stations on the same street. SOGO across the road serves cheap and good Japanese food. I really enjoy my morning walk by the harbour....looking at the locals fishing and old folks practicing "Tai Chi". The internet connection at the lobby is really unstable, even the terminals at the Link are not working properly. The staff there however really needs to be polished....they are robotic and without emotions....ask a question and you will get an answer possibly read from a script with great monotony!! However, there is this chambermaid ( i think she is filipino) who stood out from the rest....she is always chirpy and smiley, she even gave extra chocolates to my boys every time we ran into her along the corridor.

Reviews.Title: “Smoker room”
Reviews.Author: openseas
Reviews.Content: This time I stayed in smoker's room on 7th floor (730) and for the first time since I use this hotel I felt very strong smell. Even pillows stink. The room itself is quite small and the sounds from adjacent rooms can be heard quite clearly although guests were not talking particularly loudly. The hotel location and the view from the harbor view room are great. The cleanliness is, apart from the cigarette smell, exemplary. The bed is a bit on the firm side but comfortable. The breakfast in the lobby Cafe as well as the lunch were of good quality with decent choices of Asian and western foods. Check in and check out were quick and efficient. Hotel staff at all levels very courteous and helpful. Apart from the unpleasant smell in the room and a bit small size I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice harbour view from room”
Reviews.Author: Daniel_THL
Reviews.Content: Room is small (this is Hong Kong) but the harbour view is lovely. Great location to explore Tsim Sha Tsui area plus the Tsim Sha Tsui Metro entrance is just opposite. Swim pool is small and doesn't really have the 'harbour view'. Will recomend this hotel for its location and service

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay At An Old Favorite”
Reviews.Author: AndrewBennett
Reviews.Content: Used to stay at the Sheraton a lot on business 4-5 years ago. Went back for a quick overnight while in transit back to the States. Hotel is still amongst the best in HK. Not pretentious - just relaxingly modern, clean and well done throughout. Rooms are relaxing. Quiet. Great beds. Rooftop pool and spas with a great view of HK Island are worth the stay alone. Differences I noticed since 5 years ago: The building next door has a weird flashing light display (which serves no purpose) which sometimes catches you in the corner of your eye when at the pool area at night - just a bit weird. And, asking for Tea in the restaurant used to bring the pleasant surprise (to a traveling Englishman) of a pot with 2 tea bags and a small jug of cold milk. This time a cup of tea arrived. I had to ask for milk and was supplied with a jug of warm milk. Not out of the ordinary in Asia, just a bit disappointing given my previous experiences. Lastly - the Afternoon Tea buffet was really good. Even better than before. Overall a great, quick, visit - I'll be back there asap.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Business Hotel cetnrally located in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: martinSinSyd
Reviews.Content: Rooms in HKG are smaller than elsewhere no matter which hotel you choose. It's the same with this Sheraton. But the decor is nice, the room is comfortable and the service efficient. The bar is very expensive and although it has a nice view I'd recommend to pick somewhere else. There was no water in the room except the expensive Evian on the day of arrival which is a bit of a letdown at a hotel that charges USD 200++. it was fixed on the subsequent days. There are cheaper places of the same quality and there are better quality places at the same price. But if you want to stay centrally in Kowloon, close to MTR, Star Ferry and the harbor front then this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Valuable harbor view suite”
Reviews.Author: Sutty K
Reviews.Content: I stay in harbor view suite(1002) at ten floor on New year eve. Location is OK in transportation from Kawloon airport rail station walk through Element shopping then skywalk to Austin station then take subway to TST ( shuttle bus is out from Closed Nathan road ) hotel is at K exit.I arrived. at 7 pm reception is prompt to check in with welcome smile with described my suite is very good view(although is look tired from all day work.Very long distance from elevator to suite. The suite is so huge at left side corner opposite intercontinental hotel with 3 television with 6 divided part 1) entrance, will see large closet for shoe 2) walk-in wardrobe with two smooth Yukata, iron big sized safe 3) office desk with fax machine , TV, refrigerator, Minibar and view of sea and all type of plug 4) wet room is ultimately clean in the middle between office room and bed room that separate in three part first Bathtube and shower, second. powder sink that transparency glass with full amenities(include tooth brush paste and mouthwash), third. two toilet and another well equipped glass sink however amount of shampoo shower gel is little and not impressive ( self sheraton brand ) 5) Bedroom due to corner room you will see good view from two glass but had intercon and newworld tower & television at corner obscure some view . daybath sofa and ipod station,two mineral water and choccolate is complimentary. Bed! is firm no special mattress topper (such as down/feather ) with feather duvet? and feather pillow? ( I sleep on duvet because I want soften bed) 6) living room ,it is highlight as reception told me panoramic view of Hong-kong Island since Hongkong convention center. to. IFC2 building that made me so happy with symphony of light and countdown to 2011 firework of IFC2 & other buildings that valuable for me because not to crowded with million visitors at victoria harbor for seeing celebration, Moreover weLcome greeting with cards, basket of fruits(seedless grapes, one apple, few banana), a bag of cookies , a bottle of 2008 australian red wine for compliment about security is OK , he checked me is really guest when comeback in 2.30 am with strong noise. Fitness center(fitness first brand) at top floor well equipped with good view with harbor and Peninsula hotel, but small sauna area. On the roof you will have short distance warm swimming pool and private jacuzzi but I think closed time is too short. At check out reception and concierge is very enthusiasm with quick and very polite. Conclusion I think suite is ultimately clean look new no any bad smell with superior view and cheap when compared to other five star hotel, Staffs is efficiency on their duty , Cons are sweet sleeper bed TM is should be improved (too firm and no any topper for comfort) and shampoo or shower gel is should be improved in quality and quantity .

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_WLG
Reviews.Content: I love everything about this hotel! The hotel itself is modern, clean and has exceptional service. My room was clean and a good size with a comfortable bed. The hotel breakfast is also very good with a good range of Western and Chinese food. There is also a good travel center in the hotel with very friendly staff to help with sightseeing.Foreign exchange is also available. The location is excellent, a very short walk across the road to the waterfront and the ferry to Hong Kong Island. Nathan Rd is fantastic and there are so many food and shopping options right on the doorstep of the hotel. Overall, I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Place in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: mb2105
Reviews.Content: In the centre of Kowloon it offers quite some possibilities to stroll around the penninsula... The rooms are good from their size. Equipped with amenities. Looking from the bathroom directly to the room. Good quality of beds and of linen. Don't try the Spa. It's integrated in a chain of fitness centres and just there to make money... Prices are too high and quality of massage is poor. The plus of this hotel is that rates on Kowloon side are much cheaper than on Hong Kong Side. Otherwise I would recommend to go on the Hong Kong side by looking for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Harbour View”
Reviews.Author: ExploreinLuxury
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in Kowloon. You have to stay in a Harbour View room to appreciate the hotels location. We initially booked a deluxe room and upgraded to Harbour View to take in the spectatular view of the Harbour and of Hong Kong Island. If i visit Hong Kong again i will stay in Hong Kong island which is more modern. Kowloon is still a bit cultural.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it. Can't wait till next visit”
Reviews.Author: Fizzer59
Reviews.Content: Booked a Harbour View room in the towers and upgraded to deluxe HV Room. The view at night was unbelieveable. The check in professional, friendly , efficient and helpful. The lounge was great and my only reservation would be that it's perhaps it's a little too small as it'shard to get a table. The service was impeccable and the snacks/ hors d'ouevres a cut above those in many Starwood lounges. The choice of available drinks certainly was. My wife loved the champagne while watching the Symphony of Lightb show. The room was extremely pleasant and larger than I had expected for a hotel whereproperty pricesareso high. Much roomier than similar class hotels in Tokyo for example. Breakfast upstairs was perfect every day, with impeccable service again, as well as a spectacular view. The food was pretty good too. Loved the aloe vera yoghurt. The location is to die for and I cannot think of a better reason to stay . Had 5 nights in the fall and looking forwards to several more next month.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the Sheraton in HKG”
Reviews.Author: leilani-scottie
Reviews.Content: The service is fantastic. Extreamly welcoming, friendly, polite the list of positive's can go on forever. The room is huge even for a standard room and very clean with a great view of the city. The location is fantastic you are in the middle of the shopping empire of Hong Kong with Victoria Harbour right across the road. The MTR is right across the road and only 3min ride to Central on Hong Kong Island. The amenties of the hotel are great. It's got a fantastic gym, pool & Spa We loved every minute of our stay in the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great Servcie”
Reviews.Author: DiploJ
Reviews.Content: We had a great four-night stay at the Sheraton over Christmas. Prior to arriving in Hong Kong, the staff were very responsive to my e-mails about the room, airport transportation, etc. and the quality of service was sustained throughout our trip. The concierge was immensely helpful, the harbor view great, and our room comfortable and well-appointed. The location can't be beat. We were also pleasantly surprised by the quality and variety of the breakfast buffet, although it is on the expensive side. Despite the fact that we stayed at the hotel during a very busy holiday weekend, we did not have any problems during our stay. My one criticism (which I often have for higher-end hotels) is that wireless is not available for free in the rooms. If I can stay at a cheap hotel in Vietnam and get free internet in my room, why can't I do it at a 5-star hotel in Hong Kong? Overall, we would definitely recommend this hotel for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: RashmiSharma
Reviews.Content: We stayed in December 2010 having booked three harbour view rooms. Thanks to Management for upgrading one of our members to a suite which allowed us to view a Sunday morning wedding ! The harbour view rooms offer great views esp. of the light show every night. Location is superb, bang next to MTR (Tsim East). Great breakfast. Lobby is quite small. Staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TK1956
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights from 27/12. We had a room overlooking the harbour. The room and the view were first class. The staff at the reception area for check in and check out were excellent. Even handled my query about blocking my credit card with more than my total bill with extreme courtesy and professionalism. This cc blocking has happened at 4 hotels in HK now but doesn't seem to happen in other cities i've visited. I understand the concept but 1 hotel (not Sheraton) left my card blocked for months after my visit. Anyway Sheraton staff had a solution that we were all happy with. Room facilities on 10th floor were excellent, very quiet at night so good sleep acheived although bed was a little hard for my liking. TST area is 1st rate with Nathan Rd a hive of activity. JUst totally ignore the Indian tailor/fake watch/fake bag touts and you will be left alone. Do not make eye contact and keep walking. MRT is superb, can we bring it to Brisbane? We used Spendid Tours in the lobby to book a day tour to Macau. Whilst the Tour itself was fine, their organisational skills leave a lot to be desired. They dropped us at the ferry terminal in HK and said someone will meet you on the other side. Getting through Customs on Macau was a nightmare, took 75 minutes and everyone had dispersed throughout the terminal. Same happened on return to HK. Simply appointing a Tour Leader to guide you through would have reduced the tension. The tour office were made aware of this and said they would investigate. All in all we loved Sheraton HK and HK. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Solid international hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TravelguyNYC75
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Sheraton HK in mid November. The Sheraton HK is exactly what you'd expect from an international chain - rooms are clean and tidy, public areas are spacious and neat. As Gold SPGs we successfully negotiated our upgrade to their club lounge (discounted additional charge). The Sheraton HK club lounge is something to write home about. It is open 24hours a day which come very much in hand when jet lagged. Their breakfast and pre-dinner canapés services are excellent and accompanied by premium wines and spirits. Another amenity worth mentioning at this property is the gym. While it is not a big room, the gym at Sheraton HK is extensive allowing a real full work-out. From a location point-of-view, it can't really get much better as the Sheraton is right above a subway station on Nathan Rd overlooking the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location small but nicely appointed room.”
Reviews.Author: EarnyinLA
Reviews.Content: You really can't ask for a better location in Hong Kong. There is a subway station right behind the hotel, plenty of places to shop within a block away, and a great view at night. I wish I had more time to spend at this hotel since I paid a premium for the hotel but I only had time to sleep and leave the next morning. The room was pretty small compared to other western brand hotels I've stayed at in Hong Kong. I checked in close to 1AM and there was one other person in front of me, another staff member saw that I was in line and came out to assist me in checking in. Once I was in the room, the bed took up most of the room and there was a table and big lcd tv. The bathroom was clean and was spacious. I liked the glass sink, I've never seen one before. The bed was very comfortable and the room was quiet so I slept well that night. I would stay here again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Strategic Location”
Reviews.Author: ChloeTeah
Reviews.Content: During our trip to HK, my partner and I put up at two hotels, both at Tsim Sha Tsui area - Sheraton and Intercontinental..If i were to compare the two, Sheraton beats the latter for its Super strategic location, whereas Intercontinental outshines in terms of its scenic and breathtaking panoramic view of Victoria Harbour... Sheraton is located in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui shopping areas, next to MTR station..and just across the street is where the Avenue of Star is at..What else to ask for huh??!!! Room is spacious, clean, very much maintaining its international standard, despite the Hotel is kind of aged..Service is great - Front desk is cheerful and friendly, bellboy is polite..Oh ya, try visit the Sky Lounge for a cuppa drink while enjoying its panoramic view of Victoria Harbour.. All of all, Sheraton won my heart for its strategic LOCATION! LOCATION! LOCATION!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location....”
Reviews.Author: James_wu
Reviews.Content: Free internet in the lobby area... also in the Link area. Dont miss the roof top pool and hot tub with views of HK harbour

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, But Moderate Value”
Reviews.Author: JMW405
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location - this hotel is situated right in TST facing Hong Kong Harbor. Very convenient to cultural centers, shopping areas, and beautiful harbor front. Staff is highly professional and very helpful. However room is small and relatively expensive. Harbor view room is great but can be noisy from traffic below. Coffee shop offer excellent Western and Chinese food but is relatively expensive. Sky Lounge offers best view of Hong Kong harbor (its worthwhile to stop by at night even if you do not stay at this hotel.) Business floor has incredible staff but again only drawback is room is relatively small.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, 18th floor sky bar view stunning”
Reviews.Author: Travelefes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at the end of Nathan Road at the Kowloon side near the Tsim Tsa Tsui MTR station. It's a good hotel for business travellers, two MTR stops away from Central at Hong Kong Island. When I arrived I found out I had by accident booked a smoking room (or rather, had forgotten to book a non-smoking room). Unfortunately the hotel was full so I tried to stay in the smoking room for 20 minutes ( they came and sprayed the room to get rid of the odour) but I couldn't stay in that room. At the front desk I asked again for a non smoking room, admitting it was my mistake and would pay for an upgrade to bigger room if needed as long as it was on a non smoking floor. The receptionist helped me saying I couldnt stay in a room I didnt like for 10 days and he found me after a lot of reshuffeling a corner room on a non smoking floor at no additionak cost. so as far as I am concerned, great service. I will surely come and visit again. Overall all the staff were very friendly and helpfull, a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “My first choice in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: JamesWYC
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel many times, and our last stayed was on Aug this year. We stayed in the Tower Floor and everything were great. There are only two things that I think the hotel should know, first the gym on top our suite created very terrible noise, second, the breakfast on the lounge was abit too complicated to understand and to order, limited choice too! Hope to see improve?!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasing and functional experience”
Reviews.Author: ge90
Reviews.Content: Situated on Nathan Road, the Sheraton proved an very acceptable base for exploring Hong Kong. The Harbour View room did have a good view of the harbour- an endless visual feast. The room was on the small side and the price was on the high side, but all the decor and fittings were of high quality. Good generic 4-5 star hotel. Breakfast room was usually very busy- a bit of a madhouse, an not very attractive room but very functional and the food was reasonably good. Gym was very good. Staff OK. Shame reception is not on ground floor but no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Service and Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: kathy71356
Reviews.Content: I don't have a single thing that I don't like about this hotel. The service is great - from the front desk to the concierge to the housekeeping department. Everything is tip-top. They have many great restaurants. The breakfast buffett in the morning is exceptional. The Sky Lounge on the 17th floor has a spectaculor view of Victoria Harbor. There is also a Morton's Steakhouse, a Chinese restaurant, and a Japanese Restaurant. It is very close to the MTR and the ferry. There is a great outdoor pool on the roof of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Hong Kong - book a Harbour View”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller99
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the weekend & were given a low floor room, but the kind lobby clerk said if we changed after one night we could have a high floor for the rest of the week - do ask for this, it is essential. Waking up & going to bed with the wonderful view is something I shall remember forever, I wish we were still there!. This hotel is half the price of the Intercontinental or Peninsula & no awful dress code either, so highly recommended. The room was also much bigger than I was expecting, and everything was lovely. If I have any criticism it is that the carpet in the room is very 70s swirly, and looks quite old. Otherwise the room was perfect, great breakfast & perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - Service beyond expectation”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Papa
Reviews.Content: We were family 5 ( 2 adults, 3 young kids). We were greeted at the airport by the hotel. After the formalities, each of us received a bottle of water and were immediately whisked away in 2 private taxis. The check-in process was smooth and the lady at the check-in was very helpful. The rooms were great, clean, and very comfortable. We received a connecting room as requested and the view was stunning facing the harbour. Although we could eat our breakfast on the 17th floor, the check-in lady highly recommended to use the THE CAFE in the lobby since we had small children. The CAFE was great. We were always greeted with a smile and we had enough variety for the children. You should try their Berry Smoothy. Even the kids loved it. What a way to get fruits and veggies in them. The day before we left I wanted to use the computers but were all used up on the 17th floor and the Sheraton Link in the lobby. However, the lady at the check-in desk said that she would call me when the computer became available and she did. I stayed in my room watched TV and not in the lobby. Two thumbs up in my book. Check-out was smooth and our drop off back at the airport was excellent. The driver was very chatty and gave a play-by-play commentary on all the areas we passed. In other words we got a city tour for free. The best part is when we got home. Before I realized it, Sheraton Hong Kong emailed us that we left our blackberry charger in one of the rooms. They offered to mail it to us in Canada and we gladly accepted. Within a couple of days through express mail, I received my charger. Now that was the cherry on top. Service beyond expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Views. However rooms are small”
Reviews.Author: DLMC88
Reviews.Content: I took my family on vacation and we chose this hotel as I was a Starwood Platinum member and this was one of the more reasonably priced Starwood properties in Hong Kong. The location truely is terrific right in front of the Harbour on Kowloon side. Being a Starwood Platinum member I was upgraded to the Harbour view room which was terrific as you can watch the laser and light show from your room and the view is spectacular. The disappointment is that the room is very small in size compared to other properties i have stayed at around the world. The service at the hotel is terrific as all the staff are very friendly and helpful during our stay however we found the cleanliness and attention to detail in the room lacking at times. The door to our bathroom had significant stains on it and during our whole stay this was not noticed and cleaned. The other major disappointment was lounge access at this hotel. I checked prior to booking whether there was a lounge and was told yes however in reality the lounge at this hotel is not what i come to expect from other Starwood properties. The lounge here was just one small room with a coffee machine. This was truely a disappointment. All this aside the location was truely convenient as Star Ferry was just across the road and we could catch the ferry across to Hong Kong. There are also several MTR stations all within walking distance of the hotel. The added bonus is the proximity of this hotel to the shopping precint in Tsim Tsa Tsui and great restaurants all around. I am recommending this hotel base on its location and service vs its price point - however it will need to pick up its act on attention to detail and the small room they use as a Starwood lounge.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with spectacular views”
Reviews.Author: Beachbabe71
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! We stayed for 6 nights and would have happily stayed longer. Firstly, the position of the hotel is brilliant, right at the tip of Nathan Road, next door to the Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station and a five minute walk from the Star Ferry. Secondly, the hotel commands spectacular views of the harbour across to Hong Kong Island - the very view you see in all the postcards! We were lucky enough to stay in a harbour view room on the 15th floor and I would highly recommend reserving one of these rooms if possible. We paid a bit extra to have access to the Towers facilities (this is the term the hotel uses for their executive club) and I think is what made our stay so special. The Towers breakfast in the Oyster Bar (on the 18th floor overlooking the harbour) was wonderful and the afternoon tea and evening drinks and canapes in the club lounge were a real treat. The only negative here was that the lounge is quite small and there were times when we couldn't find a seat. The hotel might want to look at this and consider how to cope with overflow on busy days. As Towers guests we were also entitled to a HK$100 laundry allowance per person per day - enough to have one pair of shorts and a t-shirt washed - a real bonus. The room was not huge but big enough and very comfortable with all the amenities you could ask for. The bathroom was gorgeous and spacious with two sinks, a big bath, a large rainwater shower and a window which allowed you to look out to the view from the bathroom! The staff were all very polite, some less friendly and personable than others, but all helpful and accommodating. We also made good use of the rooftop pool which was terrific for cooling down after a hot, exhausting day of sightseeing. Hong Kong is such a hectic, overwhelming city and it was wonderful to be able to take sanctuary in the Sheraton at the end of each day. Overall, this was a fantastic experience and we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: chloees
Reviews.Content: I was really happy with our choice to stay at the sheraton! we arrived at the hotel at approx 7:30am me and my sister had booked a harbour view room but on arrival upgraded to the deluxe harbour view room for $150AUD and was worth every cent. Good size room with a good bathroom. The beds were nice and comfy and we had a great view of the harbour ( we were on the 7th floor). I found all the staff very helpful and the location is fantastic I will defidently stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't get lost in the shopping arcade!”
Reviews.Author: Middle_Aged_Man
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. Pleasant lobby, nice facilities and a really wonderful breakfast arcade (from miso soup to spanish omelettes. I stayed there two nights on the way to Guangzhou. I arrived at the Hong Kong airport at 5 a.m. and took a taxi to the hotel. The room (obviously) was not ready, so they let me go up to the sauna and shower and change clothes before I headed out to sight see. After a 15 hour flight from LAX, this was really appreciated. My room was a corner room on the ninth (SPG) floor. The view was okay, but if you want a view of the harbour, ask for one and ask for a higher floor. I was traveling on points, but colleagues who were SPG members and were paying got free breakfasts and a 100 Hong Kong dollar credit toward dry cleaning. The room was very modern and stylish and nicely appointed. The location is very nice--near the Star Ferry terminal and the Kowloon waterfront and near the bustling nightlife of Tsim Sha Tsui, Be sure to visit the nearby Kowloon park in the morning to watch the people practicing Tai Chi and especially if you are a birdwatcher. You are also only one MTR stop from the Temple Street Night Market. Two issues. They have a separate desk for SPG members but no separate line, which makes it difficult to use. You really seem like you are jumping line if you go to it and the others in line just glare at you. The other was the concierge, who didn't seem too informed. After being turned away from both the Pennisula Hotel restaurant and the Sheraton's rooftop restaurant because my female colleague was wearing sandals, we asked for alternatives. They really couldn't suggest anywhere we could go given my friend's "Suzy Wong Shoes" except the Ruth Chris steakhouse, which required (according to them) a taxi ride. So we went out on foot and went into the Shangra La Hotel and asked where we could get a meal. They were very helpful. Suggestion--Go to the rooftop hotel bar for a drink or afternoon tea. The view is fantastic! I would definitely stay there again! P.S. The entrances to the hotel are hard to find. There is an adjacent shopping arcade (The Elegance at the Sheraton) which is very mazelike and it is ver difficult to find your way to the hotel lobby from that shopping mall. (It is done via an elevator). The car entrance is off of Stanley Road(I think) and the easiest pedestrian entrance is off of Nathan Road.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price - better look for something else”
Reviews.Author: jozefg
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately even the good place of the hotel can not change my grade. Staff at the reception was not professional - I had to wait for quite long time for checking. The room was definitely not worth the price. Small, the view was poor. Try to look for pros but really hard to find - ach ... location but Peninsula near is definitely better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel / I will Return”
Reviews.Author: jft1
Reviews.Content: I have use to travel to HK on business about 8 time a year. I would always check into this hotel, they use to always give me an Upgraded room. The hotel had everything that I needed to function from a business point of view and the location was perfect for me. I will return !!

Reviews.Title: “A Palace in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: PeterHeb
Reviews.Content: What a hotel! A pleasure to stay there and makes any business trip almost into a vacation. Excellent rooms, very friendly and efficient service, high standard restaurants and a modern fitness room and roof pool. The highlight for me is the skyline bar with a view of the Hong Kong Island laser show while relaxing with a wine and Dim Sum.

Reviews.Title: “Nice beginning....”
Reviews.Author: praky4
Reviews.Content: I am in fact visiting Hong Kong tomorrow...will check in at Disneyland first and then am booked in Intercontinental in Salisbury from Sep 19th. The reviews here made me also think of Sheraton as an alternative and i called them today morning. I have to say their reservation service is awesome ! Their agent was if anything,above par,and patiently explained features i asked for and guided me to the most suitable choice. They take inordinate care in understanding and providing for your special request,including vegetarian fare, non smoking rooms.high floors. early check in etc etc and try to do their best. Have to say i am impressed and they have successfully convinced me to drop a Suite at the Intercontinental for a stay with them. I am convinced that with this customer service attitude, i can look forward to my visit with them..

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Hotel & Towers - stamp of approval”
Reviews.Author: SuperAdam02
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights - great location, nice restaurants and super friendly staff. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “The right choice”
Reviews.Author: sun4oz
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with my husband as he had business close by. It's in a great location, clean and modern which is what I like in a hotel. Requested a high floor and got put on the 15th floor overlooking Nathan Rd so was pleased that they could accomodate. The rooms were modern and very clean. They were also quiet. The bed was a bit hard but everyone else I spoke to found it to be heaven - must just be me. Breakfast was also nice and well prepared. Liked the way staff greeted you at the door and were willing to help you if need be. Will definately come back here. Oh, and the rooftop pool. Very nice to just go and relax from the busy streets for a couple of hours. Most enjoyable!!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OttVanTor
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel about 10 times a year and it's fantastic - great value, great staff and great service. Centrally located is another positive. Conceirge service is friendly and helpful. Rooms are well appointed, as a platnium guest the upgrade to the suite is always great. The harbour view rooms are small for sure and when I first stayed at the hotel, I walkedstraight out of the room and back to reception - there literally was not enough space to put a single suitcase on the ground flat. Was upgraded straight away again with friendly service. The platnium lounge needs upgrading and maybe a window and I know the guest services manager has listened to guests and made some recommendations to the hotel. At least they have now stopped smoking on the 9th floor - it was totally gross walking through the stink to get to the platnium lounge until this summer. All in all, great value, great location with fridnely staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel-centrally located”
Reviews.Author: TanmayB
Reviews.Content: Travelled and stayed at the Sheraton HKG... The hotel is centrally located at Nathan Road.. The servie is excellent and the indian food is awesome... The rooms are just about ok in size and toilets in some rooms are bigger than the others... Free Wifi in the lobby is also a big plus.. All the shopping centres are very close by from the hotel..one can actually wak to Harbour city mall..shop on the nathan streets itself..take a 2 mins bus ride to mongkok /ladies market and walk to jordan night market.....A great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Great location, views and staff.”
Reviews.Author: Pashmina_Julia
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton in Kowloon for two nights on business and was really impressed with the hotel. Check in procedure/staff very helpful and room very pleasant - lots of space! Fantastic views over the bay from the Sky Lounge where you can watch the light show every evening from 8pm. Prices not cheap though - around £8-£9 for a glass of wine and £10-£11 for a cocktail. Pool on the top floor also but just didn't have time to use it, unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: mossibiten
Reviews.Content: How lovely to read the comments,and am so impressed that the management reply,not many hotels do that!I return to the hotel every 2 years,have always been impressed and the staff are fantastic.The location is perfect.Rooms are great ,with good views,I prefer 8th floor or above.I could try other hotels ,but Sheraton has all I need!I am going again in September,and am so pleased that reading the reviews the standard has maintained

Reviews.Title: “Service=Above and Beyond!”
Reviews.Author: TravelLady30
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just recently moved to Hong Kong from Southern California. We are now expats in the city of Hong Kong and when we first arrived we had to stay at the Sheraton in TST for 30 days!! At first, I thought I would literally "kill" my husband after being trapped in a room with him for 30 days...but that wasn't the case. The Sheraton staff and lovely hotel amenities helped us to get through our first 30 days in Hong Kong. We had a room on the 12th floor with a Harbor View. If you can swing one of these rooms, do so...the view is absolutley amazing. You will enjoy the nightly Light Show at 8pm every night and also the spectacular view of Hong Kong island. Our room was equipped with dual sinks, a shower and bathtub that were beyond excellent. The bed was very comfortable and the decor of the rooms were standard but nice. Now the EXCELLENT part of the hote was the staff. These folks went above and beyond their expected service...The room service operator took personal care of us. She would remember what we had ordered the night before and would ask me if I wanted it again! She also sent up a few bottles of free wine during the month...Just Because!! The Breakfast at the Sheraton is AWESOME!! It's "Breakfast Heaven" as far as I'm concerned! The staff would always greet us with a genuine smile and "good morning" as we walked up. We were always promptly seated even if there was a line. The chef's will make you anything, you can get your coffee or tea any style...it's just amazing. It made each morning so great!! The pool, the gym...excellent. The gym is a little small, but it is part of the "Fitness First' chains (which we now belong to!), so you can take some classes for a minimal cost! The Japanese restaurant, Dim Sum and Morton's were all outstanding. We tried them a few times and found the service and food to be excellent. There really wasn't anything bad about this hotel. The Sheraton in Hong Kong is good for any kind of traveller... I would highly recommend this hotel coming to Hong Kong. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for business with great view at top floors”
Reviews.Author: Culturetraveller12
Reviews.Content: The towers floors are much to recommend especially for business trips. These floors offer a great view to Hong Kong island. (New Year or Chinese New Year specially to recommend with the fireworks.) The service is very good even for people not regularly frequenting Sheraton hotels. The rooms are recently renovated all over, very modern design.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: tws1086
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at the Sheraton in Kowloon in late May and would highly recommend the hotel. With the possible exception of the Intercontinental and Peninsula, there is no better located hotel than the Sheraton-especially when cost is taken into account You have beautiful harbour views and the metro station is literally a block away. The staff was wonderful with special recognition due to the morning concierge desk. They were "spot on" in all of their directions, recommendations and tips. We only ate breakfast in the hotel, but the buffet was extensive and the service prompt. Free internet is provided on the ground floor-another perk often not seen at luxury hotels unfortunately. Overall an excellent stay with no complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, great views and excellent Executive Club”
Reviews.Author: jbacMelbourne
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Hong kong was an excellent choice. We were fortunate enough to book into the Tower Rooms and received Executive Club benefits. It was certainly worth the additIonal cost. Great breakfast and executive club service. Sitting in the Executive Club having drinks and canapes while watching the Symphony of Lights over the Hong Kong harbour was a highlight. The breakfast was also wonderful and not the usual continental fare served in other executive clubs. The customer service was of a very high standard. The position is ideal for the metro and shopping. The pool was a bit small (and in particular when our room could see the Intercontinental Hotel pool across the road, which looked like a resort pool) But this was minor and it wasn't the sort of holiday we wanted to laze around the pool. Also considering the cost it was good value We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great service on executive floor”
Reviews.Author: Rodney1977
Reviews.Content: we had an very special time at the Sheraton hotel Hong Kong during this visit. we stayed on the executive floor and very special attention from the staff. Especially Angela Mak. Her team is doing an great job. The temp was reallly good this time, so the pool was really great. The staff is really friendly and assist you wth everything. I definately recommend the executive floor of this hotel when you visit Hong Kong. Besides Angela aare sppecial atttention to Betty, Apoll,Anthony,Billy,Wing,Miki,Breakfast Server,Bon and Health Club . I'm sure we will come back to this hotel with the great service. Angela Mak thanks for thhe special attention, we really enjoyed this. Rgds, Rodney

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sarac_8
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton in Hong Kong is a world class hotel. The hotel is centrally located. We stayed a total of 5 nights. the first 3 nights we had a suite, we had a panoramic view. Large beautiful bathroom, seperate office area. ( Free Wi-fi in the suites only.) Then we took the ferry to Macau for a night, and came back and had a standard room. Obviously the room was quite smaller than the suite, but still nice. The cafe has an awesome breakfeast brunch. The dim sum is great. The gym is on the top floor, and I felt like I was on top of the world as I ran on the treadmill and looked over hong kong. There is also a restaurant on the top floor that is fun to go and have drinks and look over the city. Definitely go to Hong Kong Park and take the tram up to Victoria Peak. This was the highlite of our trip. The restaurant I recommend is "Pearl", floor to ceiling windows, great wine and food. Service is wonderful too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: RonaldvanderBoom
Reviews.Content: I am a seasoned international traveler and have stayed at many upscale properties in Asia, Europe and Northern America over the years. In my opinion this hotel ranks among the best (along with the Taj Mahal Hotel in Delhi) regarding service, comfort, elegance and attitude. I won't belabor the positive comments of other posters; just endorse them wholeheartedly. Everything was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent located good quality luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: alok67
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after considering its location. It is centrally located with fantastic view of Hong Kong island. It is walkable from all shopping areas. The breakfast spread and variety was enormous though we had to stand in the queue in the morning rush hour but the service was excellent. The room was spacious and clean with all amenities. Only thing odd was there was no latch in the toilet, Price wise it is expensive than the neighbouring hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “enjoy the light show as never before”
Reviews.Author: choosyindian
Reviews.Content: this is one of the best locations of the hotel i have ever come across. overlooking the beautiful sea and skyline of hong kong city. in the middle of the central shopping area. walking distance from most places. but remember to book in advance if you rally want to stay here as its busy or full most times i have been there! very mordern hotel!

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: MikeNewYork80
Reviews.Content: It was my perfect place in Hong Kong, I visit very often the city in business and is the best last choice. The rooms in the Sheraton are very large and beautiful, ideal for rest after working all day. The cuisine at the hotel was first class and fantastic, very good products We asked them for some information to play some tennis in HK and everything was very well fixed by the hotel, this my place in Hong Kong. Next time I´m returning with my wife Pat and my kids. Regards Michael New York

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: skhemka
Reviews.Content: this is a great business hotel. it features are huge conf room and business center facitlities. it is a decent location right on nathan road, but I feel they could do more by throwing in free wifi etc.

Reviews.Title: “luxury is a privilege no longer”
Reviews.Author: aky_84
Reviews.Content: I was on a holiday trip to hong kong and booked myself in this hotel. It is perfectly located for one to experience hong kong. On the tsim sha sui road/area, right across to the famous peninsula, stands this very good hotel which will leave you craving for more time in hong kong. The hotel staff was very well trained and very well mannered. The service was prompt and courteous. Even at 2am, the IT guy got me blackberry charger from somewhere and a cable for my laptop. The concierge was very helpful for city tour information. Rooms were fabulous and very well done. Harbour view rooms dont make you feel like leaving. The best part is the hong kong light show which one can see from the window of the room along with english commentary on the radio which is a complementary provision in the room. The bathrooms had multiple showerheads with good amenities. The hotel also has a mall in the basement. which links to another mall across the street. The area is a tourist hotspot and with nathan road on one side of the hotel, one cant go wrong with shopping, especially for electronics. The restaurants are very good, and the food quality is pretty high. Breakfast serves up an amazing array of buffet choices, which leave you belly full till afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff and super location”
Reviews.Author: KirtiNewDelhi
Reviews.Content: The location was amazing - right on the Harbor! This is right opposite the Peninsula. The rooms are clean and the Sky bar is worth a visit. The view from 'oyester bar' was breathtaking

Reviews.Title: “Best price/performance for a room with a view at TsimShaTsui”
Reviews.Author: DavidLau
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights after the completion of a business trip. Since this was my R&R days, I wanted a room with a good view of HK harbor. That was the main reason that I choose this hotel among its competitors. The location couldn't be better for Nathan Road, the malls as well as it view of the harbor - facing the HK convention center. I booked a deluxe harbor-view room as I was concerned that the regular rooms might be a little small. With the AAA discount, it was somewhat cheaper than their competitors. I was quite happy with the room size, it didn't feel cramped at all - besides the bed, there was a glass office desk, a comfy upholstery chair, a console on which the flat-panel TV and mini-bar were located. The room decor is modern and updated. The bed was comfortable with nice down comforters. The bathroom is done is creme-colored marble and very cool see-through glass counter-top & sink. Also unique was there were 2 sinks/wash-basins instead of just one - a little strange as the bathroom was not jumbo-sized. Being trendy, there's a see-through window from the bathroom so you can see the harbor view in the bedroom window. The shower is just adjacent to the bathtub without partition. One negative was that internet wasn't part of my room fee. Adjacent to the work desk were some video connector ports - I didn't spend the time to figure out what they were for - perhaps hooking up your computer to the TV? I was upgraded to the SPG preferred Guest floor - the benefits are 1) some apples that are placed by the elevators 2) more important to most people - free mini-bottles of liquor outside the mini-bar 3) a free guidebook to HK dining. I was pretty happy with the harbor view from my room. The museums across Salisbury Road block the view slightly, but those building are also interesting architecturally. The front desk and concierge people were very helpful and professional so no complaints there. As expected, the staff's English is excellent. Most of the time, the lobby is subdued and relatively empty of people - very calming after walking around TST. Some minor nits about the house-keeping though: a) the glass wall & doors in the shower weren't spotless, rather they were cloudy from hard-water build-up. Otherwise, the room was very clean. b) When I arrived there were a couple of complimentary bottles of drinking water on the night stands. At some later time, these bottles were removed - strange. I had to call house-keeping to get them back. c) I had some laundry done, but it didn't return by the stated time. It was late by a few hours. I ate at the "Cafe" buffet restaurant. Be warned - this is very popular and CROWDED. Especially at breakfast, when it can seem like a college cafeteria. The food quality is good, especially for dinner - where I was especially happy with the food items. Besides the regular business center, there are 5 computers & 1 printer for free use in the lobby - very nice. There's a top-floor lounge and roof-top pool, but I didn't have a chance to use these. Despite minor quibbles, overall I was quite happy with my choice. Compared to its more luxurious (and much more expensive) competitors, I think this Sheraton is a good choice for quality & value. I would say it's a very strong 4-star offering, bordering on 5-star if they can fix the house-keeping issues I mentioned. If I could, I would give it 4.5 stars overall rating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service & Excellent Quality--We Will Come Back !!”
Reviews.Author: ozaer_shah
Reviews.Content: Id like to start by saying our stay at this property was not only encouraging, but has left us a lifetime memory..thanks to the wonderful positive professional staff that run this hotel. We booked this room using Starwood points and upon arrival, the desk agent encouraged us to upgrade to the towers room--and I must say, the best decision I made...well worth the extra $300 we paid for the 2 nights/ 3 days we were in HK. Our room included an incredible view of the harbor, which cannot be surpassed for the price. This upgrade enabled us to enjoy an afternoon tea with delicious scones--soft drinks, munchies, etc. Also after the high tea from 230-430PM, an evening Hors d'œuvre session which started from 530PM-730PM offering an array of delicious 'happy hour' treats, which also included free drinks, and a chance to view the harbor light show while enjoying a cocktail drink (cappuccinos for us) The upgrade also included $100HKD free daily allowance for laundry (which was enough to clean 1 dress shirt), 20% meals/food items from the restaurant, free internet in the room (very useful)...otherwise you can go the lobby (not so convenient). The towers upg also has their own breakfast spread on the top floor. A very delicious spread with a great view of the harbor. There was not anything that you couldn't have within reason. The waiters took care of you at every angle--everything from seating you, to getting your toast, making sure your cup of coffee was filled and hot. Unbelievable service. An excellent upper floor exercise facility which we used early in the morning--felt like our own gym since no one was there at 6AM. Once again, everything you needed was there---all you needed was shorts and tennis shoes--the rest they took care of. Amenities in the room included a toothbrush, comb, lotions galore, shampoo/conditioner(s), comfy slippers and robes, office supplies. There was one asst. mgr by the name of "Angela" who was just phenomenal.....she taught us every trick in getting to where we wanted to go on the MTR and the best places to score bargain deals.....She was also great company to chat about the local scene and Hong Kong. This Starwood hotel has some really good SPG point redemption values--for instance, for 6500 pts, we were able to take back a Mercedes Benz to the airport from the hotel. That saved us a lot of time and also $260HKD.....but it was the time factor that was most important, as the car service was right there, and it was a Mercedes..very comfortable. The driver even offered us bottled water for the trip to the airport. This hotel took care of us at every angle and because of that service, we will not only return to Hong Kong to see the sights, but our stay at the Sheraton will be the second reason to return. Thank you Starwood and thank you Hong Kong Sheraton for the incredible memories!!

Reviews.Title: “Solid, Dependable, Just Not Exciting (not that it has to be) -- Great for Business”
Reviews.Author: traveler60601
Reviews.Content: Like many Sheratons, this is an extremely competent and efficient hotel. Clean, well designed rooms (albeit small consistent with HK). Some have great views of the harbor. Big plus was the better than average fitness room with friendly attendants. Location was very agreable to transit, etc. Not that it needed any -- but there was just no "wow" factor. Which is just to say if you are looking for very good accommodations, especially for business, this is a great choice. Not the place I would recommend for someone looking to splurge or have a more romantic style getaway. One surprise was the excellent batch of apples set out by the elevators during the day -- I must admit I am picky about such things and these were great! Did not eat at the hotel, as their main restaurant is a steakhouse and I did not travel half-way around the world from Chicago and it's overabundance of steak places to eat a steak! Concierge was helpful in providing maps, suggesting places to have a bite or a drink, etc. Overall very happy with this hotel and would use it again, though if I was able to splurge or had a more special occasion I might consider my other options.

Reviews.Title: “Great view; awesome shower”
Reviews.Author: ropavieja
Reviews.Content: The two rooms we booked faced the harbor and the view was great. We stayed at the 10th floor though we should have gotten a higher floor. The rooms were nice and spacious by Hong Kong standards. The shower was awesome (so awesome that we got the same one for our home after a visit almost two years ago). The gym is run by Fitness First so you do get members coming in ie not as quiet as most hotels gyms. The check-in was OK and I thought the front desk could have been friendlier and more knowledgeable when I asked for directions. The lobby's nice and the free wifi connection and computers in the lobby were useful to check for information on a holiday. Location's convenient with the connection to the underground mall across the street and the subway station closeby. Though the area a block away seem a bit dodgy later in the night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DGNYC78
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights here, and must say that the best thing about the hotel is its proximity to other attractions. We spent many nights just walking around the area, or jumping into a cab or taking the train to nearby locations. The subway entrance is actually quite close, as are shopping and dining. Hong Kong itself, however, was less than expected.

Reviews.Title: “A haven in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: woodee1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton for the first two nights of our honeymoon. We were spending two days in Hong Kong before connecting on to Thailand for 2 and a half weeks. The hotel is well situated with great harbour views in the Kowloon district. Best of all is it's proximity to the public transport, making it easy to get around on the various options. The staff were very welcoming, upgrading us to a harbour view room and giving us a lovely bottle of red wine to celebrate our honeymoon. The hotel itself is immaculate, while the rooms are quite small, but fit for purpose. The Sheraton is probably best described as a business hotel, with all the necessary facilities, but provided us with a 5 star place to rest and relax after exploring the busy streets and shops of Hong Kong Island and Lantau Island.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly not what it used to be.”
Reviews.Author: waltersdad
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel for about 15 years and there has been a huge drop in standards since last year. The hotel seems to be targeting the tourist trade now instead of business travellers. On arrival I had to beg for a late check-out, even as such a loyal customer. Rooms looking a little worn in places. Service very variable - some of staff downright miserable, others fine. Room cleaned well, but items not always replaced as used. Very overpriced breakfast - the buffet has been downgraded from what I could see and the menu item I ordered was expensive and not particularly high quality - also not exactly what I ordered. Took 3 tries to get a drinkable cup of coffee and finally had to order capuccino to get that. Very noisy at bedtime - tough if you want to sleep before midnight. I finally called it quits half way through my stay and moved to another, slightly more expensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTING-If possible, choose another hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CanarioViajero
Reviews.Content: The only positive thing about the hotel is its location (and maybe its roof top pool), right at the beginning of Nathan Road and next to the Peninsula Hotel, which makes it very easy to stroll around the Avenue of the Stars and enjoy the views of Central's skyline. However, all the rest is very disappointing: (a) The personnel is unfriendly (the concierge is terrible!!) and not ready to help. You feel just like a number and does not make you feel "at home" (mostly the opposite...you are there "bothering" them!); (b) the rooms, fittings and furniture are quite worn out and need urgently a refurbishment. For the price of the rooms, you would expect modern rooms with all the amenities of these type of hotels (for example, ipod dock stations). The rooms are like stepping back into the mid 90's; (c) The common installations are, like the rooms, worn out (the elevators are, at least, 20 years old!!); and (d) You have to pay to use the internet (!!!). There are much better hotels at a much better price in HK. The next time I will definately look for another place to stay at!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service, friendly staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: JulieCManchester
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our way to Australia. The staff were extremely helpfull and the hotel is well situated for easy access to the fantastic harbour light show. The view from the sky bar is great as well, but you need to be prepared to pay a little over the odds for the privilege. The hotel even delivered an umprompted birthday cake and card to our room for my partners birthday. Would definitely recommend this as a good stop over option

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: hollycat2202
Reviews.Content: arrvied at this hotel, and was able to check- in very early as we just flew in from London. Jet lag hit us, hotel situated 10 minutes from the star ferry, plenty of shopping close by. Hotel breakfast very good, lots of choices. Brillant stay. Little disapointing swimming pool closed for refurb.... was not told until we arrvied at the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!!”
Reviews.Author: kim0404
Reviews.Content: During the Chinese new year.. there are alot of street events that are being held just in front of the hotel.. lion dances and performances. so we had fun staying here during the new year. ok for my review for this hotel. At the front desk, I find the staff there very friendly and helpful. they were polite, efficient and speaks English well which is a big plus for us..(no nosebleeds here in terms of communication). We were upgraded to the executive suite since my husband is a platinum member even though the hotel were a bit crowded because of the season. the check in was fast even though it was a busy night. when we were in our room.. i find the room spacious and clean. well decorated as well. the bathroom is immaculately clean(check my photo's) we had a tub and two glass sink and a separate toilet. the bed was big and soft. really comfy to sleep in as well as the pillows.. the housekeeping does a very good job in cleaning the room. and when i asked them for something.. they go out of their way to get it for me so we were very pleased with the service here.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, solid 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: PoopsieOliver
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton in Hong Kong in March 2010. My trip was for business but I ended up having a lot of downtime so I ended up enjoying the hotel's amenities, including the jacuzzi's on the top floor. Although the hotel might not be a 5 star, I would rate it as a great 4 star hotel. I have stayed at five star hotels, such as the Four Seasons, the Ritz Carlton, and the Mandarin Oriental. I thought on many levels the hotel was on par with these chains. The staff were polite and attended to my requests, including updating my Starwood Account. I was also impressed when I was at the Sky Lounge on the top floor. I had been seated at a decent table and when a very nice table near the window became available, one of the waitresses volunteered to move me there. She was very gracious about it. I am young-looking for my age but thought that the staff treated me respectfully. A front desk member even chased after two floors to return the copy of my landing card that had fallen out of my passport. The staff at the gym on the top floor were friendly and courteous. The gym was smallish but well-maintained. I generally don't like the Techno Gym equipment and think other brands like Star Trac are better, but the cardio machines were well-maintained. My room was also very comfortable and well-served my housekeeping. I am pretty finicky about a comfortable bed and found the bed comfortable and slept well during my entire stay. My only complaint was that on one night I could hear noise, including the TV and the phone, from the room next door, which had an adjoining door that was locked. Thankfully, it was only one night. Also, I think the location in Tsim Tsa Tsui is great. It is lively and convenient and I prefer it to the Central area on Hong Kong Island.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: kwon123
Reviews.Content: What a great stay! Had a harbour view room which had a lovely view of the famous Hong Kong skyline. We were provided with ample drinking water, fruit and bathroom amneties were replaced very regularly: the hotel was certainly not stingy! Rooms were very well appointed but may be a bit small for some but very comfortable and modern indeed. Bathroom was equally nice although small and we had a glass window which allowed you to look into the room. Flat screeen TV was great and so was the DVD player. Hotel location was excellent, really close to everything on the Kowloon side and within walking distance to all the necessary transport hubs. Service was great, everyone was really friendly and nothing was too hard. Had to call the service desk several times to ask for various things, adapters, additional toothpaste, convenience store location and this was all done very efficiently and in a very friendly manner. Breakfast excellent: evertyhing you could ask for and more - dim sum included. Staff at breakfast very friendly and efficient. Can be very busy. Rooftop swimming pool and jaccuzi worth checking out as well! Oh, there is also free internet downstairs in the lobby. Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Joseph C
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton has a beautiful view of Hong Kong island. Be sure to ask for a room with a view, otherwise, you might be staring at an air conditioning unit. The restaurants are expensive (30 USD for breakfast). Nice rooms but a little small.

Reviews.Title: “Central location with nearby access to everything!”
Reviews.Author: rafflesking
Reviews.Content: This hotel couples the consistency of a Sheraton property with a prime location in Kowloon. All of the shopping is nearby, great views of the harbor, and a quick walk to the subway to get across the Hong Kong Island. Amenities, staff and dining are good but not remarkable - it's the location that makes it worth a premium.

Reviews.Title: “the view is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: phil081
Reviews.Content: the location is excellent, with excellent views to the Island. The food is truly excellent, we had a delicious australian steak at the bar - delicious! but not cheap, we had a tiffon the first night (level 8 i think) so had to stay inside and enjoyed the hotel facilities. very close the the main street and shop!

Reviews.Title: “Asian Business connections”
Reviews.Author: NormanT1
Reviews.Content: All accomodations less Cheng Du were at Sheraton hotels which were truly 5 star hotels. Service, accomodations, attention to details of the customer and cleanliness far surpassed any hotel in the United States I have ever stayed in. All the hotels were spacious and no attention to ambiance was spared. Also no one hurried me. Truely I got what was paid for and then some. conversely, I stayed in a Sheraton in Manhattan upon return. Was locked out of my room despite my VIP privilege considering all the sheratons and $$ that was on my card. My baggage was in the storage area on the main floor. Subsequently the room was gratis given the faux pas. Welcome back!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely clean hotel with amazing views of Hong Kong Island”
Reviews.Author: londonite64
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here along with my parents for a long weekend last April. Although most large hotels don't offer a very personalised atmosphere, I felt the staff here were very polite and keen to help with anything that you need. The rooms were immaculate and our room overlooked Hong Kong Island so the views are spectacular especially at night. The top floor bar has great views of the light show at night (along with some slightly cheesy commentry) and delicious cocktails. It is close to transport and all the shops in Kowloon. I would not hesitate to stay there again or recommend others to stay there. If you are thinking of staying there whilst in Hong Kong, I say do it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect....”
Reviews.Author: aloukin
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel we stayed in on a fairly long Asian tour. When we arrived we were quite stunned by the opulence of the lobby! The room was a good size, the bathroom reasonable, both were very clean. As for the views - wow!! We were fortunate enough to be there for the Chinese new year celebrations and they were an incredible sight. The location was great, the harbour was over the road and there is a lot to do there. Also just outside was a bus stop, and a bus seemed to come along to your destination every five minutes! The staff were incredibly helpful, even though we did seem accident prone. The plug we managed to get stuck in the bath, the suitcase lock we accidentally jammed! Each of these emergencies was fixed quickly and efficiently by kind men bearing pliers, and indulgent smiles. I guess they've seen it all before! The bars and restaurants in the hotel were pricey, but we didn't really eat in that much, there were plenty of places nearby. Overall, an extremely positive experience, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need; no need to pay more”
Reviews.Author: EricN99
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in a normal size room with the harbor view. The view is spectacular, the rooms are modern, the service is very professional, and the public transportation access is really easy. There are certainly more luxurious places, but if you're looking for something that's modern, convenient and not crazy expensive, this will do you just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views of the Harbour”
Reviews.Author: camelot-lot
Reviews.Content: A "Must Do" for this hotel is to upgrade to a Harbour view room. The views are simply sensational across to Hong Kong Island and the Peak. So much so that my wife and I stayed in one night and ordered Pizza to our room just so that we could watch the ships sail up and down and the world go by. Sad but very very memorable. Staying on Hong Kong Island for some is nicer but from Kawloon you have much better views. And the view will be my long lasting memory so its worth every penny to upgrade. My wife and I loved it. Just 4 days in the magic city of sites, flavours and shopping! Loved the local markets which have some great bargains. A must do is to go to the top of The Peak but be warned meals can be pricey at the top. We must have walked about 25 miles in the time that we were there but we love that way to explore. The Sheraton hotel is a typical Sheraton - mixture of business and leisure but immaculately clean, shiney and well maintained. Nothing is too much for the staff. The chinese restaurant in the hotel has excellent Dim Sum - different to our chinese but the locals frequent it which is always a good sign. Bathrooms are quirky too as the bathroom has a glass screen between it and the main bedroom so you can take in the stunning view having a shower, shave or even a sh... Great hotel in a fabulous location. Would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Holiday at The Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: AliC1
Reviews.Content: Fantastic views, great and frequent housekeeping with lots of attention to detail including constant replacement of bottled water and fruit. Restaurants were a bit expensive but overall stay was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you expect from a luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: JandPAustralia
Reviews.Content: Fantastic view, staff, facilities, room, decor and breakfast

Reviews.Title: “A delightful surprise”
Reviews.Author: TheLadyinRed03
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights at the beginning of our 3 week SE Asia honeymoon and 3 nights at the end and enjoyed it immensely. As Starwood Gold members we were upgraded to a harbour view room where we had a great view of the Symphony of Lights show at night. Room was clean and modern. Concierge at the hotel was very helpful. The location was very convenient, next to the Peninsula hotel, few blocks to the Tsim Sha Shui MRT station, and close to lots of shopping. I would definitely stay here again when in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: anachronist
Reviews.Content: Take a high floor harbour view and get a much better deal than at the Intercontinental or Peninsula next door. The rooms are modern and comfortable. The rooftop pool is fun and the breakfast buffet offers exceptional variety and quality. One could argue that the hotel is a bit short on style and in absolute terms not that cheap but frankly you could say the same about HK itself. Our biggest issue with the city was the pervasive pollution. Blue sky is a rarity and sewage smells a reality.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: sloughboy
Reviews.Content: with sheraton you know what you get, quality but you have to pay for it. nice location and make sure you poay extra for the harbour view. location ok, walking distance to the harbour but humidity can get to you if you are unhealthy.

Reviews.Title: “OK business stay, good location and grewt view of Victoria harbour...”
Reviews.Author: hisokajp
Reviews.Content: I staid in this hotel for 3 nights for a business stay, i staid several time in Mong Kok before and Tsim Sha Tsui is a good change of location, convenient and more quieter. The hotel was nice, a little old maybe and I was surprised to see that there was no wireless internet in the room. You have to use a cables which limit the movement in the room, could be better for an expensive business hotel? The boarding pass print out in the business center wasn't included either... Those kind of small details tarnish the overall experience at a Sheraton...

Reviews.Title: “Great location - excellent service - bar with a view”
Reviews.Author: chicagotraveler062
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights, staff was very attentive and helpful. Location is great - bar was a perfect place to watch the evening light show. Subway station across the street, easy access to the markets and all other attractions. Both local and touristy restaurants nearby. Gym was large. Glad I am an SPG member - Sheraton has never let me down and as usual the Hong Kong towers was no exception.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: somersetbill
Reviews.Content: The hotel met all our expectations. It is well located, it is spacious and comfortable and the service is great. The restaurants are good and the breakfasts offer a really good choice - something to suit all tastes. We had a room overlooking the waterfront and the view was really, really good. If you walk up Nathan Road you will be pestered by touts trying to sell you suits, shirts and fake watches and they really turned us off. But this has nothing to do with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service & great value upgrade”
Reviews.Author: red1stoney
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was excellent and the room upgrade - which gives access to 16th floor "lounge", breakfast, afternoon tea, hors d'oerves and alcoholic drinks - is fantastic value for money. Location of the hotel is very good being close to MTR station, Star ferry and waterfront for the nightly laser show - although if you haven't emptied your wine glass by the 8pm show start time you can watch it from the 16th floor lounge or the 18th floor Oyster Bar or the roof top pool!!!!

Reviews.Title: “request harbour views”
Reviews.Author: Swisswifey
Reviews.Content: we used this hotel on a trip to HK for my husbands work. We used to live here so were happy with an upgrade to a suite that didn't have a harbour view but if you can get one take it. the breakfast buffet is a nightmare. The food is good and not too expensive but the service is terrible. I got my coffee after I had been back to the buffet twice and had my plate whipped out from under my nose whilst I was still eating my toast... admittedly this is a personal pet hate and some people don't get upset when this happens.... The rooms are very comfortable but the executive lounge is depressing. about the worst lounge I have ever used. there are no windows and the air con is set so low you need to bring your duvet with you. There is a very nice girl who works there though and she is very helpful - i heard he offering lots of local knowledge to other guests. The hotel in Kowloon is very well situated for shopping at the markets and you can get to the star ferry in about 5 mins walk.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Cruising on a sailboat in FL Keys
Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, convenient location and very well trained professional staff!”
Reviews.Author: DocFraud
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel several times on business but this last trip was for leisure. The rooms are well appointed, nicely furnished and large by HK standards. Everything was spotlessly clean, and the rooms were made up promptly each day. Turn down service was a little hit and miss however with the style and the extent of the turn down variyng a little depending on who was on duty. It is only a small detail, but one that detracts from the otherwise perfect service. The location is very convenient and most points in Hong Kong can be reached within 30 minutes at any time of the day. Hung Hom train station is about a $15 cab ride, HKG is ~$220 HKD with tolls and the bargain of the century Star Ferry is only a 10 minute walk from the front door of the hotel. The entrance to the Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station is only about 200 feet from the side door of the hotel. As a business traveller I was almost always upgraded to the executive suites, which IMHO rank amongst the best in class.
