Told them it was my first time in Hong Kong and they upgraded me to a harbour view room on the 12th floor. OMG how incredible the view was. The rooms were a good size, very comfortable. The location is excellent, right in the middle of Tsim Sha Tsui and the subway station. 5 Minute walk to Star Ferry to bring you to Hong Kong Island. Harbor City is only a few blocks away. Take the subway to Mong Kok and exit E to the Ladies Market which opens around noon/1pm. Pickup some great knockoffs of handbags, Monte Blancs and every designer watch you can image. Some VERY good deals can be had. Lots of little shopping arcades and nooks and crannies just outside the hotel doors. Across from waterfront and high end shopping. Watch the lightshow every night at 8pm and the fireworks on Saturdays from the bar on the top floor of the hotel, Morton's restaurant dining window or on the Avenue of the Stars across the street on the waterfront where the Intercontinental is. A Starbucks can be found a block over but beware, it opens around 8am as do most other coffee shops. Stores opens 10 to 2ish as well. If you don't look like a local and more of a tourist or businessman, everywhere you walk up Nathan street you'll be asked if you want to buy a suit or watch. It gets to a point where you have to yell at them (mostly Indians) to leave you alone. The entire staff is attentive and ensures you have everything you need. The gym facilities were good for a hotel. Had a deep tissue massage at the spa for about $85 and it was pretty decent also. The pool is small but good, is located on the roof so lots of privacy with little nooks and locations you can hide out. 3 hot tubs and great view of the skyline. In case you need a good American steak, Morton's is on the 4th floor and is always a sure thing for steaks. My personal ambition is to eat at every Morton's around the world, and this brings it to about 29 so far.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: PrakashTilokani
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right next to the best retail stores like fendi and luis vuitton and has an amazing view of the harbour. the buffet restuarent is good and you can get good crabs there for dinner. I stayed in a deluxe room with harbour view and the room is a bit small but i guess thats the norm in HK. The bathroom has a glass window between the room and can be a bit amusing. Tried the chinese restaurent and it was not bad but i would recommend the chinese restaurent in the trade center. Shopping complexes are easily accessible and the ferry is also quite close. One negative is that they give very small bottled water in the room. these small green bottles which last exactly 2 sips. Everytime i needed water i had to call for this bottle which wud last me a sip... The night market and the ladies market are easily accessible by taxi. In all a good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “(Almost) all you would expect”
Reviews.Author: natffm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in a harbour view room. It is true that the room was not huge, but I found it adequate. What was indeed ridiculously small was the wardrobe. I had trouble squeezing my stuff in there. Other than that, I liked the room, especially the phantastic view. Public areas are elegant and very well maintained. Staff is friendly and efficient, in some (few) cases with a tilt towards efficiency rather than friendliness. Breakfast buffet was average. All in all, it is a typical 5-star chain hotel, and it delivers all you can reasonably expect, not less, and (apart from the view) not more.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room, Great View”
Reviews.Author: BigTravelr
Reviews.Content: We booked a room facing the harbor and got one on the 15th floor. The view was fantastic. You get an almost unblocked view of the skyscrapers in Hong Kong. Location was good with easy access to the subway. The room's modern with lots of glass (including a glass wall between the bathroom and the rest of the room -- so you get the full view of the city from the bathroom). However, the room was a bit small, and for two people in the room, we kept walking into each other. Like one of the other reviewers, we didn't enjoy Hong Kong (hot weather, crowds and rude people) but loved the hotel. The Sky Lounge is a great place for drinks and food (small portions) -- with a view. Service at the lobby lounge was slow.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view of harbour”
Reviews.Author: constantia
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 night stay at the Sheraton Hotel We stayed in a room overlooking the Harbour, on the 14th floor. I would definitely recommend staying on higher floors as you can escape the noise from the traffic and the construction. The view of the harbour and the evening light show made this hotel well worth it. The hotel is also in a great location - across from several shopping malls and close to the Intercontinental and the Peninsula, both of which have award winning restaurants. We only ate breakfast at the hotel, which was an incredible buffet. Food was great but more importantly, the selection was exceptional. One note was that we are starwood members and were told the breakfast was free, however, when we checked out, we learned that only the continental part was free - which was misleading. We did vist the gym which was very small, especially for a hotel of this size. My partner had a massage and said it was great. Overall, HK is a great city and this is good hotel to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Rooms are fairly sized for Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlyerNewYork
Reviews.Content: I was in Hong Kong on business for 3 days and stayed at the Sheraton Hotel. The service was good overal and the room was clean and comfortable. I had a great sleep every night. The bed was comfy and the pillow is one of the best i've laid my head on.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Si-Em
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton, Hong Kong for 2 weeks in September '06 for our honeymoon and as far as we're concerned we couldn't have picked a better Hong Kong hotel. The hotel and room were clean and beautifully designed and decorated. We were given a harbour view room and sent flowers and fruit baskets (who says theres no advantages to getting married). The location was great, perfect for getting around Tsim Sha Tsui and within easy walking distance of the ferry terminal for getting across to Hong Kong Island itself. The staff were friendly and polite, giving an extra room key when I locked myself out of the room without any hassle. On feature which did impress me, which I think all hotels should have (seems petty and small but I'm mentioning it anyway), rather than a 'Do not disturb/Please make up my room sign' which you have to put on the door and which can easily be flipped over by someone playing a prank (a similar thing happend to us in another hotel when someone altered our breakfast order) they have switches inside the room with illuminate 'Do not disturb' or 'Please make up my room' lights by your door, you even get a doorbell! Small I know, but it impressed me. Our room was spacious, the bathroom had a walk-in shower, separate bath and window between the bedroom and bathroom (don't worry there's a blind). There's a speaker in the bathroom too so you can hear the tv. A wide range of any toiletries you might need is provided... including toothbrushes!!! The wardrobe was very spacious and contained a safe for valubles. The TV was large (but not LCD.. but so what?) with great reception. The hotel is eco-friendly (or as eco friendly as the guest that stays there) allowing you to choose whether your sheets and towels are changed or just tidied up for you, which is great as I've always thought changing clean bedsheets and towels was a waste. Theres a great selection of English-language channels in the room and an English-language local newspaper - The South China Morning Post - is delivered each day. We can't comment on the food at the hotel as we tend to prefer to venture out and try the local cuisine (Hotel food can be a bit 'safe' and westernised)... and as your in Hong Kong theres no shortage of delicious and cheap food around... If you've never tried 'everyday' chinese cuisine before (I'm not talking chicken in black bean sauce from Mr Wongs here) be adventurous, try something new, you'll be well rewarded. Try Hang Heungs Kitchen in the New World Centre across the road, Happy Garden Noodle and Congee Kitchen on Canton Road and Hing Fat on Ashley Road. www.pandamedic.co.uk/HKFood.htm. for food photos.

Reviews.Title: “Top marks for the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Christo8
Reviews.Content: We took the upgrade to a Deluxe Harbour View Room and didn’t regret it for a moment. Fantastic view from a room that was generous sized by any standard – and rooms in HK can be on the small side. Hotel has reasonable outside space on he roof and is ideally positioned for Nathan Road shopping, the MRT or Star Ferry to Central. FOOD Great choice at breakfast – you can order speciality coffees and there are two fruit smoothies each day. Hotel restaurants are predictably pricey – we ate in “Zen Casual Dining” on the top floor once. It’s tapas size bites of food, which means the bill soon rattles up! Much better to go to the Mask of Si Chuen that is just round the corner for spicy Chinese food at a great price! BAR The Sky Lounge was generally quiet and has a great view of the harbour – however you get a much better view (and great cocktails) from the Intercontinental lobby bar which is just over the road and can be reached via an underground link from level 3 of the hotel’s shopping mall. POOL Small but serviceable. Decent number of sun-loungers considering it’s a rooftop in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but ...”
Reviews.Author: Ocean1458
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. The rooms with harbour view (lowest price) are very, very small (too expensive for what it is). However the location is great and the people are very helpful and nice. Be aware of heavy roadwork in front of the hotel with noise up to the 15th floor almost 24hrs . If you want a quiet hotel with an even nicer view I suggest the Intercontinental (might be a little bit more expensive but quiet and quietness is very important in such a hectic city).

Reviews.Title: “Semi-luxurious hotel with an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MRIII
Reviews.Content: My partner and I visited Hong Kong in late January and stayed at the Sheraton Hong Kong Hotel and Towers - A newly renovated semi-luxurious hotel with an excellent location in the heart of Kowloon. ROOM We reserved the Deluxe Room without Harbour View since the Harbour View rooms were sold out during our stay. We tried repeatedly to get a Harbour View room, but were unsuccessful even after our arrival – They’re quite popular and rightly so: Our room only had views of Nathan Road, The Peninsula Hotel and the other lower floors of our own hotel. The room itself was of moderate size with modern furnishing. There was a medium-sized television on an unusual TV stand (not an LCD TV), a writing desk with Internet access (not complimentary), a sofa and a large window. Since we are members of the STARWOOD Preferred Guest Program, we also received complimentary bottles of water and a newspaper daily (the room itself was on the STARWOOD Preferred Guest floor). The room was very bright and cheerful; I especially liked the dark brown colour motif! The bed was comfortable and the bed sheets were acceptable. The room was clean and also had tea-making facilities. BATHROOM The bathroom was semi-luxurious – A glass sink with a heated mirror and a nice purple orchid which slowly wilted away during our stay. The toilet was inside the bathroom and there was no separate shower cubicle. The no-name Sheraton branded amenities were all right and to be expected of a hotel of this calibre. The water pressure was surprisingly good! HOTEL FACILITIES/RESTAURANTS The hotel offered a fitness centre/spa and a pool, but we didn't use these facilities. There were numerous restaurants to choose from, but we didn’t dine in the hotel. The lobby was quite nice – having recently gone through a renovation. There was a nifty machine, which could print most international newspapers for a small fee in the lobby. I tried to use it, but it was out of service. The Sky Lounge on the top floor of the hotel came highly recommended, but in the end we didn’t get a chance to review it. SERVICE There was no service-related problems. The staff was courteous, although not always smiling. The only complaint I have is Starwood Hotels’ tendency to use internationally unrecognised geographic names (i.e. "Arabian" Gulf as opposed to the correct "Persian Gulf") in their brochures/websites that can be insulting/politically insensitive to certain guests. SURROUNDINGS The hotel is right in the middle of Kowloon across from the Peninsula Hotel on Nathan Road. The Tsim Sha Tsui subway station is right outside the hotel and the Star Ferry terminals to Hong Kong Island is less than a ten minute walk away. Nathan Road features lots of shopping and dinning options and the Star Ferry Terminal is near the Harbour City shopping complex. It’s also worth mentioning that in the evening, the Hong Kong Symphony of Lights (light show) is worth a look – Just cross the street from the Sheraton and walk towards the Tsim Sha Tsui East Promenade at around 8 PM for views of Hong Kong island and the Hong Kong evening light show. CONCLUSION Sheraton Hong Kong Hotel and Towers is a great hotel, and semi-luxuriously appointed. The location can’t be beat and it offers value for money. I would stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: PenelopeCoMeath
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed here recently and I can honestly say that I have never had a better experience in any hotel. We had a beautiful room overlooking Hong Kong harbour which was stunning. The room was spotless, but overall I cannot say enough for the levil of hospitality we experienced at this hotel, it was faultless. Breakfast was a lovely experience, the choice of food was excellent, and on the Saturday morning we were offered champaign, one of the staff told us that this was normal at weekends. We did spend some time in the Sky Lounge of the hotel and the memories of the lovely staff we met there will stay with us, the service and friendliness we experienced there was priceless. Overall we would not hesitate to go back there again, it was one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Views, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cougrz007
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at the Sheraton Hong Kong on a 2-week trip through Asia. I am an SPG member, and used points to stay at the hotel for two nights, picking up the third night myself. I wasn't disappointed with my choice. Location: The hotel's location is one of it's best features - at the tip of Kowloon peninsula in the heart of Tsim Tsa Tsui. The hotel is right next to the MTR, and you can easily walk all over Kowloon (including up and down Nathan Road - "The Golden Mile" - and even to and fro the night market on Temple Street). There were tons of places to eat and drink in the neighborhood, plus great shopping and all the basic services (including banks, and a post office literally right across the street). The hotel is also right across the bay, with amazing views of the city from the rooftop and many rooms. If your room doesn't have a view, you can also cross the street and walk along the "Avenue of Stars" which is a must see for the incredible views, especially at night. The hotel is also very close to the Star Ferry, which is easily reached via the underground walkways near the hotel. In short, the location is hard to beat, and I strongly recommend Kowloon over Central for a tourist - Central is fun to walk around, but I liked TST and Kowloon better. The Room: I paid $30 a night to upgrade to a harbor view room (including for the nights that I used points for - so they weren't free after all), which was absolutely worth it. See my pictures above; this was one place where just staying in the room was an attraction all its own just because of the view. I was on the 11th floor, in a King-sized room. The room itself was relatively small, but for a solo traveller there was plenty of room for luggage, etc. The bathroom was very large, and had a few cool features such as a volume control for the TV, a glass panel looking into the room, and a separate shower/tub area. The only real downside was that the bed was a little hard, but that was just a minor issue. Amenities: I took advantage of the rooftop pool a couple of times to escape the heat (heat index of about 95F when I was there). The pool was a little smaller than it looked in the picture, but it was still very nice. If you sat on the side that faced the Peninsula Hotel, you had great views of the city. There was also a small bar/restaurant in the pool area, which offered wait service at your lounge chairs. There was a fitness facility on the same level, but I didn't end up using it. I didn't eat at any of the hotel restaurants because I generally avoid hotel restaurants because it seems that they're usually overpriced, plus I'd rather eat HK food! One other nice amenity was that they had little internet kiosks where guests got 20 minutes free - but I always just asked for another access code when my time ran out, without any problems. This was good for me, because I had a hard time finding internet cafes in Hong Kong (although I later learned that free internet was available at Pacific Coffee Company). Service: Everyone was very friendly and polite, from the doormen to the bellmen to the reception staff. Conclusion: I'd absolutely stay here again. It is definitely on the spendier side, and I especially would have felt it more had I paid for all three nights. With that said, the views and incredible location are pretty hard to beat. Compared to the Peninsula and Intercontinental (both close by and offering similar views), this hotel is quite a bit cheaper, so in that sense, I think it's a decent value for the location. I should also point out that I booked the room (for the one night I wasn't using hotel points) on the Sheraton website, and the price decreased several times since. I just went back and checked every couple weeks, and when such decreases occurred, I just rebooked under the new rate. I'd recommend that for anyone who wants to stay at a nice hotel on a budget. Anyways, I'd definitely recommend the hotel - I had an amazing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Give me a break”
Reviews.Author: kauriNewZealand
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March for 14 days. Unfortunately it does just not live up to it's star rating or represent good valuse for the pricing. From where we sat, we booked this hotel for the service they promised. If I just only wanted a bed, I'd book a backpackers! Started off in a really tiny room. Ok I know space is of premium in Hong Kong- but hello? We're staying 14 days. So they moved us to another room which was fine. Great views and the location of the hotel excellent. We discovered things are not what they seem. The minibar had dust all over it (for the whole 14 days). We were in a smoking room, the rubbish bin had holes in it and housekeeping dumped all the ash over the floor- didn't clean it up. They standard of housekeeping was such they had to send the supervisor up to check daily (which co-incidentally only lasted a few days until more problems). The engineer had to come up to fix the drains as the bath from day 1 was overflowing, the toilet kept running, we had to have someone fix the safe as that too broke down. We reluctantly had to complain to guest relations, they were good, but reactive- can't wait to get you out the door. The concierge are great. Very helpful and polite. The restaurants in the place are also great. Would recommend the oyster bar- silver service without a glitch and outstanding food. We wouldn't stay in this hotel again. Way over-priced for what they deliver. We did consider if we were being overly harsh- but took into account lesser star ratings that out-perform the Sheraton. Can't be beaten on location however.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service - location is the only saving grace”
Reviews.Author: Gorwell
Reviews.Content: Just a typical Sheraton - could just as easily be Pittsburgh, Atlanta, or Des Moines. Room size & decor are OK, but my view was the inner courtyard, despite my advance request for a room with some sort of view. One nice touch - the nighlight under the bathroom vanity that comes on automatically when you turn the lights off. The breakfast buffet has a good variety, but it comes at a typically high HK price (yeah, it's my company's money, but still - >$25 for that breakfast?). Try a muffin and coffee from the lobby shop for a much more reasonable deal, or visit the nearby SOGO grocery store (in the subterranean mall) for fresh fruit and pastries and a much more interesting cultural experience. Except for the doormen at the taxi stand, service was generally apathetic. When we went to the Sky Lounge one evening for drinks (about 9:00 PM, long after the light show), the hostess immediately showed us the "minimum charge" per person section of the drink menu. Wow, nice way to say "welcome"! One especially galling experience: I started to get a cup of coffee from the pot outside the restaurant one morning ( I was having breakfast later that morning, outside the hotel) and the hostess stopped me and asked if I had eaten in the restaurant. When I said "no, but I am a hotel guest" she snapped - "coffee only for restaurant ". Fine - if you want to create that kind of impression for a frequent business traveler spending >$300 USD per night over a five cent cup of coffee, go right ahead. I'll definitley remember that next time I book a hotel in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “I dont understand the negativity”
Reviews.Author: jblovestotravel
Reviews.Content: I simply don't understand why everyone is so negative about this hotel. It is in line with Sheratons all over the world and lets face it Sheraton sometimes leave it a little long between renovations, but every frequent traveller would know that. The harbour view rooms are great, ours was clean, fresh, comfortable bed and the bathroom setting is unique with its views over the harbour. I like the sectioned off shower and bath area - wish I had it at my house!! The breakfast buffet is in line with any 5 star I have ever stayed at. Lots of variety, everything was fresh and being constantly replenished. The location is excellent, right on Nathan road, overlooking harbour and close to Ferry terminal. My only gripe is the constant upsell in the sky lounge. Whilst the views and 8pm light shows are stunning, each time we patronised the bar we were constantly subject to upselling. Being bar owners ourselves we were aware of it and offended by it. If your order a glass of wine they suggest a bottle or at least a larger volume from the one on the menu. If you order a scotch they offer a double. If you ask for a glass of water they offer a bottle etc. etc. Be strong - order what you initially went there for and sit back, relax and enjoy the views. The upselling was the only issue. Apart from that I would thoroughly recommend this hotel and it seemed to be in line with Hong Kong accom prices.

Reviews.Title: “A week at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_traveller120
Reviews.Content: The good: -Courteous staff that were willing to try to please. If they couldn't answer your question, they would fetch someone who could. -Handy location to many sights and transport. -In house restaurants pleasingly good. Great value when using Starwood Privilege card. The bad: Overlooking some basics. For example, a lovely roof top pool and 3 hot tubs, but the harbour view is blocked by a huge neon sign facing the harbour. Also, we emailed flight details for pick up and return airport transfers. They forgot to book the return transfer. The ugly: Dissapointing "Harbour View Room". For an 8 day stay, only a third of our view was the harbour. The rest was the Intercontinental Hotel/Space museum/Gallery. Get as higher floor as possible when you book. Being easter, we couldn't even change rooms. You think booking a room for over a week would be rewarded with a decent view.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely overpriced”
Reviews.Author: evmace
Reviews.Content: There are so many hotels in Hong Kong, I would strongly consider any of the other options. The Sheraton here is just way too overpriced for what you get. The rooms are small, and our non-smoking room smelled strongly of smoke. The service was fine all around, but at close to $450 a night with taxes, I would expect better.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: koneko
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton was a great experience for me. Maybe it was due to the fact that I had stayed in some remote areas of China earlier in the week, so the Sheraton was a welcome change! Upon checking in we were told our room was on the 4th floor. I asked to be moved up higher for a better view, the check in person obliged. And the view from our room was fantastic! Overlooking the harbour and lights, it was breathtaking. The interior of the room was very nice, especially the bathroom, which also had a view of the HK harbour! Location was great, it overlooks a museaum, and is a quick walk to the Ferry. I didn't spend enough time there to really explore the area, but I found lots to do on foot, just roaming the many side streets in Hong Kong. The hotel bar has absolutely breathtaking views. It was insane! So were the drink prices. I swear I think paid like 30 bucks for a drink or something! But it was so worth it just to sit there and take in the fantastic view and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: W0zza
Reviews.Content: I am a VERY frequent flyer and have stayed in Starwood hotels all over the world - this one doesn't rate. As a Gold member, the upgrade that was offered was a move to a lower floor where the benefits were (a) a different pattern on the carpet from the lifts to my room; (b) nicer decor??!!! I shudder to think what that would be!!! The booking was incorrect - booked a KING bed and was offered 2 twin beds on arrival; (b) the rate was changed to a more expensive rate - despite the agent telling me that it would be "no problem". What she meant was it would be no problem to her!! The staff are very selective in greeting guests in the restaurants .. an Indian colleague pointed out how they practically fell over themselves to wish caucasian guests " have a nice day " etc but do not extend this to non-white guests. How ironic in China! Guess it's a hangover from times when the parks had signs "No dogs or chinese allowed". No benefits of any value are offered to their supposed premium guests....eg: free internet access; breakfast included .... It's a gigantic rip-off and I won't be going back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service Makes Up For Noise”
Reviews.Author: AmbassadortotheWorld
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Hong Kong is located in a very convenient part of Tsim Sha Tsui. Next to The Peninsula and across the street from the Science Musuem, you can walk to the Star Ferry in 5 minutes or be in the MTR (subway) in 2 minutes. The rooms are very nice with modern, well-appointed bathrooms. I stayed in two different rooms during two stays and I noticed that one room had a double sink and larger bathtub than the other, although both rooms were the same rate. Please avoid the fifth floor at all costs as this floor is directly above the function rooms. It is possible to hear quite a bit of noise from these event rooms. Also, the street noise penetrates the single pane windows, especially the sound of the charming, gargantuan diesel double decker buses that wallow past the hotel every 30 seconds. In short, ask for a room as high up as possible. The view of the harbour will be better, too! The buffet breakfast is merely average. Although there is plenty of variety to choose from, I found the fresh fruit the only food that was delicous. And if you are a croissant lover, avoid the "lard logs" that lay limply on the serving plate. As mentioned in the title, I found the staff to be professional and courteous at all times. It is clear that the Sheraton organization spends a lot of effort in recruiting and training their staff.

Reviews.Title: “Never Ever Again - Too Expensive And No Quality”
Reviews.Author: Amsterdamnetherlands
Reviews.Content: After staying in this hotel for four weeks I can safely say DO NOT BOOK this hotel!! On arrival at 1.00 AM I still had too wait 20 minutes before I could check in. During the check in they proudly told me I got a verry nice sea view room. After a long flight I really just wanted to have a good night sleep and enjoy the hotel. Unfortunately when I entered I was shocked. I do not need mutch especially since I was staying alone. But my room was soo small I could not even unpack my suitcase since there was no place. When looking out of the windows all I could see was the back of a building with a neon sign. I called reception too ask what the possibilities were for a bigger room but apperently I already had the membership level room...when I asked where my seaview was they put their face against the wall and said if you would look past the building you could see a corner of water?! During my stay I placed the do not disturb sign multiple times since they had the tendency of cleaning the room quite early also in the weekends. But when you put this sign they give you a call....when can we come and clean?? They do not accept an answer that you will let them know when they can come. Overall... I have often stay in hotels for long period of times and as long as the hotel is friendly and clean I am normally happy. But this hotel was WAY to expensive for what you get and the staff is not proffesional at all.

Reviews.Title: “Below par ”
Reviews.Author: 11mon
Reviews.Content: Executive room - ACU had leaked all down the wall and so the white wall had light brown streaks down it - NO seperate shower, stand in the tub) and carpet from the 70's. View was ok over the isalnd. Not what I expected and definately not worth the money..

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: RashaKt
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Sheraton Hong Kong would be the best after our honeymoon 10 years ago. We travelled as a family with three kids 9,6 and 4. We had a set of two interconnected rooms which was very convenient. Rooms were of good size. Loved the glass sink and counter in the bathroom. Housekeeping were there around the clock. Everyone at the hotel seemed very friendly; front desk, coffeeshop, housekeeping.... Breakfast was great. Everyone could find their favorite food to start up the day. Haven't tried the other hotel restaurants as we always prefer other places with less formal settings outside the hotel. The best thing about the sheraton is the LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION. Compared to the surronding hotels across the streets, we discovered that having a set of harbour view rooms would be of great value. The hotel is close to the upscale international brands and to the local stuff stands down the Nathan road as well. You can find plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby. Loved Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Bailey1481
Reviews.Content: Impressive hotel with impressive views! Not a member of the rewards programme but still received good service. The quality of the room was fantastic with all the finishing touches you would expect - especially the bathroom with the glass sink!!! Having a harbour view is a must - definitely worth the extra! The location was ideal with the Star Ferry only a short walk away, and dirt cheap too! Pool area was lovely and glad I managed to squeeze it in, as well as a session in the gym (wish I had that kind of view at home to motivate me!!!). Definitely recommend and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “hunting out a xmas holiday”
Reviews.Author: penguin148
Reviews.Content: We are a family of six ( two are teenagers) and we had a great time.Even though we did not eat at the hotel, we found everything else on offer spot on.Yes, we did have a harbour view and like other reviews it was fabulous and the room was big enough for three of us in each room and each bed very comfortable. There was the problem on one day as with the previous review of our rooms not cleaned on our return at 4 o'clock but the cleaner could not apologise enough and gave an explaination for this which was totally acceptable.She was courteous,and very friendly for the complete stay.Also I am glad eating was not allowed in the lobby (AS PER THE PREVIOUS REVIEW) as I would not like to see the crumbs of a banana bun on the seats in a pleasant clean area shared by all , thank you! This hotel is in the prime area of Kowloon with shopping and transport in easy walking distance.The hotel is spotlessly clean and staff very courteous.The biscuits and chocolates sent with a note if anything went wrong was appreciated and a farewell basket of fruit was also a lovely gesture. To keep the six of us happy all the time is a great task,but this holiday fitted all our needs and we all had a great time for the seven days stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Choice of Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SueBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 travelled to Hong Kong for Christmas this year and we decided to book 2 rooms at the Sheraton in Kowloon, staying 5 nights. What a great choice! We had 2 adjoining rooms which was fantastic and we were fortunate the have harbour view rooms so we see the Symphony of Lights show every night as well as the fireworks on Christmas Eve and Christmas Evening without going outside. The Sheraton is located a short walk to the Star Ferry, which takes you across to Hong Kong Island, there is an entry to the MTR Subway train system across the road and you can walk in any direction and find wonderful shopping to suit all budgets. The staff were the friendliest I have come across, very helpful and polite. No request made to the staff was too small or too hard, they did their best at all times. The buffet breakfast was a feast every day and at no time were we disappointed with the variety or quality of the food. There are a number of restaurants at the hotel, as well as the sensational views when you go to the SkyBar. All in all, staying at the Sheraton made our first trip to Hong Kong memorable.

Reviews.Title: “will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: NicoleSanJose
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. I requested the non-smoking rooms during my booking since we had two young children with us. Upon arrival, they said that there are no more non-smoking rooms left. I would have to upgrade the rooms with an additional charge to have a non-smoking room. I made the woman call her manager to get an approval to get me the non-smoking rooms without any additional charges. She kept on saying that I did not make the request when I booked the rooms. After about five minutes, we finally got our non-smoking rooms. They have the rudest people working there. We left our rooms at seven in the morning, and when we came back around two o'clock, the rooms still have not been clean. I had the make up room sign on for over six hours. I had to call housekeeping to have them clean our rooms. They said that they forgot our rooms. We went down to the lobby to wait for almost thirty minutes while they clean our room. My children were hungry, and I gave them a piece of bread (pineapple bun) for a snack in the lobby. A woman came up and started yelling at us for eating in the lobby. I told her that we had no where to eat since housekeeping forgot to clean our rooms. She just kept on telling us to put our food away instead of finding us a solution to our problem. I was so mad, that I called the duty manager to complain. He apologized by sending a plate of chocolate and cookies to our room. I guess that he thinks a plate of choclolate and cookies will solve our problems with this hotel. I will never come back to Sheraton Hong Kong ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Service not good”
Reviews.Author: D-holidayLover
Reviews.Content: Book the reservation by phone, the reservation staff is very friendly they offer me with the rate of HKD1400++, when i check in to the hotel i pay extra of HKD1100++ to try their harbour view room with breakfast. The view was prefect very nice full facing the harbour, in the morning when sunrise you feel that extra of HKD1100++ is just worth of money. But then few unhappy things happen: 1st: when i go to the sky lounge for breakfast the staff just ask by saying breakfast for 2? ok, have a sit here. Not even greet me with good morning or what. but after that a western people came in they greet good morning with a warm smile, it just such a different between western people and asian people? We pay the same rate but why treating us so differently. 2nd: the choices of the food is just so limited, like only cold food but no hot food in the morning. Just so terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you would expect from a property ranked #9 by Trip Advisor”
Reviews.Author: earthtravelers
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through the spg.com site on the strength of its ranking on trip advisor and of the candid pictures we had looked at. We were staying four nights as a stopover on our way back from Japan. What a shambles, this is an old, tired, property with small rooms complete with 1970s decor...The reservation system is totally misleading. The hotel name "Sheraton Hotel & TOWERS" means that unless you are in the know, even as an spg member, your booking will land you a room well below par on a regular floor. We refused two rooms and found out by reading the floor directory in the lift that TOWERS refers to the executive floors (16th & 17th floors), complete with lounge and facilities closer to a hotel of that caliber. We had to upgrade our booking, at our cost and waste our time before being issued with a partial harbour view and a comfortable but disappointing room. The rest of the hotel is like an ageing ship with station like facilities...Not a patch on other properties visited whilst in Hong Kong. So buyer beware...at over $300, this is not good value, even if the towers staff was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: Holiday-Jetset
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel and it was absolutely excellent! Although this was a girlie shopping break and we didn't spend all that much time in the hotel, we were still there long enough to experience this first class hotel. We stayed in a Deluxe room (no harbour view) but it was more than big enough for our needs and the bathroom with its glass sink was very modern and stylish. The room was exceptionally clean and there was also a turn down service. We spent a few hours one night in the sky lounge sipping a bottle of wine (quite expensive at £35 per bottle) but well worth it for a fantastic view of the harbour light show at 8pm. All staff were very attentive, and the breakfast could not be faulted. There was everything you could think of, from a full English breakfast, to noodles, cheese and cold meats, danish pastries, fresh fruit, smoothies, freshly cooked omlettes and eggs etc. You could have virtually anything. The health club was also great. We had a swedish massage an hour before leaving for the airport to return home and it was work every penny of the £42. It was my friend's first time and she's now hooked! The location cannot be beaten. 1 minute from the KCR/MTR trains. 5 min walk from the Star Ferry port. Shops on the doorstep and everthing else you could need. The 7/11 shop is across the road which opens early and closes late for any items you may need. All areas of Hong Kong are easily accessible from this hotel. We didn't use any of the restaurants because we were always out and about and wanted to sample the local cuisine, bit they all looked very good and if the breakfast was anything to go by they would surely have been excellent. The roof top swimming pool looked good although time did not allow us to use this facility. I would definitely stay here again and although a room with a harbour view would have been nice, they extra £42 per night for the privilege was not necessary as the sky lounge is open to everyone and has a fantastic view! I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Different system at this Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: nzbased
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights (7-10 November 06) as husband has Gold status. Disappointed to find that only Platinum status reaps any rewards - Hong Kong Sheraton is a rulebook unto itself. On check-in, and providing copy of confirmed booking, staff member could find no evidence of our booking. Called over another staff and they both spent 3-4 minutes looking at the piece of paper, almost willing it to reveal the answer to their situation! We were eventually put into a Club room on the 8th floor. On looking out of the window (which provided a good harbour view) we were very unhappy to see a building site on the road in front of the hotel. Knowing a lot about the construction industry, we realised we would have early wake-up calls and perhaps late working at night. Not what you want at HK$3000/night. Asked reception and they promised work only between 8am and 6pm. Sure enough, next morning we were woken by a motorised jackhammer at 7.10am. After many attempts to get explanation, we were moved to another room - still could hear construction noise, and eventually were given a suite at the back of the hotel facing a courtyard. Heaven! We were also given a complimentary bottle of wine and fruit bowl. The Executive Lounge is for Platinum and Tower guests only. The only advantage of using this Sheraton (if you are not Platinum) is to accrue points.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: panch
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at the Sheraton. The rooms have been upgraded. Very comfortable in every way. The location couldn't be more perfect. Near the train, Avenues of the Stars, New World Center, the Harbor view, light show at night, Nathan road, restaurants at the Peninsula, etc... The breakfast was amazing. I had so many items to choose from. The hotel staff is friendly and speak good English. They were also very knowledgable about HK. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Average”
Reviews.Author: Steve_06896
Reviews.Content: Covenient location for Kowloon business. Simply average accomodations. Stayed in executive suite and it was ... average... If you can stay on Hong Kong Island - try the JW Marriott. Much nicer, better service, better restaraunts on hotel property.

Reviews.Title: “View Was Great but.....”
Reviews.Author: TAMember11
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed in this hotel for five days in two adjacent rooms. We stayed in the deluxe harbour view rooms and although the view was unbelievable, the service wasn't up to the level of the view. Since we had two rooms at full price, we were hoping the management would give us some sort of compensation (breakfast included, maybe?) but they made no effort to accomodate our request. Knowing that other people have gotten free upgrades in their rooms and free breakfast, we weren't trying to get special treatments. It really wasn't about the $ but we were disappointed with their lack of enthusiasm trying to in some way, keep their customers happy. My advice to people booking the rooms here is to try and get free breakfast or upgrade through the internet before you get there. Just so you don't feel left out. Other than that, the rooms are nice, location convenient and the view is definitely something you'd want to go back for.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good experience but could have been better.”
Reviews.Author: Smith_P&L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 9th and 10th October 2006. We had booked a harbour view room but on arrival the receptionist said there was a special offer on and for HK$200 extra we could upgrade to a Superior harbour view room which we were led to believe was larger and better. We agreed and were directed to our room on the 10th floor. Later in the evening an envelope from our Travel Agent was delivered to us still showing our original room number which just happened to be only three doors down the corridor. So don't fall for that trick! It would have been useful to have had a little more information about the facilities, including the locations of restaurants and eating places, Internet access etc within the hotel on our arrival. We only had two days and it was only be accident that we discovered a lift from the reception area which took us directly into the shopping centre. The first morning we had breakfast in The Cafe which was an experience due to the over enthusiasm of the numerous staff all trying to hold out your chair for you whilst placing a napkin on your lap, offering you orange juice, tea, coffee or rearranging the cutlery. (Just as I had my coffee in perfect proportions I looked the other way for a second and a waiter topped it up thereby spoiling all my hard work - and hotel coffee can be hardwork at times!) By the second morning we had discovered the Sky Lounge where we had one of our best breakfasts ever. Having said all that the room service was excellent and prompt. Overall the food, cleanliness and staff were first class. However, don't choose this hotel just because of its proximity to Nathan Road's shopping as running the gauntlet of the touts trying to sell dodgy goods can be waring, to say the least, as they are stationed, literally, every few yards. Stick to the main shopping malls or visit Stanley Market.

Reviews.Title: “Suitable rooms for disabled traveller!”
Reviews.Author: Glasgowtraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during Easter holiday. Booked by telephone. Had requested room with separate shower and bath due to mobility problems. When we arrived found room with shower over tub. Advised reception not suitable and they upgraded me to a suitable room, also with excellent harbour view- at no extra cost. (previous room did not have the view. i think maybe only deluxe rooms have separate bath and shower, suggest you specifically ask when booking) Hotel has great location. next to lift wich takes you to underground passageway to allow you to cross busy road. Service excellent. Breakfast buffet style delicious, quite pricey but if you go out can easily find lots of other eateries. I would definitely return to this one, although i would also like to try the peninsula which is right next door! we had the afternoon tea at sheraton which was brilliant, harbour view. Also had tea at the pen -food equally as good but much busier.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but could be better!”
Reviews.Author: Arielarafe
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice already and it's not one of best hotel that others have described. I stayed here because of business since I travelled extensively in Asia for my job and the company that I am now working for do not let us stay at the Intercontinental which is across the street (which I absolutely LOVED!)... Checking in takes a bit of searching and can take about 10-15 minutes even though I have made reservation ahead of time. Rooms are decent size and very clean but the bed is hard as a rock in which I had to place the comforter on top of it so that I don't have back pain in the morning. Breakfast has good selection but service is slow and can take a long time waiting to be serve. The lobby can be a bit like a mall with lots of people standing around with nowhere to sit. Checking out takes equally same amount of time to check in even though they have already gave me the bill the night before in which I told them that everything looks good to go....

Reviews.Title: “#1 in Hong Kong? I disagree...”
Reviews.Author: StyleTraveller
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that there is nothing terribly wrong with this hotel but it definitely does not deserve the #1 rating given some of the other fabulous hotels in the city. After friendly airport service to arrange transportation there was efficient front door welcome and arranging of luggage being transported to our room. The first impression inside was of a smallish lobby with very low ceilings in parts making it rather unimpressive. There was also an unpleasant mildews smell greeting us in the lobby. Despite being a Platinum Starwood member I received slow and non-enthusiastic check-in. Our room was on the 7th floor with a harbor view but given the location the view was partially blocked by the Intercontinental in front and required a stretch to the right to see the skyline on the other side of the harbor. The humidity smell from the lobby was even stronger in our room; if we hadn't arrived so late and tired I would have asked for another room. The room itself was fine, nice bed, nice bathroom with a bathtub for one rather than two. The room was smallish but nothing wrong. The Starwood Lounge on the 9th floor is hardly worth it, only fountain soft drinks during the day with some appetizers and alcohol between 3 and 6 in the afternoon. Nice touch is the roof pool on the 18th floor with three Jacuzzis with a good partial view of the harbor. Service was good everywhere although a bit slow in the breakfast restaurant. Great choice for breakfast but the hot food could be a bit hotter, the coffee a bit better and the service a bit more attentive. Location was good right next to the (much better) Peninsula. Easy walk to the Star Ferry to get across to the main attractions and business district. All in all, not bad but I would only go back to a suite on a high floor if the smell disappeared, otherwise I would choose one of the many other fine hotels in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “expensive but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: vellum
Reviews.Content: stayed for 2 nights for business, good location but slightly away from the main shopping area on nathan road, close to the harbour and near the shopping malls there and cultural centre, space museum, star ferry, etc. underground station is 2 minutes walk away. basically a very good hotel with all facilities, can arrange coach to airport at hk$230 per head. no problem when check in and check out. extremely friendly staffs. nice small room with modern luxury glassy design, all necessary facilities included in room - bathrobes, extra blankets, slippers, tea/ coffee/ free bottle water, stationary, internet access, iron, ironing board, hair dryer, safebox, toothbrush, toothpaste, shampoo, shower gel, moisturiser, sewing kit, shoe cloth, etc. lovely bathroom with glass sink and counter. room has a courtyard view and could hear the engine of the lifts throughout the nights, so did not sleep that well as the lifts operated 24 hrs, another colleague had the same complaint. room included breakfast in a bar on basement, lots of choice and good quality food, recommended. but make sure write down all travel companions' names and hotel room numbers on the bill in the restaurant and double check they don't charge you again on breakfasts before check out. other restaurants and pubs are very pricey considered there are millions of choice just outside the hotel. local calls are charged at hk$5 each call for the first 30 minutes, then hk$1 per minute. again, a bit expensive. local calls including mobile are free from any landline in hongkong, therefore most restaurants and bars provide phone free for customers. and charge at hk$1 per call in any phone box. my room was bill at hk$4400 for the 2 nights stay including breakfast, 30% service charge, tax, and 2 local calls. nice hotel but will not stay there again unless book a harbour view room and get a big discount.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: mildredmoo
Reviews.Content: This is our second time at the hotel. The first time was 13 years ago so it certainly has changed. Upon check in we were told that to have rooms on the same floor (we have two teenage children) we could upgrade to deluxe rooms. The price quoted was reasonable so we did. Of course, the views are spectacular. One of the very best views in the world. Just arrived in time for the light display on the harbour. The kids loved the rooms but we found them very "modern". This isn't a necessarily a bad thing, but just different. Some people will absolutely love it and some prefer the older luxurious type of room. But in any case, the view is the star of the show! Someplace Else, the downstairs bar is great for Happy Hour and the breakfast (served in Someplace Else because the Cafe was being redecorated) was fabulous. Staff extremely welcoming. On one morning at least five people wished us a good day on our way out. Didn't have time for the Oyster bar but did have a drink in the Sky Lounge and again the views are amazing. A very nice stay all in all. Might look at Intercontinental next time although absolutely nothing wrong with Sheraton at all.

Reviews.Title: “Five star experience at 3 star price”
Reviews.Author: Multicaster
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four day stay at the Sheraton in Kowloon and after staying at "5 star" hotels in Singapore and Kuala Lumpur on the visit think the Sheraton is every bit their equal. We got a harbor view room at a great rate from one of the three big internet sources (it pays to do this, as at every stop we found one of the three with much better pricing than the other two) - less than $200 US per night. And the view of Victoria Harbor was nothing less than stunning. You can't beat this location very close to the MRT station, bus routes, great shopping, Star Line ferry, and more. The hotel staff were really helpful and impressive, and that's after gettting pampered at two other locations on our trip. The room was just a tad small, but nicely designed with a great view of the harbor through the glass front on the bathroom (don't worry it has a drop down shade). If they hadn't lost 2 feet to adding the tub and given that back to the living area it wouldn't have been quite so compact for us Americans, but it's really just a minor quibble. We'll definitely be going back. It was spotless, friendly, adventurous, and downright romantic. Highly recommended by two picky east coasters.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GQSurfer8
Reviews.Content: This hotel and especially its staff were fantastic. Because we were flying in from Los Angeles we arrived at the hotel at 10:30 am. Although check-in time is 3:00 pm, we were given our room without any hesitation. We booked a deluxe harbour view room which was a decent size and had a nice marble and glass bathroom complete with fresh orchids. As with all Sheratons, the bed was absolutely amazing. The view from the room of the harbour and Hong Kong Island was spectacular. It was one of the most amazing views from an urban hotel that I have ever seen. Each night the buildings on either side of the harbour put on a cool laser and light show. The best part was that my deluxe harbour view room had one of the best seats in Hong Kong for the light show. We took breakfast at the hotel's buffet each morning. Try to get breakfast included in the rate. The selection is large and the food was good. The hotel has a perfect location. It is close to the subway which can take you all over Kowloon and to Hong Kong Island. It is also a short stroll to the Star Ferry. The hotel is also very close to great shopping and world class restaurants such as Hutong, Spoon, and Felix. Make sure to get a drink at the Sky Lounge located on the 18th floor of the hotel. The views from there are amazing. The best part of the hotel was the service. Each member of the staff was extremely friendly and even remembered our names and preferences. This hotel was the perfect base for exploring Hong Kong and its neighboring islands. I look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Really can't fault much here”
Reviews.Author: chefspop
Reviews.Content: Really can't fault the Sheraton. Excellent location for Kawloon, friendly staff. Stylish hotel with great shopping on your doorstep. Good sized clean room with great bathroom. Great breakfast with excellent buffet and nice views if you can get a seat by the window. Good rooftop pool and great gym. Hey they even have pump classes if you are that keen. Cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: LQGuy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton from July 24-29, 2006. The hotel has a good Kowloon location, close to the MTR (subway), and a five minute walk to the Star Ferry and Harbour City Shopping mall (700 stores!). The hotel reminded us of some Kimpton hotels, or the "W Hotels" brand...a little flashy, but mainly modern with sleek lines, all done very tastefully. The service was good. We used the concierge quite a bit and they really did their best to help us out with our inquiries and reservations! The front desk staff were also efficient. We ate breakfast at the Cafe each morning. The array of food and quality was excellent. And the service there was friendly and very quick! The room was also nice. The size was a typical hotel room (I hear rooms in Hong Kong run small). The bathroom was starndard size, with a cool elevated glass counter and sink. My ONLY complaint is the cost of a "toll free" call. To use my calling card cost $6 U.S. DOLLARS!!!!! But to place a local call cost me 35 cents! Makes no sense! But they insisted that it was a correct charge. This is my only issue with this hotel, and all things considered, it's insignificant. We certainly would not hesitate to return to this hotel. There were simply no problems at all...great customer service and a very good location. We highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Digithil
Reviews.Content: I went to Hong Kong with three of my friends for a week of shopping (as girls do!) It was our first time abroad together, a bit of an indulgence, and we really wanted it to be special. And it was!! We had requested two harbour view rooms, and if possible, interconnecting. We were told this may not be possible, however, on our arrival we had exactly what we ordered. Perfect! The staff were amazing, from the doormen with their smiles, to the manager of the breakfast buffet-which was perfect- everyone and everything was perfect! We had umbrellas when it rained, free internet on request in the lobby, help making the taxi drivers understand where we wanted to go, chocs on the pillow and a free bottle of water ever night. As well, I can honestly say I only heard one person walking down the corridor ANY time we were there (6 nights) Its very quiet! The view was perfect. Room service (at 11 at night mind you!) was very well priced and delicious. Am taking my son there in October to show him this great city - we had a blast!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: akn
Reviews.Content: After an initial difficulty getting a room with a harbour view which we had requested, we received one with a partial view, on 14th floor. Infact it had an excellent view, especially of the illuminations at night. Quite spectacular. To compensate for the difficulty, the management sent us a bottle of chilled Bordeaux white wine. A nice touch!!! Room was large with excellent amenities. Location very good. 5 minutes from Start Ferry Terninal and a couple of shopping malls. Concierge advice for restaurants close to hotel in evenings also very good. Knutsford Terrace, off Nathan Road, a pedestrianised area with all styles of restaurants ....excellent. Great ambiance and very good food!!!! We went twice!!!! Altogether an excellent stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view and loved the service (mostly)”
Reviews.Author: What2DoNext
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton between the 10th and 14th of June 2006. Loved the view from my deluxe harbour room. We could see the 8PM light shows from the room. The room service was really good as were the reception and conceirge. The turn down service was good and I loved the chocolates on the pillow. The american breakfast was so huge that one breakfast was enough for two of us. Huge pancakes and waffles! Also the location of the hotel is very convenient for travelling. The only downfall was the offer of a narrowband (modem) connection for half the price of a broadband service which was then unavailable because I could not use it even though I am a computer scientist!!! This in itself would not have been terrible had Sheraton had qualified personnel to help me with the issue. Instead they sent me the head of house keeping (susi or suki) who managed to install some windows add-on to the laptop and wasted a good hour doing absolute nonsense on my laptop. Ofcourse she got no where especially since my laptop was not cantonese-friendly and she was not very good with communication either. I felt at least they could have given me the broadband connection at the price of a narrowband.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the passing cruise ships, junks, tugs, Salisbury Rd works”
Reviews.Author: perthwa
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived at the Sheraton, opened our room door and saw the fantastic view our time at the Sheraton was marvelous! The staff were friendly, nothing too much for them, especially the dining room staff. We usually have our meals at night away from the hotel, but this time we had our meals there, we could not complain at all. We will definitely stay there again. The size of the room did not matter, where else in the world does your room and bathroom look over a beautiful harbour! It was fascinating to watch the workmen doing the Salisbury Rd works!

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Hong Kong is awesome”
Reviews.Author: YosemiteLamb
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. I went on business so I didn't get to experience all ameneties but it is a great place to stay. The rooms are small but are elegantly furnished. The bed was very comfortable and the harbor view unbelievable. The bathrooms are fantastic. The breakfast in the lounge is very good with a breathtaking view. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Jemuk1
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel. Fantastic service was particualrly impressed with the evening turn down service. Lovely room, the bathroom was brilliant. We paid for a harbour view, which was well worth the extra HK$300 per night. Brilliant location! If I returned to Hong Kong I would defintely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “No bed for my daughter”
Reviews.Author: science2
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a long flight to find that a twin room had been allocated for my family of 3. The hotel offered a cot free of charge, but my 7 year old daughter was not impressed! We had two options, either to pay £20 a night for a roll away bed to be put in the small twin room or to pay £40 a night for upgrade to a suite. We chose the latter, but it ate into our holiday budget because we were staying for 7 nights. The suite was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beds disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mum and I stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks end of February. The location is great but I was disappointed to see two single beds instead of the usual two double beds that we get in other hotels. Maybe it's a Hong Kong thing. The room is small but we had the harbour view room (which we paid extra). The bathroom is excellent with two double glass sinks, a separate shower and bath. We enjoyed the view of the harbour with its nightly light show during our stay there. The swimming pool wasn't as big as I hoped, small in comparision to other places I've stayed. They have three spa baths on their rooftop. However, I must say the location is the best, next to the MRT station (via KCR train entrance). I get my digital photos developed across the road at this photo store (near the 7 Eleven store) after my daily travels. Also the currency exchange booth (between 7 Eleven and Photo place) offered the best currency exchange rate in the area. You can get your money exchanged at the hotel, the rates aren't that bad either in comparision to some of the places around Nathan Road. The breakfast buffet bar was superb!! The staff there was fantastic, they saw me so often they would wave at me whenever I enter the restaurant and knew what I wanted to eat. They were excellent when my mother got sick, they made an appointmet for me with a doctor across the road. Very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: YYCworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton in early February on our way to Thailand and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We stayed in a Deluxe Harbour View Towers Level room. We were on the 17th floor so the view was great. The room was not huge compared to the rooms we had in Thailand, but for Hong Kong it certainly was a decent size. Staying on the Towers level gave us access to the lounge for pre-dinner drinks and snacks and also a great breakfast every morning. They also provided free WIFI internet access as a Towers level perk which was supposed to be only available in the lounge, but we had no trouble receiving the signal in our room as well. Staff were very friendly and accommodating. The Sheraton may not be The Peninsula or The Four Seasons, but it's still a very nice hotel with a great location. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jovial9900
Reviews.Content: Having been to Hong Kong several times , this hotel stay has been the best . I have booked my family and myself a Habour View room for 2 nites 14 - 16 Feb , as the deluxe one was fully booked . We stayed on the 11th floor and had an awesome view of the harbour . We had the pleasure of viewing the 12 minutes laser show from our room ,and my 2 young kids enjoyed it , but better on the second night , where we walked across to the harbour and mingled with the crowd , and this time round together with the sound effects and ambience - SPECTACULAR ! The service is efficient and staffs are polite . Basically , there is no complain about their service. The room is very clean and modern.Great pillows , my 2 young kids slept throughout the nites . The baby crib that they provided for my 18 months old girl , even came with a little pillow and a nice feeling cotton blanket ,how thoughtful! And the crib was already inside my room , before i checked in ! Their internet connection is fast and just a phone call to the receiption and it is done with a fee of HKD120 per 24 hours - REASONABLE . But the marble floor at the shower point would be very slippery when wet , and there is like some blood stain on the floor of my room , it seemed like someone stayed before me has had a terrible fall and had bled a lot , the blood stains seemed to have sipped into the tiles , and couldn't be washed off . So my hubby and i were extra careful when stepping out of the bathtub , and i would carry my kids out , after they have their shower . Make use of their shampoos and bath gels , conditioner , lotion it has very nice lavendar smell and it comes in a generous tube package , unlike those that you find in normal 3-4 stars hotel . My husband and i ended up not using our own that we have brought along . I had my dinner at one of their Pub Restaurant at the basement , SOMEPLACE ELSE . Try out their chicken wings with their special sauce , very nice . Their seafood rice combo came at a hefty price of HKD260 (SGD56)and nothing special . My next stay would still be The Sheraton , and i would definately pay more to stay at the Harbour View room .

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Thomson_aus
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton for 4 nights in January 2006. The level of service is exceptional. Rooms are made up twice daily by a dedicated room attendant. They provide a turndown service at night with a complimentary chocolate and bottled water. Each morning, a complimentary newspaper is provided. Good points: -World class service -Great location right on Nathan Rd, opposite the Peninsula. -Modern rooms - everything seemed brand new -Fantastic choice of restaurants -Great swimming pool with 3 hot jacuzzis overlooking magnificent views of the Hong Kong harbour -It is a large hotel, which means that they have more capabilities to meet special guest requests Room for improvement: -The bed mattress was a bit hard - however housekeeping added extra padding to the bed after my first night -The bathroom amenities provided are nothing special I would definitely return to the Sheraton, as the level of service is exceptional. Having travelled the globe, it's hard to beat Hong Kong's top hotels for their facilities and level of service!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - But a few Small issues”
Reviews.Author: flytoomuch
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights and found the location fantastic, the rooms really quite spacious, and the beds were fantastic. Got upgraded to a Harbour View room, and the view is just what you would expect, fantastic. Continental Breakfast was included in the rate, and had the option to be delivered via room service, which was a great option, especially after New Years. The staff were all very friendly, and a few issues I had with my bill appeared to be sorted out correctly, efficiently and with only one phone call. My only real complaint, is although a few of the restaurants are included in the Starwood Privilege Dining Programme, some aren’t and these are not advertised – so you end up at the having a bill higher that expected. The odd thing is that the hotel allows you to use Starpoints to eat at these restaurants - not really fair The availability of Non news and Non Sport TV is also quite poor. The pool, as well as the spa pools on the roof probably offer what must be some of the greatest views of hong kong harbour, and we also watched the nightly laser and light show without some of the crowds. A good place and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Braindrain
Reviews.Content: As others have mentioned, the location of this hotel is great. It's at the southern tip of Tsim Sha Tsui across from the Peninsula. It's a short walk to the Star ferry and the entrance to the MTR is right beside the hotel, by the KCR entrance. We arrived by taking the Airport Express and connecting via the free K2 shuttle bus to the side of the Sheraton. We got a deal on the price so it only costed 70 HKD/person/one way. I stayed here for 4 nights at an incredibly low rate of 1150 HKD/night, considering it was over New Year's. As a Platinum, they offered to put me up in a Harbour View room on the 15th Floor. I declined in favour of a suite which is about twice the size. A word of caution about suites with number xx64. There is an unexplainable "thumping" noise that emanates from the bedroom closet. When bringing it up with the front desk, they acknowledged that problem and offered to put me in a different suite. I declined since the other suite would be a purely city view. Also, as Platinum, I got access to the exec lounge and a free continental breakfast at The Cafe. You have to tell them you're getting the continental breakfast or they will charge you for the full breakfast. It wasn't bad since it included pastries, congee, smoked salmon, chicken, salad bar, juice, and a smoothie bar. The exec lounge is nothing to write home about but is open from 7 am to 11 pm for non-alcohol drinks. Canapes are from 5 pm to 8 pm which includes alcohol drinks such as beer, wine, and whiskey. The Sheraton has been renovated and the rooms are extremely modern in appearance. The bathrooms use the boutique hotel style sinks but I always think the water doesn't come out far enough. I had a strange configuration of a roman bath enclosed with the bathtub. The suites also come with a separate washroom and sink by the entrance. There's a very nice sitting lounge and great workstation space. In the sitting lounge, there is a DVD/CD player with the TV. The bedroom is just huge, for Hong Kong, and the beds are very nice. I'm not sure if they're the Sheraton Sweet Sleeper beds, though. When navigating the MTR, I strongly suggest you pick up an Octopus card. It costs 150 HKD which includes a refundable 50 HKD deposit and 100 HKD in refundable credits. That way, you don't have to carry bags of change in your pockets and navigate horrendous line-ups to buy tickets. We went to HK Disneyland which was cost about 18 HKD each way. What can I say about shopping? It's everywhere. Ignore the people selling suits or fake watches along Nathan road. Well, that's if you want to. Also ignore any "duty free" places since all of HK is duty free. The computer/electronic mecca is the Golden Computer Arcade mall by Sham Shui Po station. Good places within walking distance for dim sum include the Serenade restaurant in the HK Convention Centre (which has an excellent view of the harbour and discounts its dim sum if you arrive before noon) and Hei Chin Rou in the Langham hotel. There's a Morton's on the 4th floor of the Sheraton if you need a good steak fix. The service encountered in the hotel was very good. I got a bogus minibar charge one day but front desk took care of it without a problem. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: doris18
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton for 2 nights on the way out to Australia and 1 night on the way back. The hotel proved to be the perfect choice. Had a great harbour view on first visit and got upgraded to a suite on the way back. Rooms are very modern with fantastic glass bathrooms and are extremely comfortable and spotless. Excellent service too. We had dinner in the restaurant on the 17th floor - great food and stunning views. Breakfast didn't disappoint either. The hotel is also superbly located at the bottom of Nathan Road and only a short distance from the Star Ferry. Will definitely stay at the Sheraton again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, Stayed in a Harbour View Room on the 12th Floor right opposite the Convention Centre on Hong Kong Island. Really comfortable beds "Sheraton Sleeper Beds". Nice to have a shave in the bathroom overlooking the Harbour while listening to TV on the in bathroom speakers. Buffet Breakfast was good but a little expensive but good selection. Brilliant location, right next to Nathan Street (Beware of people continuallly selling suits / copy watches) but hey thats Hong Kong. 10 minute walk to the Star Ferry and just oppo the subway makes excellent travel connections.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: shoppadownunder
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon and although we didnt have a harbour view room our room was clean, large and suitably furnished. They have amazing bathrooms and nice comfy beds. The service is excellent with chocolates and water with the bed turned down each night. The hotel is located directly above the KCR train subway entrance and also the MTR can be accessed from here. The location couldnt be better. The staff were always friendly and helpful and we asked for a late checkout till 1pm which they oblidged with as checkout is usually 12noon. There is a 7/11 located behind the hotel which is great for snacks and drinks. The pool area/jacuzzis are fantastic for nighttime views and on the last night we found the glass elevator which you get great views to hong kong island from. If you are not in the harbour tower this can be accessed from the same floor as the sky lounge which also has amazing views

Reviews.Title: “be careful”
Reviews.Author: gabio
Reviews.Content: An absolutely terrific hotel. We only stayed here for one night and requested a harbour view and paid a hefty price for it aswell (about £135) but it was a saturday night so we wanted to see the fireworks from our room.Unfortunately they only put us on the 5th floor and we werent high enough to see over the buildings.our complaints were fruitless and we werent moved or compensated and there is no view from the bathroom unlike some of the reviews i have read on here....not unless your eyesight bends around walls and doors!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton from August 9th - August 15th. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are adequate size. The location is excellent as it is near Star Ferry and the MTR (subway). Staff was very friendly and attentive to our needs. Breakfast at the Cafe is wonderful also.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: TT-Traveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night after several hectic days on the mainland doing business. Excellent service all around. The staff was very friendly and extremely professional. You really got the feeling that you were special e.g. at both check-in and checkout the manager came over and opened a new line for me even though they were only one or two people ahead of me. The room itself was cozy and the view of the harbour was superb. The slick glass walled bathroom was also a very nice touch. I ate at the The Cafe. Impeccable service. I did not have to wait on anything. Staff simply appeared out of nowhere at the right time. The location at the bottom of Nathan Street allowed me to easily cram in 1-1/2 days of sightseeing and shopping. Three blocks from the Star Ferry and across the road from the Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station made getting around a snap. There was also a free shuttle bus from the Airport express Kowloon station to the hotel. Very convenient. My only minor complaint was the bell staff did not help with my luggage to/from the shuttle drop off neither at check-in nor checkout. This aside, I would stay here again without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Small but beautifully renovated rooms”
Reviews.Author: mjftrip
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Hotel Hong Kong has undergone a renovation that is to be commended. The rooms, while on the small side, have been beautifully and completely redone. And the food is as good as any 5-star hotel in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality All Round!!!”
Reviews.Author: popmonkey
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights in Hong Kong and stayed at the Sherton.What a great choice ,everything was excellent!!From the location(seconds from the MTR station,next to the Peninsula Hotel and not to mention the Harbour View) to the service ,to the beautiful rooms with great glass bathrooms(you can sit in the bath looking out across your room through the windows at the Hong Kong skyline),i cant fault this one bit.We upgraded to the Harbour view room which i must say is a MUST.Another plus is the Sky lounge at the top of the hotel,you get the very best views of the Harbour at night while sipping away on your Cocktails.Didnt want to go home!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: enr12
Reviews.Content: This is hotel is well maintained, and the spacious lobby is well furnished, and a delightful place to visit. The rooms were a little on the small side, but very well furnished with the latest high tech look, including 110 outlets. The Wifi worked well in the room, but unlike the Hyatt in Tokyo which was free, this one ran close to $15 US a day. Service was very good, with bottles of water place in your rooms each day. It was within two blocks of the MRT Station, and about 3 long blocks to the Star Ferry. The Swimming Pool and health club are right on the top of the hotel, and gives a great view. The water was as little cold for being out doors in the wind.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive”
Reviews.Author: JCW
Reviews.Content: Occasionally, Sheraton manages to get it absolutely right with one of their large hotels. And this is a case in point - doing full justice to its excellent location and superb harbour views. Service is slick and professional. My room (upgraded to a suite as a platinum guest) was modern, very nicely designed, and extremely comfortable. There's a good range of restaurants (including a superlative branch of Morton's on the 4th floor, albeit operating totally independently). The platinum guest lounge on the 9th floor is a nice touch. And it somehow manages to overcome its size (and inevitable slight impersonal nature) to feel friendly and welcoming. I'd certainly recommend it for the business traveller.
